4

    
    

    
// Help:

    


    

    
5

    
    

    
// - Read FAQ at http://dearimgui.org/faq

    


    

    
6

    
    

    
// - Newcomers, read 'Programmer guide' in imgui.cpp for notes on how to setup Dear ImGui in your codebase.

    


    

    
7

    
    

    
// - Call and read ImGui::ShowDemoWindow() in imgui_demo.cpp. All applications in examples/ are doing that.

    


    

    
8

    
    

    
// Read imgui.cpp for more details, documentation and comments.

    


    

    
9

    
    

    
// Get the latest version at https://github.com/ocornut/imgui

    


    

    
10

    
    

    

    


    

    
11

    
    

    
// -------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
12

    
    

    
// PLEASE DO NOT REMOVE THIS FILE FROM YOUR PROJECT!

    


    

    
13

    
    

    
// -------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
14

    
    

    
// Message to the person tempted to delete this file when integrating Dear ImGui into their codebase:

    


    

    
15

    
    

    
// Think again! It is the most useful reference code that you and other coders will want to refer to and call.

    


    

    
16

    
    

    
// Have the ImGui::ShowDemoWindow() function wired in an always-available debug menu of your game/app!

    


    

    
17

    
    

    
// Also include Metrics! ItemPicker! DebugLog! and other debug features.

    


    

    
18

    
    

    
// Removing this file from your project is hindering access to documentation for everyone in your team,

    


    

    
19

    
    

    
// likely leading you to poorer usage of the library.

    


    

    
20

    
    

    
// Everything in this file will be stripped out by the linker if you don't call ImGui::ShowDemoWindow().

    


    

    
21

    
    

    
// If you want to link core Dear ImGui in your shipped builds but want a thorough guarantee that the demo will not be

    


    

    
22

    
    

    
// linked, you can setup your imconfig.h with #define IMGUI_DISABLE_DEMO_WINDOWS and those functions will be empty.

    


    

    
23

    
    

    
// In another situation, whenever you have Dear ImGui available you probably want this to be available for reference.

    


    

    
24

    
    

    
// Thank you,

    


    

    
25

    
    

    
// -Your beloved friend, imgui_demo.cpp (which you won't delete)

    


    

    
26

    
    

    

    


    

    
27

    
    

    
// Message to beginner C/C++ programmers about the meaning of the 'static' keyword:

    


    

    
28

    
    

    
// In this demo code, we frequently use 'static' variables inside functions. A static variable persists across calls,

    


    

    
29

    
    

    
// so it is essentially like a global variable but declared inside the scope of the function. We do this as a way to

    


    

    
30

    
    

    
// gather code and data in the same place, to make the demo source code faster to read, faster to write, and smaller

    


    

    
31

    
    

    
// in size. It also happens to be a convenient way of storing simple UI related information as long as your function

    


    

    
32

    
    

    
// doesn't need to be reentrant or used in multiple threads. This might be a pattern you will want to use in your code,

    


    

    
33

    
    

    
// but most of the real data you would be editing is likely going to be stored outside your functions.

    


    

    
34

    
    

    

    


    

    
35

    
    

    
// The Demo code in this file is designed to be easy to copy-and-paste into your application!

    


    

    
36

    
    

    
// Because of this:

    


    

    
37

    
    

    
// - We never omit the ImGui:: prefix when calling functions, even though most code here is in the same namespace.

    


    

    
38

    
    

    
// - We try to declare static variables in the local scope, as close as possible to the code using them.

    


    

    
39

    
    

    
// - We never use any of the helpers/facilities used internally by Dear ImGui, unless available in the public API.

    


    

    
40

    
    

    
// - We never use maths operators on ImVec2/ImVec4. For our other sources files we use them, and they are provided

    


    

    
41

    
    

    
//   by imgui_internal.h using the IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS define. For your own sources file they are optional

    


    

    
42

    
    

    
//   and require you either enable those, either provide your own via IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA in imconfig.h.

    


    

    
43

    
    

    
//   Because we can't assume anything about your support of maths operators, we cannot use them in imgui_demo.cpp.

    


    

    
44

    
    

    

    


    

    
45

    
    

    
// Navigating this file:

    


    

    
46

    
    

    
// - In Visual Studio IDE: CTRL+comma ("Edit.GoToAll") can follow symbols in comments, whereas CTRL+F12 ("Edit.GoToImplementation") cannot.

    


    

    
47

    
    

    
// - With Visual Assist installed: ALT+G ("VAssistX.GoToImplementation") can also follow symbols in comments.

    


    

    
48

    
    

    

    


    

    
49

    
    

    
/*

104

    
    

    
#pragma warning (disable: 4996)     // 'This function or variable may be unsafe': strcpy, strdup, sprintf, vsnprintf, sscanf, fopen

    


    

    
105

    
    

    
#pragma warning (disable: 26451)    // [Static Analyzer] Arithmetic overflow : Using operator 'xxx' on a 4 byte value and then casting the result to an 8 byte value. Cast the value to the wider type before calling operator 'xxx' to avoid overflow(io.2).

    


    

    
106

    
    

    
#endif

    


    

    
107

    
    

    

    


    

    
108

    
    

    
// Clang/GCC warnings with -Weverything

    


    

    
109

    
    

    
#if defined(__clang__)

    


    

    
110

    
    

    
#if __has_warning("-Wunknown-warning-option")

    


    

    
111

    
    

    
#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunknown-warning-option"         // warning: unknown warning group 'xxx'                     // not all warnings are known by all Clang versions and they tend to be rename-happy.. so ignoring warnings triggers new warnings on some configuration. Great!

    


    

    
112

    
    

    
#endif

    


    

    
113

    
    

    
#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunknown-pragmas"                // warning: unknown warning group 'xxx'

    


    

    
114

    
    

    
#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wold-style-cast"                 // warning: use of old-style cast                           // yes, they are more terse.

    


    

    
115

    
    

    
#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wdeprecated-declarations"        // warning: 'xx' is deprecated: The POSIX name for this..   // for strdup used in demo code (so user can copy & paste the code)

    


    

    
116

    
    

    
#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wint-to-void-pointer-cast"       // warning: cast to 'void *' from smaller integer type

    


    

    
117

    
    

    
#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wformat-security"                // warning: format string is not a string literal

    


    

    
118

    
    

    
#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wexit-time-destructors"          // warning: declaration requires an exit-time destructor    // exit-time destruction order is undefined. if MemFree() leads to users code that has been disabled before exit it might cause problems. ImGui coding style welcomes static/globals.

    


    

    
119

    
    

    
#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunused-macros"                  // warning: macro is not used                               // we define snprintf/vsnprintf on Windows so they are available, but not always used.

    


    

    
120

    
    

    
#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wzero-as-null-pointer-constant"  // warning: zero as null pointer constant                   // some standard header variations use #define NULL 0

    


    

    
121

    
    

    
#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wdouble-promotion"               // warning: implicit conversion from 'float' to 'double' when passing argument to function  // using printf() is a misery with this as C++ va_arg ellipsis changes float to double.

    


    

    
122

    
    

    
#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wreserved-id-macro"              // warning: macro name is a reserved identifier

    


    

    
123

    
    

    
#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wimplicit-int-float-conversion"  // warning: implicit conversion from 'xxx' to 'float' may lose precision

    


    

    
124

    
    

    
#elif defined(__GNUC__)

    


    

    
125

    
    

    
#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wpragmas"                  // warning: unknown option after '#pragma GCC diagnostic' kind

    


    

    
126

    
    

    
#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wint-to-pointer-cast"      // warning: cast to pointer from integer of different size

    


    

    
127

    
    

    
#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wformat-security"          // warning: format string is not a string literal (potentially insecure)

    


    

    
128

    
    

    
#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wdouble-promotion"         // warning: implicit conversion from 'float' to 'double' when passing argument to function

    


    

    
129

    
    

    
#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wconversion"               // warning: conversion to 'xxxx' from 'xxxx' may alter its value

    


    

    
130

    
    

    
#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wmisleading-indentation"   // [__GNUC__ >= 6] warning: this 'if' clause does not guard this statement      // GCC 6.0+ only. See #883 on GitHub.

    


    

    
131

    
    

    
#endif

    


    

    
132

// Helpers

142

#endif

    


    

    
144

    
    

    
#if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(vsnprintf)

    


    

    
145

146

    
    

    
#endif

    


    

    
147

    
    

    

    


    

    
148

    
    

    
// Format specifiers, printing 64-bit hasn't been decently standardized...

    


    

    
149

    
    

    
// In a real application you should be using PRId64 and PRIu64 from <inttypes.h> (non-windows) and on Windows define them yourself.

    


    

    
150

    
    

    
#ifdef _MSC_VER

    


    

    
151

    
    

    
#define IM_PRId64   "I64d"

    


    

    
152

    
    

    
#define IM_PRIu64   "I64u"

    


    

    
153

    
    

    
#else

    


    

    
154

    
    

    
#define IM_PRId64   "lld"

    


    

    
155

    
    

    
#define IM_PRIu64   "llu"

    


    

    
156

    
    

    
#endif

    


    

    
157

    
    

    

    


    

    
158

    
    

    
// Helpers macros

    


    

    
159

    
    

    
// We normally try to not use many helpers in imgui_demo.cpp in order to make code easier to copy and paste,

    


    

    
160

    
    

    
// but making an exception here as those are largely simplifying code...

    


    

    
161

    
    

    
// In other imgui sources we can use nicer internal functions from imgui_internal.h (ImMin/ImMax) but not in the demo.

    


    

    
162

    
    

    
#define IM_MIN(A, B)            (((A) < (B)) ? (A) : (B))

    


    

    
163

    
    

    
#define IM_MAX(A, B)            (((A) >= (B)) ? (A) : (B))

    


    

    
164

    
    

    
#define IM_CLAMP(V, MN, MX)     ((V) < (MN) ? (MN) : (V) > (MX) ? (MX) : (V))

    


    

    
165

    
    

    

    


    

    
166

    
    

    
// Enforce cdecl calling convention for functions called by the standard library, in case compilation settings changed the default to e.g. __vectorcall

    


    

    
167

    
    

    
#ifndef IMGUI_CDECL

    


    

    
168

    
    

    
#ifdef _MSC_VER

    


    

    
169

    
    

    
#define IMGUI_CDECL __cdecl

    


    

    
170

    
    

    
#else

    


    

    
171

    
    

    
#define IMGUI_CDECL

    


    

    
172

    
    

    
#endif

    


    

    
173

    
    

    
#endif

    


    

    
174

// We split the contents of the big ShowDemoWindow() function into smaller functions

    


    

    
199

    
    

    
// (because the link time of very large functions grow non-linearly)

    


    

    
200

    
    

    
static void ShowDemoWindowWidgets();

    


    

    
201

    
    

    
static void ShowDemoWindowLayout();

// [SECTION] Helpers

    


    

    
209

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
210

    
    

    

    


    

    
211

    
    

    
// Helper to display a little (?) mark which shows a tooltip when hovered.

    


    

    
212

    
    

    
// In your own code you may want to display an actual icon if you are using a merged icon fonts (see docs/FONTS.md)

    


    

    
213

    
    

    
static void HelpMarker(const char* desc)

    


    

    
214

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
215

    
    

    
    ImGui::TextDisabled("(?)");

    


    

    
216

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort))

    


    

    
217

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
218

    
    

    
        ImGui::BeginTooltip();

    


    

    
219

    
    

    
        ImGui::PushTextWrapPos(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 35.0f);

    


    

    
220

    
    

    
        ImGui::TextUnformatted(desc);

    


    

    
221

    
    

    
        ImGui::PopTextWrapPos();

    


    

    
222

    
    

    
        ImGui::EndTooltip();

    


    

    
223

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
224

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
225

    
    

    

    


    

    
226

    
    

    
static void ShowDockingDisabledMessage()

    


    

    
227

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
228

    
    

    
    ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();

    


    

    
229

    
    

    
    ImGui::Text("ERROR: Docking is not enabled! See Demo > Configuration.");

    


    

    
230

    
    

    
    ImGui::Text("Set io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable in your code, or ");

    


    

    
231

    
    

    
    ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, 0.0f);

    


    

    
232

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::SmallButton("click here"))

    


    

    
233

    
    

    
        io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable;

    


    

    
234

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
235

    
    

    

    


    

    
236

    
    

    
// Helper to wire demo markers located in code to an interactive browser

    


    

    
237

    
    

    
typedef void (*ImGuiDemoMarkerCallback)(const char* file, int line, const char* section, void* user_data);

    


    

    
238

    
    

    
extern ImGuiDemoMarkerCallback      GImGuiDemoMarkerCallback;

    


    

    
239

    
    

    
extern void*                        GImGuiDemoMarkerCallbackUserData;

    


    

    
240

    
    

    
ImGuiDemoMarkerCallback             GImGuiDemoMarkerCallback = NULL;

    


    

    
241

    
    

    
void*                               GImGuiDemoMarkerCallbackUserData = NULL;

    


    

    
242

    
    

    
#define IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER(section)  do { if (GImGuiDemoMarkerCallback != NULL) GImGuiDemoMarkerCallback(__FILE__, __LINE__, section, GImGuiDemoMarkerCallbackUserData); } while (0)

    


    

    
243

    
    

    

    


    

    
244

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
245

    
    

    
// [SECTION] Demo Window / ShowDemoWindow()

    


    

    
246

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
247

    
    

    
// - ShowDemoWindow()

    


    

    
248

    
    

    
// - ShowDemoWindowWidgets()

    


    

    
249

    
    

    
// - ShowDemoWindowLayout()

    


    

    
250

    
    

    
// - ShowDemoWindowPopups()

    


    

    
251

    
    

    
// - ShowDemoWindowTables()

    


    

    
252

    
    

    
// - ShowDemoWindowColumns()

    


    

    
253

    
    

    
// - ShowDemoWindowInputs()

    


    

    
254

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
255

    
    

    

    


    

    
256

    
    

    
// Demonstrate most Dear ImGui features (this is big function!)

    


    

    
257

    
    

    
// You may execute this function to experiment with the UI and understand what it does.

    


    

    
258

    
    

    
// You may then search for keywords in the code when you are interested by a specific feature.

    


    

    
259

    
    

    
void ImGui::ShowDemoWindow(bool* p_open)

    


    

    
260

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
261

    
    

    
    // Exceptionally add an extra assert here for people confused about initial Dear ImGui setup

    


    

    
262

    
    

    
    // Most functions would normally just crash if the context is missing.

    


    

    
263

    
    

    
    IM_ASSERT(ImGui::GetCurrentContext() != NULL && "Missing dear imgui context. Refer to examples app!");

    


    

    
264

    
    

    

    


    

    
265

    
    

    
    // Examples Apps (accessible from the "Examples" menu)

    


    

    
266

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_main_menu_bar = false;

    


    

    
267

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_dockspace = false;

    


    

    
268

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_documents = false;

    


    

    
269

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_console = false;

    


    

    
270

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_log = false;

    


    

    
271

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_layout = false;

    


    

    
272

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_property_editor = false;

    


    

    
273

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_long_text = false;

    


    

    
274

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_auto_resize = false;

    


    

    
275

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_constrained_resize = false;

    


    

    
276

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_simple_overlay = false;

    


    

    
277

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_fullscreen = false;

    


    

    
278

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_window_titles = false;

    


    

    
279

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_custom_rendering = false;

    


    

    
280

    
    

    

    


    

    
281

    
    

    
    if (show_app_main_menu_bar)       ShowExampleAppMainMenuBar();

    


    

    
282

    
    

    
    if (show_app_dockspace)           ShowExampleAppDockSpace(&show_app_dockspace);     // Process the Docking app first, as explicit DockSpace() nodes needs to be submitted early (read comments near the DockSpace function)

    


    

    
283

    
    

    
    if (show_app_documents)           ShowExampleAppDocuments(&show_app_documents);     // Process the Document app next, as it may also use a DockSpace()

    


    

    
284

    
    

    
    if (show_app_console)             ShowExampleAppConsole(&show_app_console);

    


    

    
285

    
    

    
    if (show_app_log)                 ShowExampleAppLog(&show_app_log);

    


    

    
286

    
    

    
    if (show_app_layout)              ShowExampleAppLayout(&show_app_layout);

    


    

    
287

    
    

    
    if (show_app_property_editor)     ShowExampleAppPropertyEditor(&show_app_property_editor);

    


    

    
288

    
    

    
    if (show_app_long_text)           ShowExampleAppLongText(&show_app_long_text);

    


    

    
289

    
    

    
    if (show_app_auto_resize)         ShowExampleAppAutoResize(&show_app_auto_resize);

    


    

    
290

    
    

    
    if (show_app_constrained_resize)  ShowExampleAppConstrainedResize(&show_app_constrained_resize);

    


    

    
291

    
    

    
    if (show_app_simple_overlay)      ShowExampleAppSimpleOverlay(&show_app_simple_overlay);

    


    

    
292

    
    

    
    if (show_app_fullscreen)          ShowExampleAppFullscreen(&show_app_fullscreen);

    


    

    
293

    
    

    
    if (show_app_window_titles)       ShowExampleAppWindowTitles(&show_app_window_titles);

    


    

    
294

    
    

    
    if (show_app_custom_rendering)    ShowExampleAppCustomRendering(&show_app_custom_rendering);

    


    

    
295

    
    

    

    


    

    
296

    
    

    
    // Dear ImGui Tools/Apps (accessible from the "Tools" menu)

    


    

    
297

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_metrics = false;

    


    

    
298

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_debug_log = false;

    


    

    
299

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_stack_tool = false;

    


    

    
300

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_about = false;

    


    

    
301

    
    

    
    static bool show_app_style_editor = false;

    


    

    
302

    
    

    

    


    

    
303

    
    

    
    if (show_app_metrics)

    


    

    
304

    
    

    
        ImGui::ShowMetricsWindow(&show_app_metrics);

    


    

    
305

    
    

    
    if (show_app_debug_log)

    


    

    
306

    
    

    
        ImGui::ShowDebugLogWindow(&show_app_debug_log);

    


    

    
307

    
    

    
    if (show_app_stack_tool)

    


    

    
308

    
    

    
        ImGui::ShowStackToolWindow(&show_app_stack_tool);

    


    

    
309

    
    

    
    if (show_app_about)

    


    

    
310

    
    

    
        ImGui::ShowAboutWindow(&show_app_about);

    


    

    
311

    
    

    
    if (show_app_style_editor)

    


    

    
312

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
313

    
    

    
        ImGui::Begin("Dear ImGui Style Editor", &show_app_style_editor);

    


    

    
314

    
    

    
        ImGui::ShowStyleEditor();

    


    

    
315

    
    

    
        ImGui::End();

    


    

    
316

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
317

    
    

    

    


    

    
318

    
    

    
    // Demonstrate the various window flags. Typically you would just use the default!

    


    

    
319

    
    

    
    static bool no_titlebar = false;

    


    

    
320

    
    

    
    static bool no_scrollbar = false;

    


    

    
321

    
    

    
    static bool no_menu = false;

    


    

    
322

    
    

    
    static bool no_move = false;

    


    

    
323

    
    

    
    static bool no_resize = false;

    


    

    
324

    
    

    
    static bool no_collapse = false;

    


    

    
325

    
    

    
    static bool no_close = false;

    


    

    
326

    
    

    
    static bool no_nav = false;

    


    

    
327

    
    

    
    static bool no_background = false;

    


    

    
328

    
    

    
    static bool no_bring_to_front = false;

    


    

    
329

    
    

    
    static bool no_docking = false;

    


    

    
330

    
    

    
    static bool unsaved_document = false;

    


    

    
331

    
    

    

    


    

    
332

    
    

    
    ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = 0;

    


    

    
333

    
    

    
    if (no_titlebar)        window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar;

    


    

    
334

    
    

    
    if (no_scrollbar)       window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar;

    


    

    
335

    
    

    
    if (!no_menu)           window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar;

    


    

    
336

    
    

    
    if (no_move)            window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove;

    


    

    
337

    
    

    
    if (no_resize)          window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize;

    


    

    
338

    
    

    
    if (no_collapse)        window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse;

    


    

    
339

    
    

    
    if (no_nav)             window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNav;

    


    

    
340

    
    

    
    if (no_background)      window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground;

    


    

    
341

    
    

    
    if (no_bring_to_front)  window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus;

    


    

    
342

    
    

    
    if (no_docking)         window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking;

    


    

    
343

    
    

    
    if (unsaved_document)   window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument;

    


    

    
344

    
    

    
    if (no_close)           p_open = NULL; // Don't pass our bool* to Begin

    


    

    
345

    
    

    

    


    

    
346

    
    

    
    // We specify a default position/size in case there's no data in the .ini file.

    


    

    
347

    
    

    
    // We only do it to make the demo applications a little more welcoming, but typically this isn't required.

    


    

    
348

    
    

    
    const ImGuiViewport* main_viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();

    


    

    
349

    
    

    
    ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(main_viewport->WorkPos.x + 650, main_viewport->WorkPos.y + 20), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);

    


    

    
350

    
    

    
    ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(550, 680), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);

    


    

    
351

    
    

    

    


    

    
352

    
    

    
    // Main body of the Demo window starts here.

    


    

    
353

    
    

    
    if (!ImGui::Begin("Dear ImGui Demo", p_open, window_flags))

    


    

    
354

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
355

    
    

    
        // Early out if the window is collapsed, as an optimization.

    


    

    
356

    
    

    
        ImGui::End();

    


    

    
357

    
    

    
        return;

    


    

    
358

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
359

    
    

    

    


    

    
360

    
    

    
    // Most "big" widgets share a common width settings by default. See 'Demo->Layout->Widgets Width' for details.

    


    

    
361

    
    

    
    // e.g. Use 2/3 of the space for widgets and 1/3 for labels (right align)

    


    

    
362

    
    

    
    //ImGui::PushItemWidth(-ImGui::GetWindowWidth() * 0.35f);

    


    

    
363

    
    

    
    // e.g. Leave a fixed amount of width for labels (by passing a negative value), the rest goes to widgets.

    


    

    
364

    
    

    
    ImGui::PushItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * -12);

    


    

    
365

    
    

    

    


    

    
366

    
    

    
    // Menu Bar

    


    

    
367

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())

    


    

    
368

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
369

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Menu"))

    


    

    
370

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
371

    
    

    
            IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Menu/File");

    


    

    
372

    
    

    
            ShowExampleMenuFile();

    


    

    
373

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndMenu();

    


    

    
374

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
375

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Examples"))

    


    

    
376

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
377

    
    

    
            IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Menu/Examples");

    


    

    
378

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Main menu bar", NULL, &show_app_main_menu_bar);

    


    

    
379

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Console", NULL, &show_app_console);

    


    

    
380

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Log", NULL, &show_app_log);

    


    

    
381

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Simple layout", NULL, &show_app_layout);

    


    

    
382

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Property editor", NULL, &show_app_property_editor);

    


    

    
383

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Long text display", NULL, &show_app_long_text);

    


    

    
384

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Auto-resizing window", NULL, &show_app_auto_resize);

    


    

    
385

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Constrained-resizing window", NULL, &show_app_constrained_resize);

    


    

    
386

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Simple overlay", NULL, &show_app_simple_overlay);

    


    

    
387

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Fullscreen window", NULL, &show_app_fullscreen);

    


    

    
388

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Manipulating window titles", NULL, &show_app_window_titles);

    


    

    
389

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Custom rendering", NULL, &show_app_custom_rendering);

    


    

    
390

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Dockspace", NULL, &show_app_dockspace);

    


    

    
391

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Documents", NULL, &show_app_documents);

    


    

    
392

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndMenu();

    


    

    
393

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
394

    
    

    
        //if (ImGui::MenuItem("MenuItem")) {} // You can also use MenuItem() inside a menu bar!

    


    

    
395

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Tools"))

    


    

    
396

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
397

    
    

    
            IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Menu/Tools");

    


    

    
398

    
    

    
#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS

    


    

    
399

    
    

    
            const bool has_debug_tools = true;

    


    

    
400

    
    

    
#else

    


    

    
401

    
    

    
            const bool has_debug_tools = false;

    


    

    
402

    
    

    
#endif

    


    

    
403

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Metrics/Debugger", NULL, &show_app_metrics, has_debug_tools);

    


    

    
404

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Debug Log", NULL, &show_app_debug_log, has_debug_tools);

    


    

    
405

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Stack Tool", NULL, &show_app_stack_tool, has_debug_tools);

    


    

    
406

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("Style Editor", NULL, &show_app_style_editor);

    


    

    
407

    
    

    
            ImGui::MenuItem("About Dear ImGui", NULL, &show_app_about);

    


    

    
408

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndMenu();

    


    

    
409

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
410

    
    

    
        ImGui::EndMenuBar();

    


    

    
411

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
412

    
    

    

    


    

    
413

    
    

    
    ImGui::Text("dear imgui says hello! (%s) (%d)", IMGUI_VERSION, IMGUI_VERSION_NUM);

    


    

    
414

    
    

    
    ImGui::Spacing();

    


    

    
415

    
    

    

    


    

    
416

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Help");

    


    

    
417

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Help"))

    


    

    
418

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
419

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("ABOUT THIS DEMO:");

    


    

    
420

    
    

    
        ImGui::BulletText("Sections below are demonstrating many aspects of the library.");

    


    

    
421

    
    

    
        ImGui::BulletText("The \"Examples\" menu above leads to more demo contents.");

    


    

    
422

    
    

    
        ImGui::BulletText("The \"Tools\" menu above gives access to: About Box, Style Editor,\n"

    


    

    
423

    
    

    
                          "and Metrics/Debugger (general purpose Dear ImGui debugging tool).");

    


    

    
424

    
    

    
        ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
425

    
    

    

    


    

    
426

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("PROGRAMMER GUIDE:");

    


    

    
427

    
    

    
        ImGui::BulletText("See the ShowDemoWindow() code in imgui_demo.cpp. <- you are here!");

    


    

    
428

    
    

    
        ImGui::BulletText("See comments in imgui.cpp.");

    


    

    
429

    
    

    
        ImGui::BulletText("See example applications in the examples/ folder.");

    


    

    
430

    
    

    
        ImGui::BulletText("Read the FAQ at http://www.dearimgui.org/faq/");

    


    

    
431

    
    

    
        ImGui::BulletText("Set 'io.ConfigFlags |= NavEnableKeyboard' for keyboard controls.");

    


    

    
432

    
    

    
        ImGui::BulletText("Set 'io.ConfigFlags |= NavEnableGamepad' for gamepad controls.");

    


    

    
433

    
    

    
        ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
434

    
    

    

    


    

    
435

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("USER GUIDE:");

    


    

    
436

    
    

    
        ImGui::ShowUserGuide();

    


    

    
437

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
438

    
    

    

    


    

    
439

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Configuration");

    


    

    
440

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Configuration"))

    


    

    
441

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
442

    
    

    
        ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();

    


    

    
443

    
    

    

    


    

    
444

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::TreeNode("Configuration##2"))

    


    

    
445

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
446

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.ConfigFlags: NavEnableKeyboard",    &io.ConfigFlags, ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard);

    


    

    
447

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable keyboard controls.");

    


    

    
448

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.ConfigFlags: NavEnableGamepad",     &io.ConfigFlags, ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad);

    


    

    
449

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable gamepad controls. Require backend to set io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad.\n\nRead instructions in imgui.cpp for details.");

    


    

    
450

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.ConfigFlags: NavEnableSetMousePos", &io.ConfigFlags, ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos);

    


    

    
451

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Instruct navigation to move the mouse cursor. See comment for ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos.");

    


    

    
452

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.ConfigFlags: NoMouse",              &io.ConfigFlags, ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse);

    


    

    
453

    
    

    
            if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse)

    


    

    
454

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
455

    
    

    
                // The "NoMouse" option can get us stuck with a disabled mouse! Let's provide an alternative way to fix it:

    


    

    
456

    
    

    
                if (fmodf((float)ImGui::GetTime(), 0.40f) < 0.20f)

    


    

    
457

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
458

    
    

    
                    ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
459

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Text("<<PRESS SPACE TO DISABLE>>");

    


    

    
460

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
461

    
    

    
                if (ImGui::IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Space))

    


    

    
462

    
    

    
                    io.ConfigFlags &= ~ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse;

    


    

    
463

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
464

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.ConfigFlags: NoMouseCursorChange", &io.ConfigFlags, ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouseCursorChange);

    


    

    
465

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Instruct backend to not alter mouse cursor shape and visibility.");

    


    

    
466

    
    

    

    


    

    
467

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.ConfigFlags: DockingEnable", &io.ConfigFlags, ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable);

    


    

    
468

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
469

    
    

    
            if (io.ConfigDockingWithShift)

    


    

    
470

    
    

    
                HelpMarker("Drag from window title bar or their tab to dock/undock. Hold SHIFT to enable docking.\n\nDrag from window menu button (upper-left button) to undock an entire node (all windows).");

    


    

    
471

    
    

    
            else

    


    

    
472

    
    

    
                HelpMarker("Drag from window title bar or their tab to dock/undock. Hold SHIFT to disable docking.\n\nDrag from window menu button (upper-left button) to undock an entire node (all windows).");

    


    

    
473

    
    

    
            if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable)

    


    

    
474

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
475

    
    

    
                ImGui::Indent();

    


    

    
476

    
    

    
                ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDockingNoSplit", &io.ConfigDockingNoSplit);

    


    

    
477

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Simplified docking mode: disable window splitting, so docking is limited to merging multiple windows together into tab-bars.");

    


    

    
478

    
    

    
                ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDockingWithShift", &io.ConfigDockingWithShift);

    


    

    
479

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable docking when holding Shift only (allow to drop in wider space, reduce visual noise)");

    


    

    
480

    
    

    
                ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar", &io.ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar);

    


    

    
481

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Create a docking node and tab-bar on single floating windows.");

    


    

    
482

    
    

    
                ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDockingTransparentPayload", &io.ConfigDockingTransparentPayload);

    


    

    
483

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Make window or viewport transparent when docking and only display docking boxes on the target viewport. Useful if rendering of multiple viewport cannot be synced. Best used with ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge.");

    


    

    
484

    
    

    
                ImGui::Unindent();

    


    

    
485

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
486

    
    

    

    


    

    
487

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.ConfigFlags: ViewportsEnable", &io.ConfigFlags, ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable);

    


    

    
488

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("[beta] Enable beta multi-viewports support. See ImGuiPlatformIO for details.");

    


    

    
489

    
    

    
            if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable)

    


    

    
490

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
491

    
    

    
                ImGui::Indent();

    


    

    
492

    
    

    
                ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge", &io.ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge);

    


    

    
493

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Set to make all floating imgui windows always create their own viewport. Otherwise, they are merged into the main host viewports when overlapping it.");

    


    

    
494

    
    

    
                ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigViewportsNoTaskBarIcon", &io.ConfigViewportsNoTaskBarIcon);

    


    

    
495

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Toggling this at runtime is normally unsupported (most platform backends won't refresh the task bar icon state right away).");

    


    

    
496

    
    

    
                ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigViewportsNoDecoration", &io.ConfigViewportsNoDecoration);

    


    

    
497

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Toggling this at runtime is normally unsupported (most platform backends won't refresh the decoration right away).");

    


    

    
498

    
    

    
                ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigViewportsNoDefaultParent", &io.ConfigViewportsNoDefaultParent);

    


    

    
499

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Toggling this at runtime is normally unsupported (most platform backends won't refresh the parenting right away).");

    


    

    
500

    
    

    
                ImGui::Unindent();

    


    

    
501

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
502

    
    

    

    


    

    
503

    
    

    
            ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigInputTrickleEventQueue", &io.ConfigInputTrickleEventQueue);

    


    

    
504

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable input queue trickling: some types of events submitted during the same frame (e.g. button down + up) will be spread over multiple frames, improving interactions with low framerates.");

    


    

    
505

    
    

    
            ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigInputTextCursorBlink", &io.ConfigInputTextCursorBlink);

    


    

    
506

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable blinking cursor (optional as some users consider it to be distracting).");

    


    

    
507

    
    

    
            ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigInputTextEnterKeepActive", &io.ConfigInputTextEnterKeepActive);

    


    

    
508

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Pressing Enter will keep item active and select contents (single-line only).");

    


    

    
509

    
    

    
            ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDragClickToInputText", &io.ConfigDragClickToInputText);

    


    

    
510

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable turning DragXXX widgets into text input with a simple mouse click-release (without moving).");

    


    

    
511

    
    

    
            ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges", &io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges);

    


    

    
512

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable resizing of windows from their edges and from the lower-left corner.\nThis requires (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors) because it needs mouse cursor feedback.");

    


    

    
513

    
    

    
            ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly", &io.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly);

    


    

    
514

    
    

    
            ImGui::Checkbox("io.MouseDrawCursor", &io.MouseDrawCursor);

    


    

    
515

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Instruct Dear ImGui to render a mouse cursor itself. Note that a mouse cursor rendered via your application GPU rendering path will feel more laggy than hardware cursor, but will be more in sync with your other visuals.\n\nSome desktop applications may use both kinds of cursors (e.g. enable software cursor only when resizing/dragging something).");

    


    

    
516

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Also see Style->Rendering for rendering options.");

    


    

    
517

    
    

    
            ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
518

    
    

    
            ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
519

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
520

    
    

    

    


    

    
521

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Configuration/Backend Flags");

    


    

    
522

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::TreeNode("Backend Flags"))

    


    

    
523

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
524

    
    

    
            HelpMarker(

    


    

    
525

    
    

    
                "Those flags are set by the backends (imgui_impl_xxx files) to specify their capabilities.\n"

    


    

    
526

    
    

    
                "Here we expose them as read-only fields to avoid breaking interactions with your backend.");

    


    

    
527

    
    

    

    


    

    
528

    
    

    
            // Make a local copy to avoid modifying actual backend flags.

    


    

    
529

    
    

    
            // FIXME: We don't use BeginDisabled() to keep label bright, maybe we need a BeginReadonly() equivalent..

    


    

    
530

    
    

    
            ImGuiBackendFlags backend_flags = io.BackendFlags;

    


    

    
531

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: HasGamepad",             &backend_flags, ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad);

    


    

    
532

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: HasMouseCursors",        &backend_flags, ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors);

    


    

    
533

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: HasSetMousePos",         &backend_flags, ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos);

    


    

    
534

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: PlatformHasViewports",   &backend_flags, ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports);

    


    

    
535

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: HasMouseHoveredViewport",&backend_flags, ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport);

    


    

    
536

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: RendererHasVtxOffset",   &backend_flags, ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset);

    


    

    
537

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: RendererHasViewports",   &backend_flags, ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports);

    


    

    
538

    
    

    
            ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
539

    
    

    
            ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
540

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
541

    
    

    

    


    

    
542

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Configuration/Style");

    


    

    
543

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::TreeNode("Style"))

    


    

    
544

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
545

    
    

    
            HelpMarker("The same contents can be accessed in 'Tools->Style Editor' or by calling the ShowStyleEditor() function.");

    


    

    
546

    
    

    
            ImGui::ShowStyleEditor();

    


    

    
547

    
    

    
            ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
548

    
    

    
            ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
549

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
550

    
    

    

    


    

    
551

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Configuration/Capture, Logging");

    


    

    
552

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::TreeNode("Capture/Logging"))

    


    

    
553

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
554

    
    

    
            HelpMarker(

    


    

    
555

    
    

    
                "The logging API redirects all text output so you can easily capture the content of "

    


    

    
556

    
    

    
                "a window or a block. Tree nodes can be automatically expanded.\n"

    


    

    
557

    
    

    
                "Try opening any of the contents below in this window and then click one of the \"Log To\" button.");

    


    

    
558

    
    

    
            ImGui::LogButtons();

    


    

    
559

    
    

    

    


    

    
560

    
    

    
            HelpMarker("You can also call ImGui::LogText() to output directly to the log without a visual output.");

    


    

    
561

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::Button("Copy \"Hello, world!\" to clipboard"))

    


    

    
562

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
563

    
    

    
                ImGui::LogToClipboard();

    


    

    
564

    
    

    
                ImGui::LogText("Hello, world!");

    


    

    
565

    
    

    
                ImGui::LogFinish();

    


    

    
566

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
567

    
    

    
            ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
568

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
569

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
570

    
    

    

    


    

    
571

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Window options");

    


    

    
572

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Window options"))

    


    

    
573

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
574

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("split", 3))

    


    

    
575

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
576

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No titlebar", &no_titlebar);

    


    

    
577

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No scrollbar", &no_scrollbar);

    


    

    
578

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No menu", &no_menu);

    


    

    
579

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No move", &no_move);

    


    

    
580

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No resize", &no_resize);

    


    

    
581

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No collapse", &no_collapse);

    


    

    
582

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No close", &no_close);

    


    

    
583

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No nav", &no_nav);

    


    

    
584

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No background", &no_background);

    


    

    
585

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No bring to front", &no_bring_to_front);

    


    

    
586

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No docking", &no_docking);

    


    

    
587

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("Unsaved document", &unsaved_document);

    


    

    
588

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
589

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
590

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
591

    
    

    

    


    

    
592

    
    

    
    // All demo contents

    


    

    
593

    
    

    
    ShowDemoWindowWidgets();

    


    

    
594

    
    

    
    ShowDemoWindowLayout();

    


    

    
595

    
    

    
    ShowDemoWindowPopups();

    


    

    
596

    
    

    
    ShowDemoWindowTables();

    


    

    
597

    
    

    
    ShowDemoWindowInputs();

    


    

    
598

    
    

    

    


    

    
599

    
    

    
    // End of ShowDemoWindow()

    


    

    
600

    
    

    
    ImGui::PopItemWidth();

    


    

    
601

    
    

    
    ImGui::End();

    


    

    
602

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
603

    
    

    

    


    

    
604

    
    

    
static void ShowDemoWindowWidgets()

    


    

    
605

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
606

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets");

    


    

    
607

    
    

    
    if (!ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Widgets"))

    


    

    
608

    
    

    
        return;

    


    

    
609

    
    

    

    


    

    
610

    
    

    
    static bool disable_all = false; // The Checkbox for that is inside the "Disabled" section at the bottom

    


    

    
611

    
    

    
    if (disable_all)

    


    

    
612

    
    

    
        ImGui::BeginDisabled();

    


    

    
613

    
    

    

    


    

    
614

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic");

    


    

    
615

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Basic"))

    


    

    
616

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
617

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/Button");

    


    

    
618

    
    

    
        static int clicked = 0;

    


    

    
619

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::Button("Button"))

    


    

    
620

    
    

    
            clicked++;

    


    

    
621

    
    

    
        if (clicked & 1)

    


    

    
622

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
623

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
624

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Thanks for clicking me!");

    


    

    
625

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
626

    
    

    

    


    

    
627

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/Checkbox");

    


    

    
628

    
    

    
        static bool check = true;

    


    

    
629

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("checkbox", &check);

    


    

    
630

    
    

    

    


    

    
631

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/RadioButton");

    


    

    
632

    
    

    
        static int e = 0;

    


    

    
633

    
    

    
        ImGui::RadioButton("radio a", &e, 0); ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
634

    
    

    
        ImGui::RadioButton("radio b", &e, 1); ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
635

    
    

    
        ImGui::RadioButton("radio c", &e, 2);

    


    

    
636

    
    

    

    


    

    
637

    
    

    
        // Color buttons, demonstrate using PushID() to add unique identifier in the ID stack, and changing style.

    


    

    
638

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/Buttons (Colored)");

    


    

    
639

    
    

    
        for (int i = 0; i < 7; i++)

    


    

    
640

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
641

    
    

    
            if (i > 0)

    


    

    
642

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
643

    
    

    
            ImGui::PushID(i);

    


    

    
644

    
    

    
            ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Button, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(i / 7.0f, 0.6f, 0.6f));

    


    

    
645

    
    

    
            ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(i / 7.0f, 0.7f, 0.7f));

    


    

    
646

    
    

    
            ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ButtonActive, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(i / 7.0f, 0.8f, 0.8f));

    


    

    
647

    
    

    
            ImGui::Button("Click");

    


    

    
648

    
    

    
            ImGui::PopStyleColor(3);

    


    

    
649

    
    

    
            ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
650

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
651

    
    

    

    


    

    
652

    
    

    
        // Use AlignTextToFramePadding() to align text baseline to the baseline of framed widgets elements

    


    

    
653

    
    

    
        // (otherwise a Text+SameLine+Button sequence will have the text a little too high by default!)

    


    

    
654

    
    

    
        // See 'Demo->Layout->Text Baseline Alignment' for details.

    


    

    
655

    
    

    
        ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();

    


    

    
656

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Hold to repeat:");

    


    

    
657

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
658

    
    

    

    


    

    
659

    
    

    
        // Arrow buttons with Repeater

    


    

    
660

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/Buttons (Repeating)");

    


    

    
661

    
    

    
        static int counter = 0;

    


    

    
662

    
    

    
        float spacing = ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x;

    


    

    
663

    
    

    
        ImGui::PushButtonRepeat(true);

    


    

    
664

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::ArrowButton("##left", ImGuiDir_Left)) { counter--; }

    


    

    
665

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing);

    


    

    
666

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::ArrowButton("##right", ImGuiDir_Right)) { counter++; }

    


    

    
667

    
    

    
        ImGui::PopButtonRepeat();

    


    

    
668

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
669

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("%d", counter);

    


    

    
670

    
    

    

    


    

    
671

    
    

    
        ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
672

    
    

    
        ImGui::LabelText("label", "Value");

    


    

    
673

    
    

    

    


    

    
674

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
675

    
    

    
            // Using the _simplified_ one-liner Combo() api here

    


    

    
676

    
    

    
            // See "Combo" section for examples of how to use the more flexible BeginCombo()/EndCombo() api.

    


    

    
677

    
    

    
            IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/Combo");

    


    

    
678

    
    

    
            const char* items[] = { "AAAA", "BBBB", "CCCC", "DDDD", "EEEE", "FFFF", "GGGG", "HHHH", "IIIIIII", "JJJJ", "KKKKKKK" };

    


    

    
679

    
    

    
            static int item_current = 0;

    


    

    
680

    
    

    
            ImGui::Combo("combo", &item_current, items, IM_ARRAYSIZE(items));

    


    

    
681

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(

    


    

    
682

    
    

    
                "Using the simplified one-liner Combo API here.\nRefer to the \"Combo\" section below for an explanation of how to use the more flexible and general BeginCombo/EndCombo API.");

    


    

    
683

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
684

    
    

    

    


    

    
685

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
686

    
    

    
            // To wire InputText() with std::string or any other custom string type,

    


    

    
687

    
    

    
            // see the "Text Input > Resize Callback" section of this demo, and the misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h file.

    


    

    
688

    
    

    
            IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/InputText");

    


    

    
689

    
    

    
            static char str0[128] = "Hello, world!";

    


    

    
690

    
    

    
            ImGui::InputText("input text", str0, IM_ARRAYSIZE(str0));

    


    

    
691

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(

    


    

    
692

    
    

    
                "USER:\n"

    


    

    
693

    
    

    
                "Hold SHIFT or use mouse to select text.\n"

    


    

    
694

    
    

    
                "CTRL+Left/Right to word jump.\n"

    


    

    
695

    
    

    
                "CTRL+A or Double-Click to select all.\n"

    


    

    
696

    
    

    
                "CTRL+X,CTRL+C,CTRL+V clipboard.\n"

    


    

    
697

    
    

    
                "CTRL+Z,CTRL+Y undo/redo.\n"

    


    

    
698

    
    

    
                "ESCAPE to revert.\n\n"

    


    

    
699

    
    

    
                "PROGRAMMER:\n"

    


    

    
700

    
    

    
                "You can use the ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize facility if you need to wire InputText() "

    


    

    
701

    
    

    
                "to a dynamic string type. See misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h for an example (this is not demonstrated "

    


    

    
702

    
    

    
                "in imgui_demo.cpp).");

    


    

    
703

    
    

    

    


    

    
704

    
    

    
            static char str1[128] = "";

    


    

    
705

    
    

    
            ImGui::InputTextWithHint("input text (w/ hint)", "enter text here", str1, IM_ARRAYSIZE(str1));

    


    

    
706

    
    

    

    


    

    
707

    
    

    
            IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/InputInt, InputFloat");

    


    

    
708

    
    

    
            static int i0 = 123;

    


    

    
709

    
    

    
            ImGui::InputInt("input int", &i0);

    


    

    
710

    
    

    

    


    

    
711

    
    

    
            static float f0 = 0.001f;

    


    

    
712

    
    

    
            ImGui::InputFloat("input float", &f0, 0.01f, 1.0f, "%.3f");

    


    

    
713

    
    

    

    


    

    
714

    
    

    
            static double d0 = 999999.00000001;

    


    

    
715

    
    

    
            ImGui::InputDouble("input double", &d0, 0.01f, 1.0f, "%.8f");

    


    

    
716

    
    

    

    


    

    
717

    
    

    
            static float f1 = 1.e10f;

    


    

    
718

    
    

    
            ImGui::InputFloat("input scientific", &f1, 0.0f, 0.0f, "%e");

    


    

    
719

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(

    


    

    
720

    
    

    
                "You can input value using the scientific notation,\n"

    


    

    
721

    
    

    
                "  e.g. \"1e+8\" becomes \"100000000\".");

    


    

    
722

    
    

    

    


    

    
723

    
    

    
            static float vec4a[4] = { 0.10f, 0.20f, 0.30f, 0.44f };

    


    

    
724

    
    

    
            ImGui::InputFloat3("input float3", vec4a);

    


    

    
725

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
726

    
    

    

    


    

    
727

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
728

    
    

    
            IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/DragInt, DragFloat");

    


    

    
729

    
    

    
            static int i1 = 50, i2 = 42;

    


    

    
730

    
    

    
            ImGui::DragInt("drag int", &i1, 1);

    


    

    
731

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(

    


    

    
732

    
    

    
                "Click and drag to edit value.\n"

    


    

    
733

    
    

    
                "Hold SHIFT/ALT for faster/slower edit.\n"

    


    

    
734

    
    

    
                "Double-click or CTRL+click to input value.");

    


    

    
735

    
    

    

    


    

    
736

    
    

    
            ImGui::DragInt("drag int 0..100", &i2, 1, 0, 100, "%d%%", ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);

    


    

    
737

    
    

    

    


    

    
738

    
    

    
            static float f1 = 1.00f, f2 = 0.0067f;

    


    

    
739

    
    

    
            ImGui::DragFloat("drag float", &f1, 0.005f);

    


    

    
740

    
    

    
            ImGui::DragFloat("drag small float", &f2, 0.0001f, 0.0f, 0.0f, "%.06f ns");

    


    

    
741

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
742

    
    

    

    


    

    
743

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
744

    
    

    
            IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/SliderInt, SliderFloat");

    


    

    
745

    
    

    
            static int i1 = 0;

    


    

    
746

    
    

    
            ImGui::SliderInt("slider int", &i1, -1, 3);

    


    

    
747

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("CTRL+click to input value.");

    


    

    
748

    
    

    

    


    

    
749

    
    

    
            static float f1 = 0.123f, f2 = 0.0f;

    


    

    
750

    
    

    
            ImGui::SliderFloat("slider float", &f1, 0.0f, 1.0f, "ratio = %.3f");

    


    

    
751

    
    

    
            ImGui::SliderFloat("slider float (log)", &f2, -10.0f, 10.0f, "%.4f", ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic);

    


    

    
752

    
    

    

    


    

    
753

    
    

    
            IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/SliderAngle");

    


    

    
754

    
    

    
            static float angle = 0.0f;

    


    

    
755

    
    

    
            ImGui::SliderAngle("slider angle", &angle);

    


    

    
756

    
    

    

    


    

    
757

    
    

    
            // Using the format string to display a name instead of an integer.

    


    

    
758

    
    

    
            // Here we completely omit '%d' from the format string, so it'll only display a name.

    


    

    
759

    
    

    
            // This technique can also be used with DragInt().

    


    

    
760

    
    

    
            IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/Slider (enum)");

    


    

    
761

    
    

    
            enum Element { Element_Fire, Element_Earth, Element_Air, Element_Water, Element_COUNT };

    


    

    
762

    
    

    
            static int elem = Element_Fire;

    


    

    
763

    
    

    
            const char* elems_names[Element_COUNT] = { "Fire", "Earth", "Air", "Water" };

    


    

    
764

    
    

    
            const char* elem_name = (elem >= 0 && elem < Element_COUNT) ? elems_names[elem] : "Unknown";

    


    

    
765

    
    

    
            ImGui::SliderInt("slider enum", &elem, 0, Element_COUNT - 1, elem_name);

    


    

    
766

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Using the format string parameter to display a name instead of the underlying integer.");

    


    

    
767

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
768

    
    

    

    


    

    
769

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
770

    
    

    
            IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/ColorEdit3, ColorEdit4");

    


    

    
771

    
    

    
            static float col1[3] = { 1.0f, 0.0f, 0.2f };

    


    

    
772

    
    

    
            static float col2[4] = { 0.4f, 0.7f, 0.0f, 0.5f };

    


    

    
773

    
    

    
            ImGui::ColorEdit3("color 1", col1);

    


    

    
774

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(

    


    

    
775

    
    

    
                "Click on the color square to open a color picker.\n"

    


    

    
776

    
    

    
                "Click and hold to use drag and drop.\n"

    


    

    
777

    
    

    
                "Right-click on the color square to show options.\n"

    


    

    
778

    
    

    
                "CTRL+click on individual component to input value.\n");

    


    

    
779

    
    

    

    


    

    
780

    
    

    
            ImGui::ColorEdit4("color 2", col2);

    


    

    
781

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
782

    
    

    

    


    

    
783

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
784

    
    

    
            // Using the _simplified_ one-liner ListBox() api here

    


    

    
785

    
    

    
            // See "List boxes" section for examples of how to use the more flexible BeginListBox()/EndListBox() api.

    


    

    
786

    
    

    
            IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/ListBox");

    


    

    
787

    
    

    
            const char* items[] = { "Apple", "Banana", "Cherry", "Kiwi", "Mango", "Orange", "Pineapple", "Strawberry", "Watermelon" };

    


    

    
788

    
    

    
            static int item_current = 1;

    


    

    
789

    
    

    
            ImGui::ListBox("listbox", &item_current, items, IM_ARRAYSIZE(items), 4);

    


    

    
790

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(

    


    

    
791

    
    

    
                "Using the simplified one-liner ListBox API here.\nRefer to the \"List boxes\" section below for an explanation of how to use the more flexible and general BeginListBox/EndListBox API.");

    


    

    
792

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
793

    
    

    

    


    

    
794

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
795

    
    

    
            // Tooltips

    


    

    
796

    
    

    
            IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/Tooltips");

    


    

    
797

    
    

    
            ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();

    


    

    
798

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Tooltips:");

    


    

    
799

    
    

    

    


    

    
800

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
801

    
    

    
            ImGui::Button("Button");

    


    

    
802

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())

    


    

    
803

    
    

    
                ImGui::SetTooltip("I am a tooltip");

    


    

    
804

    
    

    

    


    

    
805

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
806

    
    

    
            ImGui::Button("Fancy");

    


    

    
807

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())

    


    

    
808

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
809

    
    

    
                ImGui::BeginTooltip();

    


    

    
810

    
    

    
                ImGui::Text("I am a fancy tooltip");

    


    

    
811

    
    

    
                static float arr[] = { 0.6f, 0.1f, 1.0f, 0.5f, 0.92f, 0.1f, 0.2f };

    


    

    
812

    
    

    
                ImGui::PlotLines("Curve", arr, IM_ARRAYSIZE(arr));

    


    

    
813

    
    

    
                ImGui::Text("Sin(time) = %f", sinf((float)ImGui::GetTime()));

    


    

    
814

    
    

    
                ImGui::EndTooltip();

    


    

    
815

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
816

    
    

    

    


    

    
817

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
818

    
    

    
            ImGui::Button("Delayed");

    


    

    
819

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNormal)) // Delay best used on items that highlight on hover, so this not a great example!

    


    

    
820

    
    

    
                ImGui::SetTooltip("I am a tooltip with a delay.");

    


    

    
821

    
    

    

    


    

    
822

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
823

    
    

    
            HelpMarker(

    


    

    
824

    
    

    
                "Tooltip are created by using the IsItemHovered() function over any kind of item.");

    


    

    
825

    
    

    

    


    

    
826

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
827

    
    

    

    


    

    
828

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
829

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
830

    
    

    

    


    

    
831

    
    

    
    // Testing ImGuiOnceUponAFrame helper.

    


    

    
832

    
    

    
    //static ImGuiOnceUponAFrame once;

    


    

    
833

    
    

    
    //for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)

    


    

    
834

    
    

    
    //    if (once)

    


    

    
835

    
    

    
    //        ImGui::Text("This will be displayed only once.");

    


    

    
836

    
    

    

    


    

    
837

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Trees");

    


    

    
838

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Trees"))

    


    

    
839

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
840

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Trees/Basic trees");

    


    

    
841

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::TreeNode("Basic trees"))

    


    

    
842

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
843

    
    

    
            for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)

    


    

    
844

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
845

    
    

    
                // Use SetNextItemOpen() so set the default state of a node to be open. We could

    


    

    
846

    
    

    
                // also use TreeNodeEx() with the ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen flag to achieve the same thing!

    


    

    
847

    
    

    
                if (i == 0)

    


    

    
848

    
    

    
                    ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once);

    


    

    
849

    
    

    

    


    

    
850

    
    

    
                if (ImGui::TreeNode((void*)(intptr_t)i, "Child %d", i))

    


    

    
851

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
852

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Text("blah blah");

    


    

    
853

    
    

    
                    ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
854

    
    

    
                    if (ImGui::SmallButton("button")) {}

    


    

    
855

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
856

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
857

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
858

    
    

    
            ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
859

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
860

    
    

    

    


    

    
861

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Trees/Advanced, with Selectable nodes");

    


    

    
862

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::TreeNode("Advanced, with Selectable nodes"))

    


    

    
863

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
864

    
    

    
            HelpMarker(

    


    

    
865

    
    

    
                "This is a more typical looking tree with selectable nodes.\n"

    


    

    
866

    
    

    
                "Click to select, CTRL+Click to toggle, click on arrows or double-click to open.");

    


    

    
867

    
    

    
            static ImGuiTreeNodeFlags base_flags = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth;

    


    

    
868

    
    

    
            static bool align_label_with_current_x_position = false;

    


    

    
869

    
    

    
            static bool test_drag_and_drop = false;

    


    

    
870

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow",       &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow);

    


    

    
871

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick);

    


    

    
872

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth",    &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Extend hit area to all available width instead of allowing more items to be laid out after the node.");

    


    

    
873

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth",     &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth);

    


    

    
874

    
    

    
            ImGui::Checkbox("Align label with current X position", &align_label_with_current_x_position);

    


    

    
875

    
    

    
            ImGui::Checkbox("Test tree node as drag source", &test_drag_and_drop);

    


    

    
876

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Hello!");

    


    

    
877

    
    

    
            if (align_label_with_current_x_position)

    


    

    
878

    
    

    
                ImGui::Unindent(ImGui::GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing());

    


    

    
879

    
    

    

    


    

    
880

    
    

    
            // 'selection_mask' is dumb representation of what may be user-side selection state.

    


    

    
881

    
    

    
            //  You may retain selection state inside or outside your objects in whatever format you see fit.

    


    

    
882

    
    

    
            // 'node_clicked' is temporary storage of what node we have clicked to process selection at the end

    


    

    
883

    
    

    
            /// of the loop. May be a pointer to your own node type, etc.

    


    

    
884

    
    

    
            static int selection_mask = (1 << 2);

    


    

    
885

    
    

    
            int node_clicked = -1;

    


    

    
886

    
    

    
            for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++)

    


    

    
887

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
888

    
    

    
                // Disable the default "open on single-click behavior" + set Selected flag according to our selection.

    


    

    
889

    
    

    
                // To alter selection we use IsItemClicked() && !IsItemToggledOpen(), so clicking on an arrow doesn't alter selection.

    


    

    
890

    
    

    
                ImGuiTreeNodeFlags node_flags = base_flags;

    


    

    
891

    
    

    
                const bool is_selected = (selection_mask & (1 << i)) != 0;

    


    

    
892

    
    

    
                if (is_selected)

    


    

    
893

    
    

    
                    node_flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Selected;

    


    

    
894

    
    

    
                if (i < 3)

    


    

    
895

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
896

    
    

    
                    // Items 0..2 are Tree Node

    


    

    
897

    
    

    
                    bool node_open = ImGui::TreeNodeEx((void*)(intptr_t)i, node_flags, "Selectable Node %d", i);

    


    

    
898

    
    

    
                    if (ImGui::IsItemClicked() && !ImGui::IsItemToggledOpen())

    


    

    
899

    
    

    
                        node_clicked = i;

    


    

    
900

    
    

    
                    if (test_drag_and_drop && ImGui::BeginDragDropSource())

    


    

    
901

    
    

    
                    {

    


    

    
902

    
    

    
                        ImGui::SetDragDropPayload("_TREENODE", NULL, 0);

    


    

    
903

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Text("This is a drag and drop source");

    


    

    
904

    
    

    
                        ImGui::EndDragDropSource();

    


    

    
905

    
    

    
                    }

    


    

    
906

    
    

    
                    if (node_open)

    


    

    
907

    
    

    
                    {

    


    

    
908

    
    

    
                        ImGui::BulletText("Blah blah\nBlah Blah");

    


    

    
909

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
910

    
    

    
                    }

    


    

    
911

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
912

    
    

    
                else

    


    

    
913

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
914

    
    

    
                    // Items 3..5 are Tree Leaves

    


    

    
915

    
    

    
                    // The only reason we use TreeNode at all is to allow selection of the leaf. Otherwise we can

    


    

    
916

    
    

    
                    // use BulletText() or advance the cursor by GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing() and call Text().

    


    

    
917

    
    

    
                    node_flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen; // ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet

    


    

    
918
