        ImGui::PlotLines("Lines", func, NULL, display_count, 0, NULL, -1.0f, 1.0f, ImVec2(0, 80));

    


    

    
1765

    
    

    
        ImGui::PlotHistogram("Histogram", func, NULL, display_count, 0, NULL, -1.0f, 1.0f, ImVec2(0, 80));

    


    

    
1766

    
    

    
        ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
1767

    
    

    

    


    

    
1768

    
    

    
        // Animate a simple progress bar

    


    

    
1769

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Plotting/ProgressBar");

    


    

    
1770

    
    

    
        static float progress = 0.0f, progress_dir = 1.0f;

    


    

    
1771

    
    

    
        if (animate)

    


    

    
1772

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
1773

    
    

    
            progress += progress_dir * 0.4f * ImGui::GetIO().DeltaTime;

    


    

    
1774

    
    

    
            if (progress >= +1.1f) { progress = +1.1f; progress_dir *= -1.0f; }

    


    

    
1775

    
    

    
            if (progress <= -0.1f) { progress = -0.1f; progress_dir *= -1.0f; }

    


    

    
1776

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
1777

    
    

    

    


    

    
1778

    
    

    
        // Typically we would use ImVec2(-1.0f,0.0f) or ImVec2(-FLT_MIN,0.0f) to use all available width,

    


    

    
1779

    
    

    
        // or ImVec2(width,0.0f) for a specified width. ImVec2(0.0f,0.0f) uses ItemWidth.

    


    

    
1780

    
    

    
        ImGui::ProgressBar(progress, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));

    


    

    
1781

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);

    


    

    
1782

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Progress Bar");

    


    

    
1783

    
    

    

    


    

    
1784

    
    

    
        float progress_saturated = IM_CLAMP(progress, 0.0f, 1.0f);

    


    

    
1785

    
    

    
        char buf[32];

    


    

    
1786

    
    

    
        sprintf(buf, "%d/%d", (int)(progress_saturated * 1753), 1753);

    


    

    
1787

    
    

    
        ImGui::ProgressBar(progress, ImVec2(0.f, 0.f), buf);

    


    

    
1788

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
1789

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
1790

    
    

    

    


    

    
1791

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color");

    


    

    
1792

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Color/Picker Widgets"))

    


    

    
1793

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
1794

    
    

    
        static ImVec4 color = ImVec4(114.0f / 255.0f, 144.0f / 255.0f, 154.0f / 255.0f, 200.0f / 255.0f);

    


    

    
1795

    
    

    

    


    

    
1796

    
    

    
        static bool alpha_preview = true;

    


    

    
1797

    
    

    
        static bool alpha_half_preview = false;

    


    

    
1798

    
    

    
        static bool drag_and_drop = true;

    


    

    
1799

    
    

    
        static bool options_menu = true;

    


    

    
1800

    
    

    
        static bool hdr = false;

    


    

    
1801

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("With Alpha Preview", &alpha_preview);

    


    

    
1802

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("With Half Alpha Preview", &alpha_half_preview);

    


    

    
1803

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("With Drag and Drop", &drag_and_drop);

    


    

    
1804

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("With Options Menu", &options_menu); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Right-click on the individual color widget to show options.");

    


    

    
1805

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("With HDR", &hdr); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Currently all this does is to lift the 0..1 limits on dragging widgets.");

    


    

    
1806

    
    

    
        ImGuiColorEditFlags misc_flags = (hdr ? ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR : 0) | (drag_and_drop ? 0 : ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop) | (alpha_half_preview ? ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf : (alpha_preview ? ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview : 0)) | (options_menu ? 0 : ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions);

    


    

    
1807

    
    

    

    


    

    
1808

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color/ColorEdit");

    


    

    
1809

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Color widget:");

    


    

    
1810

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(

    


    

    
1811

    
    

    
            "Click on the color square to open a color picker.\n"

    


    

    
1812

    
    

    
            "CTRL+click on individual component to input value.\n");

    


    

    
1813

    
    

    
        ImGui::ColorEdit3("MyColor##1", (float*)&color, misc_flags);

    


    

    
1814

    
    

    

    


    

    
1815

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color/ColorEdit (HSV, with Alpha)");

    


    

    
1816

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Color widget HSV with Alpha:");

    


    

    
1817

    
    

    
        ImGui::ColorEdit4("MyColor##2", (float*)&color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV | misc_flags);

    


    

    
1818

    
    

    

    


    

    
1819

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color/ColorEdit (float display)");

    


    

    
1820

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Color widget with Float Display:");

    


    

    
1821

    
    

    
        ImGui::ColorEdit4("MyColor##2f", (float*)&color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float | misc_flags);

    


    

    
1822

    
    

    

    


    

    
1823

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color/ColorButton (with Picker)");

    


    

    
1824

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Color button with Picker:");

    


    

    
1825

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(

    


    

    
1826

    
    

    
            "With the ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs flag you can hide all the slider/text inputs.\n"

    


    

    
1827

    
    

    
            "With the ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel flag you can pass a non-empty label which will only "

    


    

    
1828

    
    

    
            "be used for the tooltip and picker popup.");

    


    

    
1829

    
    

    
        ImGui::ColorEdit4("MyColor##3", (float*)&color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel | misc_flags);

    


    

    
1830

    
    

    

    


    

    
1831

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color/ColorButton (with custom Picker popup)");

    


    

    
1832

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Color button with Custom Picker Popup:");

    


    

    
1833

    
    

    

    


    

    
1834

    
    

    
        // Generate a default palette. The palette will persist and can be edited.

    


    

    
1835

    
    

    
        static bool saved_palette_init = true;

    


    

    
1836

    
    

    
        static ImVec4 saved_palette[32] = {};

    


    

    
1837

    
    

    
        if (saved_palette_init)

    


    

    
1838

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
1839

    
    

    
            for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(saved_palette); n++)

    


    

    
1840

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
1841

    
    

    
                ImGui::ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(n / 31.0f, 0.8f, 0.8f,

    


    

    
1842

    
    

    
                    saved_palette[n].x, saved_palette[n].y, saved_palette[n].z);

    


    

    
1843

    
    

    
                saved_palette[n].w = 1.0f; // Alpha

    


    

    
1844

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
1845

    
    

    
            saved_palette_init = false;

    


    

    
1846

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
1847

    
    

    

    


    

    
1848

    
    

    
        static ImVec4 backup_color;

    


    

    
1849

    
    

    
        bool open_popup = ImGui::ColorButton("MyColor##3b", color, misc_flags);

    


    

    
1850

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(0, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);

    


    

    
1851

    
    

    
        open_popup |= ImGui::Button("Palette");

    


    

    
1852

    
    

    
        if (open_popup)

    


    

    
1853

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
1854

    
    

    
            ImGui::OpenPopup("mypicker");

    


    

    
1855

    
    

    
            backup_color = color;

    


    

    
1856

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
1857

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginPopup("mypicker"))

    


    

    
1858

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
1859

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("MY CUSTOM COLOR PICKER WITH AN AMAZING PALETTE!");

    


    

    
1860

    
    

    
            ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
1861

    
    

    
            ImGui::ColorPicker4("##picker", (float*)&color, misc_flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview);

    


    

    
1862

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
1863

    
    

    

    


    

    
1864

    
    

    
            ImGui::BeginGroup(); // Lock X position

    


    

    
1865

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Current");

    


    

    
1866

    
    

    
            ImGui::ColorButton("##current", color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf, ImVec2(60, 40));

    


    

    
1867

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Previous");

    


    

    
1868

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::ColorButton("##previous", backup_color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf, ImVec2(60, 40)))

    


    

    
1869

    
    

    
                color = backup_color;

    


    

    
1870

    
    

    
            ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
1871

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Palette");

    


    

    
1872

    
    

    
            for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(saved_palette); n++)

    


    

    
1873

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
1874

    
    

    
                ImGui::PushID(n);

    


    

    
1875

    
    

    
                if ((n % 8) != 0)

    


    

    
1876

    
    

    
                    ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemSpacing.y);

    


    

    
1877

    
    

    

    


    

    
1878

    
    

    
                ImGuiColorEditFlags palette_button_flags = ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip;

    


    

    
1879

    
    

    
                if (ImGui::ColorButton("##palette", saved_palette[n], palette_button_flags, ImVec2(20, 20)))

    


    

    
1880

    
    

    
                    color = ImVec4(saved_palette[n].x, saved_palette[n].y, saved_palette[n].z, color.w); // Preserve alpha!

    


    

    
1881

    
    

    

    


    

    
1882

    
    

    
                // Allow user to drop colors into each palette entry. Note that ColorButton() is already a

    


    

    
1883

    
    

    
                // drag source by default, unless specifying the ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop flag.

    


    

    
1884

    
    

    
                if (ImGui::BeginDragDropTarget())

    


    

    
1885

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
1886

    
    

    
                    if (const ImGuiPayload* payload = ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_3F))

    


    

    
1887

    
    

    
                        memcpy((float*)&saved_palette[n], payload->Data, sizeof(float) * 3);

    


    

    
1888

    
    

    
                    if (const ImGuiPayload* payload = ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_4F))

    


    

    
1889

    
    

    
                        memcpy((float*)&saved_palette[n], payload->Data, sizeof(float) * 4);

    


    

    
1890

    
    

    
                    ImGui::EndDragDropTarget();

    


    

    
1891

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
1892

    
    

    

    


    

    
1893

    
    

    
                ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
1894

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
1895

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndGroup();

    


    

    
1896

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndPopup();

    


    

    
1897

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
1898

    
    

    

    


    

    
1899

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color/ColorButton (simple)");

    


    

    
1900

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Color button only:");

    


    

    
1901

    
    

    
        static bool no_border = false;

    


    

    
1902

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder", &no_border);

    


    

    
1903

    
    

    
        ImGui::ColorButton("MyColor##3c", *(ImVec4*)&color, misc_flags | (no_border ? ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder : 0), ImVec2(80, 80));

    


    

    
1904

    
    

    

    


    

    
1905

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color/ColorPicker");

    


    

    
1906

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Color picker:");

    


    

    
1907

    
    

    
        static bool alpha = true;

    


    

    
1908

    
    

    
        static bool alpha_bar = true;

    


    

    
1909

    
    

    
        static bool side_preview = true;

    


    

    
1910

    
    

    
        static bool ref_color = false;

    


    

    
1911

    
    

    
        static ImVec4 ref_color_v(1.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f, 0.5f);

    


    

    
1912

    
    

    
        static int display_mode = 0;

    


    

    
1913

    
    

    
        static int picker_mode = 0;

    


    

    
1914

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("With Alpha", &alpha);

    


    

    
1915

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("With Alpha Bar", &alpha_bar);

    


    

    
1916

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("With Side Preview", &side_preview);

    


    

    
1917

    
    

    
        if (side_preview)

    


    

    
1918

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
1919

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
1920

    
    

    
            ImGui::Checkbox("With Ref Color", &ref_color);

    


    

    
1921

    
    

    
            if (ref_color)

    


    

    
1922

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
1923

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
1924

    
    

    
                ImGui::ColorEdit4("##RefColor", &ref_color_v.x, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs | misc_flags);

    


    

    
1925

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
1926

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
1927

    
    

    
        ImGui::Combo("Display Mode", &display_mode, "Auto/Current\0None\0RGB Only\0HSV Only\0Hex Only\0");

    


    

    
1928

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(

    


    

    
1929

    
    

    
            "ColorEdit defaults to displaying RGB inputs if you don't specify a display mode, "

    


    

    
1930

    
    

    
            "but the user can change it with a right-click on those inputs.\n\nColorPicker defaults to displaying RGB+HSV+Hex "

    


    

    
1931

    
    

    
            "if you don't specify a display mode.\n\nYou can change the defaults using SetColorEditOptions().");

    


    

    
1932

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("When not specified explicitly (Auto/Current mode), user can right-click the picker to change mode.");

    


    

    
1933

    
    

    
        ImGuiColorEditFlags flags = misc_flags;

    


    

    
1934

    
    

    
        if (!alpha)            flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha;        // This is by default if you call ColorPicker3() instead of ColorPicker4()

    


    

    
1935

    
    

    
        if (alpha_bar)         flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar;

    


    

    
1936

    
    

    
        if (!side_preview)     flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview;

    


    

    
1937

    
    

    
        if (picker_mode == 1)  flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar;

    


    

    
1938

    
    

    
        if (picker_mode == 2)  flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel;

    


    

    
1939

    
    

    
        if (display_mode == 1) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs;       // Disable all RGB/HSV/Hex displays

    


    

    
1940

    
    

    
        if (display_mode == 2) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB;     // Override display mode

    


    

    
1941

    
    

    
        if (display_mode == 3) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV;

    


    

    
1942

    
    

    
        if (display_mode == 4) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex;

    


    

    
1943

    
    

    
        ImGui::ColorPicker4("MyColor##4", (float*)&color, flags, ref_color ? &ref_color_v.x : NULL);

    


    

    
1944

    
    

    

    


    

    
1945

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Set defaults in code:");

    


    

    
1946

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(

    


    

    
1947

    
    

    
            "SetColorEditOptions() is designed to allow you to set boot-time default.\n"

    


    

    
1948

    
    

    
            "We don't have Push/Pop functions because you can force options on a per-widget basis if needed,"

    


    

    
1949

    
    

    
            "and the user can change non-forced ones with the options menu.\nWe don't have a getter to avoid"

    


    

    
1950

    
    

    
            "encouraging you to persistently save values that aren't forward-compatible.");

    


    

    
1951

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::Button("Default: Uint8 + HSV + Hue Bar"))

    


    

    
1952

    
    

    
            ImGui::SetColorEditOptions(ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8 | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar);

    


    

    
1953

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::Button("Default: Float + HDR + Hue Wheel"))

    


    

    
1954

    
    

    
            ImGui::SetColorEditOptions(ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float | ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel);

    


    

    
1955

    
    

    

    


    

    
1956

    
    

    
        // Always both a small version of both types of pickers (to make it more visible in the demo to people who are skimming quickly through it)

    


    

    
1957

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Both types:");

    


    

    
1958

    
    

    
        float w = (ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x - ImGui::GetStyle().ItemSpacing.y) * 0.40f;

    


    

    
1959

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(w);

    


    

    
1960

    
    

    
        ImGui::ColorPicker3("##MyColor##5", (float*)&color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha);

    


    

    
1961

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
1962

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(w);

    


    

    
1963

    
    

    
        ImGui::ColorPicker3("##MyColor##6", (float*)&color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha);

    


    

    
1964

    
    

    

    


    

    
1965

    
    

    
        // HSV encoded support (to avoid RGB<>HSV round trips and singularities when S==0 or V==0)

    


    

    
1966

    
    

    
        static ImVec4 color_hsv(0.23f, 1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f); // Stored as HSV!

    


    

    
1967

    
    

    
        ImGui::Spacing();

    


    

    
1968

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("HSV encoded colors");

    


    

    
1969

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(

    


    

    
1970

    
    

    
            "By default, colors are given to ColorEdit and ColorPicker in RGB, but ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV"

    


    

    
1971

    
    

    
            "allows you to store colors as HSV and pass them to ColorEdit and ColorPicker as HSV. This comes with the"

    


    

    
1972

    
    

    
            "added benefit that you can manipulate hue values with the picker even when saturation or value are zero.");

    


    

    
1973

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Color widget with InputHSV:");

    


    

    
1974

    
    

    
        ImGui::ColorEdit4("HSV shown as RGB##1", (float*)&color_hsv, ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float);

    


    

    
1975

    
    

    
        ImGui::ColorEdit4("HSV shown as HSV##1", (float*)&color_hsv, ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float);

    


    

    
1976

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragFloat4("Raw HSV values", (float*)&color_hsv, 0.01f, 0.0f, 1.0f);

    


    

    
1977

    
    

    

    


    

    
1978

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
1979

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
1980

    
    

    

    


    

    
1981

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Drag and Slider Flags");

    


    

    
1982

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Drag/Slider Flags"))

    


    

    
1983

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
1984

    
    

    
        // Demonstrate using advanced flags for DragXXX and SliderXXX functions. Note that the flags are the same!

    


    

    
1985

    
    

    
        static ImGuiSliderFlags flags = ImGuiSliderFlags_None;

    


    

    
1986

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp", &flags, ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);

    


    

    
1987

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Always clamp value to min/max bounds (if any) when input manually with CTRL+Click.");

    


    

    
1988

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic", &flags, ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic);

    


    

    
1989

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable logarithmic editing (more precision for small values).");

    


    

    
1990

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat", &flags, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat);

    


    

    
1991

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable rounding underlying value to match precision of the format string (e.g. %.3f values are rounded to those 3 digits).");

    


    

    
1992

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput", &flags, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput);

    


    

    
1993

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable CTRL+Click or Enter key allowing to input text directly into the widget.");

    


    

    
1994

    
    

    

    


    

    
1995

    
    

    
        // Drags

    


    

    
1996

    
    

    
        static float drag_f = 0.5f;

    


    

    
1997

    
    

    
        static int drag_i = 50;

    


    

    
1998

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Underlying float value: %f", drag_f);

    


    

    
1999

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragFloat("DragFloat (0 -> 1)", &drag_f, 0.005f, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.3f", flags);

    


    

    
2000

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragFloat("DragFloat (0 -> +inf)", &drag_f, 0.005f, 0.0f, FLT_MAX, "%.3f", flags);

    


    

    
2001

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragFloat("DragFloat (-inf -> 1)", &drag_f, 0.005f, -FLT_MAX, 1.0f, "%.3f", flags);

    


    

    
2002

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragFloat("DragFloat (-inf -> +inf)", &drag_f, 0.005f, -FLT_MAX, +FLT_MAX, "%.3f", flags);

    


    

    
2003

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragInt("DragInt (0 -> 100)", &drag_i, 0.5f, 0, 100, "%d", flags);

    


    

    
2004

    
    

    

    


    

    
2005

    
    

    
        // Sliders

    


    

    
2006

    
    

    
        static float slider_f = 0.5f;

    


    

    
2007

    
    

    
        static int slider_i = 50;

    


    

    
2008

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Underlying float value: %f", slider_f);

    


    

    
2009

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderFloat("SliderFloat (0 -> 1)", &slider_f, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.3f", flags);

    


    

    
2010

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderInt("SliderInt (0 -> 100)", &slider_i, 0, 100, "%d", flags);

    


    

    
2011

    
    

    

    


    

    
2012

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
2013

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
2014

    
    

    

    


    

    
2015

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Range Widgets");

    


    

    
2016

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Range Widgets"))

    


    

    
2017

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
2018

    
    

    
        static float begin = 10, end = 90;

    


    

    
2019

    
    

    
        static int begin_i = 100, end_i = 1000;

    


    

    
2020

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragFloatRange2("range float", &begin, &end, 0.25f, 0.0f, 100.0f, "Min: %.1f %%", "Max: %.1f %%", ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);

    


    

    
2021

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragIntRange2("range int", &begin_i, &end_i, 5, 0, 1000, "Min: %d units", "Max: %d units");

    


    

    
2022

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragIntRange2("range int (no bounds)", &begin_i, &end_i, 5, 0, 0, "Min: %d units", "Max: %d units");

    


    

    
2023

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
2024

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
2025

    
    

    

    


    

    
2026

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Data Types");

    


    

    
2027

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Data Types"))

    


    

    
2028

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
2029

    
    

    
        // DragScalar/InputScalar/SliderScalar functions allow various data types

    


    

    
2030

    
    

    
        // - signed/unsigned

    


    

    
2031

    
    

    
        // - 8/16/32/64-bits

    


    

    
2032

    
    

    
        // - integer/float/double

    


    

    
2033

    
    

    
        // To avoid polluting the public API with all possible combinations, we use the ImGuiDataType enum

    


    

    
2034

    
    

    
        // to pass the type, and passing all arguments by pointer.

    


    

    
2035

    
    

    
        // This is the reason the test code below creates local variables to hold "zero" "one" etc. for each type.

    


    

    
2036

    
    

    
        // In practice, if you frequently use a given type that is not covered by the normal API entry points,

    


    

    
2037

    
    

    
        // you can wrap it yourself inside a 1 line function which can take typed argument as value instead of void*,

    


    

    
2038

    
    

    
        // and then pass their address to the generic function. For example:

    


    

    
2039

    
    

    
        //   bool MySliderU64(const char *label, u64* value, u64 min = 0, u64 max = 0, const char* format = "%lld")

    


    

    
2040

    
    

    
        //   {

    


    

    
2041

    
    

    
        //      return SliderScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_U64, value, &min, &max, format);

    


    

    
2042

    
    

    
        //   }

    


    

    
2043

    
    

    

    


    

    
2044

    
    

    
        // Setup limits (as helper variables so we can take their address, as explained above)

    


    

    
2045

    
    

    
        // Note: SliderScalar() functions have a maximum usable range of half the natural type maximum, hence the /2.

    


    

    
2046

    
    

    
        #ifndef LLONG_MIN

    


    

    
2047

    
    

    
        ImS64 LLONG_MIN = -9223372036854775807LL - 1;

    


    

    
2048

    
    

    
        ImS64 LLONG_MAX = 9223372036854775807LL;

    


    

    
2049

    
    

    
        ImU64 ULLONG_MAX = (2ULL * 9223372036854775807LL + 1);

    


    

    
2050

    
    

    
        #endif

    


    

    
2051

    
    

    
        const char    s8_zero  = 0,   s8_one  = 1,   s8_fifty  = 50, s8_min  = -128,        s8_max = 127;

    


    

    
2052

    
    

    
        const ImU8    u8_zero  = 0,   u8_one  = 1,   u8_fifty  = 50, u8_min  = 0,           u8_max = 255;

    


    

    
2053

    
    

    
        const short   s16_zero = 0,   s16_one = 1,   s16_fifty = 50, s16_min = -32768,      s16_max = 32767;

    


    

    
2054

    
    

    
        const ImU16   u16_zero = 0,   u16_one = 1,   u16_fifty = 50, u16_min = 0,           u16_max = 65535;

    


    

    
2055

    
    

    
        const ImS32   s32_zero = 0,   s32_one = 1,   s32_fifty = 50, s32_min = INT_MIN/2,   s32_max = INT_MAX/2,    s32_hi_a = INT_MAX/2 - 100,    s32_hi_b = INT_MAX/2;

    


    

    
2056

    
    

    
        const ImU32   u32_zero = 0,   u32_one = 1,   u32_fifty = 50, u32_min = 0,           u32_max = UINT_MAX/2,   u32_hi_a = UINT_MAX/2 - 100,   u32_hi_b = UINT_MAX/2;

    


    

    
2057

    
    

    
        const ImS64   s64_zero = 0,   s64_one = 1,   s64_fifty = 50, s64_min = LLONG_MIN/2, s64_max = LLONG_MAX/2,  s64_hi_a = LLONG_MAX/2 - 100,  s64_hi_b = LLONG_MAX/2;

    


    

    
2058

    
    

    
        const ImU64   u64_zero = 0,   u64_one = 1,   u64_fifty = 50, u64_min = 0,           u64_max = ULLONG_MAX/2, u64_hi_a = ULLONG_MAX/2 - 100, u64_hi_b = ULLONG_MAX/2;

    


    

    
2059

    
    

    
        const float   f32_zero = 0.f, f32_one = 1.f, f32_lo_a = -10000000000.0f, f32_hi_a = +10000000000.0f;

    


    

    
2060

    
    

    
        const double  f64_zero = 0.,  f64_one = 1.,  f64_lo_a = -1000000000000000.0, f64_hi_a = +1000000000000000.0;

    


    

    
2061

    
    

    

    


    

    
2062

    
    

    
        // State

    


    

    
2063

    
    

    
        static char   s8_v  = 127;

    


    

    
2064

    
    

    
        static ImU8   u8_v  = 255;

    


    

    
2065

    
    

    
        static short  s16_v = 32767;

    


    

    
2066

    
    

    
        static ImU16  u16_v = 65535;

    


    

    
2067

    
    

    
        static ImS32  s32_v = -1;

    


    

    
2068

    
    

    
        static ImU32  u32_v = (ImU32)-1;

    


    

    
2069

    
    

    
        static ImS64  s64_v = -1;

    


    

    
2070

    
    

    
        static ImU64  u64_v = (ImU64)-1;

    


    

    
2071

    
    

    
        static float  f32_v = 0.123f;

    


    

    
2072

    
    

    
        static double f64_v = 90000.01234567890123456789;

    


    

    
2073

    
    

    

    


    

    
2074

    
    

    
        const float drag_speed = 0.2f;

    


    

    
2075

    
    

    
        static bool drag_clamp = false;

    


    

    
2076

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Data Types/Drags");

    


    

    
2077

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Drags:");

    


    

    
2078

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("Clamp integers to 0..50", &drag_clamp);

    


    

    
2079

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(

    


    

    
2080

    
    

    
            "As with every widget in dear imgui, we never modify values unless there is a user interaction.\n"

    


    

    
2081

    
    

    
            "You can override the clamping limits by using CTRL+Click to input a value.");

    


    

    
2082

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragScalar("drag s8",        ImGuiDataType_S8,     &s8_v,  drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &s8_zero  : NULL, drag_clamp ? &s8_fifty  : NULL);

    


    

    
2083

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragScalar("drag u8",        ImGuiDataType_U8,     &u8_v,  drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &u8_zero  : NULL, drag_clamp ? &u8_fifty  : NULL, "%u ms");

    


    

    
2084

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragScalar("drag s16",       ImGuiDataType_S16,    &s16_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &s16_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &s16_fifty : NULL);

    


    

    
2085

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragScalar("drag u16",       ImGuiDataType_U16,    &u16_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &u16_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &u16_fifty : NULL, "%u ms");

    


    

    
2086

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragScalar("drag s32",       ImGuiDataType_S32,    &s32_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &s32_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &s32_fifty : NULL);

    


    

    
2087

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragScalar("drag s32 hex",   ImGuiDataType_S32,    &s32_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &s32_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &s32_fifty : NULL, "0x%08X");

    


    

    
2088

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragScalar("drag u32",       ImGuiDataType_U32,    &u32_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &u32_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &u32_fifty : NULL, "%u ms");

    


    

    
2089

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragScalar("drag s64",       ImGuiDataType_S64,    &s64_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &s64_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &s64_fifty : NULL);

    


    

    
2090

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragScalar("drag u64",       ImGuiDataType_U64,    &u64_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &u64_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &u64_fifty : NULL);

    


    

    
2091

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragScalar("drag float",     ImGuiDataType_Float,  &f32_v, 0.005f,  &f32_zero, &f32_one, "%f");

    


    

    
2092

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragScalar("drag float log", ImGuiDataType_Float,  &f32_v, 0.005f,  &f32_zero, &f32_one, "%f", ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic);

    


    

    
2093

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragScalar("drag double",    ImGuiDataType_Double, &f64_v, 0.0005f, &f64_zero, NULL,     "%.10f grams");

    


    

    
2094

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragScalar("drag double log",ImGuiDataType_Double, &f64_v, 0.0005f, &f64_zero, &f64_one, "0 < %.10f < 1", ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic);

    


    

    
2095

    
    

    

    


    

    
2096

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Data Types/Sliders");

    


    

    
2097

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Sliders");

    


    

    
2098

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s8 full",       ImGuiDataType_S8,     &s8_v,  &s8_min,   &s8_max,   "%d");

    


    

    
2099

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u8 full",       ImGuiDataType_U8,     &u8_v,  &u8_min,   &u8_max,   "%u");

    


    

    
2100

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s16 full",      ImGuiDataType_S16,    &s16_v, &s16_min,  &s16_max,  "%d");

    


    

    
2101

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u16 full",      ImGuiDataType_U16,    &u16_v, &u16_min,  &u16_max,  "%u");

    


    

    
2102

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s32 low",       ImGuiDataType_S32,    &s32_v, &s32_zero, &s32_fifty,"%d");

    


    

    
2103

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s32 high",      ImGuiDataType_S32,    &s32_v, &s32_hi_a, &s32_hi_b, "%d");

    


    

    
2104

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s32 full",      ImGuiDataType_S32,    &s32_v, &s32_min,  &s32_max,  "%d");

2106

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u32 low",       ImGuiDataType_U32,    &u32_v, &u32_zero, &u32_fifty,"%u");

2108

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u32 full",      ImGuiDataType_U32,    &u32_v, &u32_min,  &u32_max,  "%u");

    


    

    
2109

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s64 low",       ImGuiDataType_S64,    &s64_v, &s64_zero, &s64_fifty,"%" IM_PRId64);

    


    

    
2110

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s64 high",      ImGuiDataType_S64,    &s64_v, &s64_hi_a, &s64_hi_b, "%" IM_PRId64);

    


    

    
2111

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s64 full",      ImGuiDataType_S64,    &s64_v, &s64_min,  &s64_max,  "%" IM_PRId64);

    


    

    
2112

2114

2116

2118

2121

    
    

    

    


    

    
2122

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Sliders (reverse)");

    


    

    
2123

2128

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u64 reverse",   ImGuiDataType_U64,  &u64_v, &u64_fifty, &u64_zero, "%" IM_PRIu64 " ms");

    


    

    
2129

    
    

    

    


    

    
2130

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Data Types/Inputs");

    


    

    
2131

    
    

    
        static bool inputs_step = true;

    


    

    
2132

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Inputs");

    


    

    
2133

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("Show step buttons", &inputs_step);

    


    

    
2134

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputScalar("input s8",      ImGuiDataType_S8,     &s8_v,  inputs_step ? &s8_one  : NULL, NULL, "%d");

    


    

    
2135

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputScalar("input u8",      ImGuiDataType_U8,     &u8_v,  inputs_step ? &u8_one  : NULL, NULL, "%u");

    


    

    
2136

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputScalar("input s16",     ImGuiDataType_S16,    &s16_v, inputs_step ? &s16_one : NULL, NULL, "%d");

    


    

    
2137

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputScalar("input u16",     ImGuiDataType_U16,    &u16_v, inputs_step ? &u16_one : NULL, NULL, "%u");

    


    

    
2138

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputScalar("input s32",     ImGuiDataType_S32,    &s32_v, inputs_step ? &s32_one : NULL, NULL, "%d");

    


    

    
2139

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputScalar("input s32 hex", ImGuiDataType_S32,    &s32_v, inputs_step ? &s32_one : NULL, NULL, "%04X");

    


    

    
2140

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputScalar("input u32",     ImGuiDataType_U32,    &u32_v, inputs_step ? &u32_one : NULL, NULL, "%u");

    


    

    
2141

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputScalar("input u32 hex", ImGuiDataType_U32,    &u32_v, inputs_step ? &u32_one : NULL, NULL, "%08X");

    


    

    
2142

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputScalar("input s64",     ImGuiDataType_S64,    &s64_v, inputs_step ? &s64_one : NULL);

    


    

    
2143

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputScalar("input u64",     ImGuiDataType_U64,    &u64_v, inputs_step ? &u64_one : NULL);

    


    

    
2144

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputScalar("input float",   ImGuiDataType_Float,  &f32_v, inputs_step ? &f32_one : NULL);

    


    

    
2145

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputScalar("input double",  ImGuiDataType_Double, &f64_v, inputs_step ? &f64_one : NULL);

    


    

    
2146

    
    

    

    


    

    
2147

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
2148

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
2149

    
    

    

    


    

    
2150

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Multi-component Widgets");

    


    

    
2151

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Multi-component Widgets"))

    


    

    
2152

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
2153

    
    

    
        static float vec4f[4] = { 0.10f, 0.20f, 0.30f, 0.44f };

    


    

    
2154

    
    

    
        static int vec4i[4] = { 1, 5, 100, 255 };

    


    

    
2155

    
    

    

    


    

    
2156

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputFloat2("input float2", vec4f);

    


    

    
2157

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragFloat2("drag float2", vec4f, 0.01f, 0.0f, 1.0f);

    


    

    
2158

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderFloat2("slider float2", vec4f, 0.0f, 1.0f);

    


    

    
2159

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputInt2("input int2", vec4i);

    


    

    
2160

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragInt2("drag int2", vec4i, 1, 0, 255);

    


    

    
2161

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderInt2("slider int2", vec4i, 0, 255);

    


    

    
2162

    
    

    
        ImGui::Spacing();

    


    

    
2163

    
    

    

    


    

    
2164

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputFloat3("input float3", vec4f);

    


    

    
2165

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragFloat3("drag float3", vec4f, 0.01f, 0.0f, 1.0f);

    


    

    
2166

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderFloat3("slider float3", vec4f, 0.0f, 1.0f);

    


    

    
2167

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputInt3("input int3", vec4i);

    


    

    
2168

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragInt3("drag int3", vec4i, 1, 0, 255);

    


    

    
2169

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderInt3("slider int3", vec4i, 0, 255);

    


    

    
2170

    
    

    
        ImGui::Spacing();

    


    

    
2171

    
    

    

    


    

    
2172

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputFloat4("input float4", vec4f);

    


    

    
2173

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragFloat4("drag float4", vec4f, 0.01f, 0.0f, 1.0f);

    


    

    
2174

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderFloat4("slider float4", vec4f, 0.0f, 1.0f);

    


    

    
2175

2177
