        static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable;

    


    

    
4073

    
    

    

    


    

    
4074

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags))

    


    

    
4075

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4076

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("AAA", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);

    


    

    
4077

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("BBB", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);

    


    

    
4078

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("CCC", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch);

    


    

    
4079

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableHeadersRow();

    


    

    
4080

    
    

    
            for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)

    


    

    
4081

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4082

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
4083

    
    

    
                for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)

    


    

    
4084

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
4085

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);

    


    

    
4086

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Text("%s %d,%d", (column == 2) ? "Stretch" : "Fixed", column, row);

    


    

    
4087

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
4088

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
4089

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
4090

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
4091

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 6, flags))

    


    

    
4092

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4093

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("AAA", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);

    


    

    
4094

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("BBB", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);

    


    

    
4095

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("CCC", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide);

    


    

    
4096

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("DDD", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch);

    


    

    
4097

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("EEE", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch);

    


    

    
4098

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("FFF", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide);

    


    

    
4099

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableHeadersRow();

    


    

    
4100

    
    

    
            for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)

    


    

    
4101

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4102

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
4103

    
    

    
                for (int column = 0; column < 6; column++)

    


    

    
4104

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
4105

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);

    


    

    
4106

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Text("%s %d,%d", (column >= 3) ? "Stretch" : "Fixed", column, row);

    


    

    
4107

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
4108

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
4109

4110

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
4111

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
4112

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
4113

    
    

    

    


    

    
4114

    
    

    
    if (open_action != -1)

    


    

    
4115

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);

    


    

    
4116

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Reorderable, hideable, with headers");

    


    

    
4117

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Reorderable, hideable, with headers"))

    


    

    
4118

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
4119

4120

    
    

    
            "Click and drag column headers to reorder columns.\n\n"

4122

4127

4128

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable vertical borders in columns Body until hovered for resize (borders will always appear in Headers)");

    


    

    
4129

    
    

    
        PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4130

    
    

    

    


    

    
4131

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags))

    


    

    
4132

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4133

    
    

    
            // Submit columns name with TableSetupColumn() and call TableHeadersRow() to create a row with a header in each column.

4135

4136

4142

4150

    
    

    

    


    

    
4151

    
    

    
        // Use outer_size.x == 0.0f instead of default to make the table as tight as possible (only valid when no scrolling and no stretch column)

    


    

    
4152

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 3, flags | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f)))

4158

4159

4160

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
4161

4170

4171

    
    

    

    


    

    
4172

    
    

    
    if (open_action != -1)

    


    

    
4173

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);

    


    

    
4174

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Padding");

    


    

    
4175

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Padding"))

    


    

    
4176

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
4177

    
    

    
        // First example: showcase use of padding flags and effect of BorderOuterV/BorderInnerV on X padding.

    


    

    
4178

    
    

    
        // We don't expose BorderOuterH/BorderInnerH here because they have no effect on X padding.

    


    

    
4179

    
    

    
        HelpMarker(

    


    

    
4180

    
    

    
            "We often want outer padding activated when any using features which makes the edges of a column visible:\n"

    


    

    
4181

    
    

    
            "e.g.:\n"

    


    

    
4182

    
    

    
            "- BorderOuterV\n"

    


    

    
4183

    
    

    
            "- any form of row selection\n"

    


    

    
4184

    
    

    
            "Because of this, activating BorderOuterV sets the default to PadOuterX. Using PadOuterX or NoPadOuterX you can override the default.\n\n"

    


    

    
4185

    
    

    
            "Actual padding values are using style.CellPadding.\n\n"

    


    

    
4186

    
    

    
            "In this demo we don't show horizontal borders to emphasize how they don't affect default horizontal padding.");

    


    

    
4187

    
    

    

    


    

    
4188

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags flags1 = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV;

    


    

    
4189

    
    

    
        PushStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4190

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_PadOuterX", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_PadOuterX);

    


    

    
4191

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable outer-most padding (default if ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV is set)");

    


    

    
4192

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX);

    


    

    
4193

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable outer-most padding (default if ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV is not set)");

    


    

    
4194

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadInnerX", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadInnerX);

    


    

    
4195

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable inner padding between columns (double inner padding if BordersOuterV is on, single inner padding if BordersOuterV is off)");

    


    

    
4196

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV);

    


    

    
4197

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV);

    


    

    
4198

    
    

    
        static bool show_headers = false;

    


    

    
4199

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("show_headers", &show_headers);

    


    

    
4200

    
    

    
        PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4201

    
    

    

    


    

    
4202

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_padding", 3, flags1))

    


    

    
4203

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4204

4205

4210

4212

    
    

    
            for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)

    


    

    
4213

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4214

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
4215

4222

4223

    
    

    
                    {

    


    

    
4224

4225

4227

                    //if (ImGui::TableGetColumnFlags() & ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsHovered)

4235

    
    

    
        // Second example: set style.CellPadding to (0.0) or a custom value.

    


    

    
4236

    
    

    
        // FIXME-TABLE: Vertical border effectively not displayed the same way as horizontal one...

    


    

    
4237

    
    

    
        HelpMarker("Setting style.CellPadding to (0,0) or a custom value.");

    


    

    
4238

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags flags2 = ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg;

    


    

    
4239

    
    

    
        static ImVec2 cell_padding(0.0f, 0.0f);

    


    

    
4240

4247

4248

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg);

    


    

    
4249

4250

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("show_widget_frame_bg", &show_widget_frame_bg);

    


    

    
4251

    
    

    
        ImGui::SliderFloat2("CellPadding", &cell_padding.x, 0.0f, 10.0f, "%.0f");

    


    

    
4252

    
    

    
        PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4253

    
    

    

    


    

    
4254

    
    

    
        ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_CellPadding, cell_padding);

    


    

    
4255

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_padding_2", 3, flags2))

    


    

    
4256

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4257

    
    

    
            static char text_bufs[3 * 5][16]; // Mini text storage for 3x5 cells

    


    

    
4258

    
    

    
            static bool init = true;

    


    

    
4259

    
    

    
            if (!show_widget_frame_bg)

    


    

    
4260

    
    

    
                ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_FrameBg, 0);

    


    

    
4261

    
    

    
            for (int cell = 0; cell < 3 * 5; cell++)

    


    

    
4262

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4263

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextColumn();

    


    

    
4264

    
    

    
                if (init)

    


    

    
4265

    
    

    
                    strcpy(text_bufs[cell], "edit me");

    


    

    
4266

    
    

    
                ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN);

    


    

    
4267

    
    

    
                ImGui::PushID(cell);

    


    

    
4268

    
    

    
                ImGui::InputText("##cell", text_bufs[cell], IM_ARRAYSIZE(text_bufs[cell]));

    


    

    
4269

    
    

    
                ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
4270

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
4271

    
    

    
            if (!show_widget_frame_bg)

    


    

    
4272

    
    

    
                ImGui::PopStyleColor();

    


    

    
4273

    
    

    
            init = false;

    


    

    
4274

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
4275

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
4276

    
    

    
        ImGui::PopStyleVar();

    


    

    
4277

    
    

    

    


    

    
4278

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
4279

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
4280

    
    

    

    


    

    
4281

    
    

    
    if (open_action != -1)

    


    

    
4282

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);

    


    

    
4283

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Explicit widths");

    


    

    
4284

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Sizing policies"))

    


    

    
4285

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
4286

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags flags1 = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody;

    


    

    
4287

    
    

    
        PushStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4288

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);

    


    

    
4289

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX);

    


    

    
4290

    
    

    
        PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4291

    
    

    

    


    

    
4292

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags sizing_policy_flags[4] = { ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit, ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedSame, ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchProp, ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame };

    


    

    
4293

    
    

    
        for (int table_n = 0; table_n < 4; table_n++)

    


    

    
4294

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4295

    
    

    
            ImGui::PushID(table_n);

    


    

    
4296

    
    

    
            ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30);

    


    

    
4297

    
    

    
            EditTableSizingFlags(&sizing_policy_flags[table_n]);

    


    

    
4298

    
    

    

    


    

    
4299

    
    

    
            // To make it easier to understand the different sizing policy,

    


    

    
4300

    
    

    
            // For each policy: we display one table where the columns have equal contents width, and one where the columns have different contents width.

    


    

    
4301

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, sizing_policy_flags[table_n] | flags1))

    


    

    
4302

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4303

    
    

    
                for (int row = 0; row < 3; row++)

    


    

    
4304

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
4305

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
4306

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("Oh dear");

    


    

    
4307

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("Oh dear");

    


    

    
4308

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("Oh dear");

    


    

    
4309

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
4310

    
    

    
                ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
4311

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
4312

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 3, sizing_policy_flags[table_n] | flags1))

    


    

    
4313

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4314

    
    

    
                for (int row = 0; row < 3; row++)

    


    

    
4315

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
4316

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
4317

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("AAAA");

    


    

    
4318

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("BBBBBBBB");

    


    

    
4319

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("CCCCCCCCCCCC");

    


    

    
4320

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
4321

    
    

    
                ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
4322

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
4323

    
    

    
            ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
4324

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
4325

    
    

    

    


    

    
4326

    
    

    
        ImGui::Spacing();

    


    

    
4327

    
    

    
        ImGui::TextUnformatted("Advanced");

    


    

    
4328

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
4329

    
    

    
        HelpMarker("This section allows you to interact and see the effect of various sizing policies depending on whether Scroll is enabled and the contents of your columns.");

    


    

    
4330

    
    

    

    


    

    
4331

    
    

    
        enum ContentsType { CT_ShowWidth, CT_ShortText, CT_LongText, CT_Button, CT_FillButton, CT_InputText };

    


    

    
4332

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable;

    


    

    
4333

    
    

    
        static int contents_type = CT_ShowWidth;

    


    

    
4334

    
    

    
        static int column_count = 3;

    


    

    
4335

    
    

    

    


    

    
4336

    
    

    
        PushStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4337

    
    

    
        ImGui::PushID("Advanced");

    


    

    
4338

    
    

    
        ImGui::PushItemWidth(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30);

    


    

    
4339

    
    

    
        EditTableSizingFlags(&flags);

    


    

    
4340

    
    

    
        ImGui::Combo("Contents", &contents_type, "Show width\0Short Text\0Long Text\0Button\0Fill Button\0InputText\0");

    


    

    
4341

    
    

    
        if (contents_type == CT_FillButton)

    


    

    
4342

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4343

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
4344

    
    

    
            HelpMarker("Be mindful that using right-alignment (e.g. size.x = -FLT_MIN) creates a feedback loop where contents width can feed into auto-column width can feed into contents width.");

    


    

    
4345

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
4346

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragInt("Columns", &column_count, 0.1f, 1, 64, "%d", ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);

    


    

    
4347

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);

    


    

    
4348

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_PreciseWidths", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_PreciseWidths);

    


    

    
4349

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable distributing remainder width to stretched columns (width allocation on a 100-wide table with 3 columns: Without this flag: 33,33,34. With this flag: 33,33,33). With larger number of columns, resizing will appear to be less smooth.");

    


    

    
4350

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX);

    


    

    
4351

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY);

    


    

    
4352

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoClip", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoClip);

    


    

    
4353

    
    

    
        ImGui::PopItemWidth();

    


    

    
4354

    
    

    
        ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
4355

    
    

    
        PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4356

    
    

    

    


    

    
4357

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", column_count, flags, ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 7)))

    


    

    
4358

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4359

    
    

    
            for (int cell = 0; cell < 10 * column_count; cell++)

    


    

    
4360

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4361

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextColumn();

    


    

    
4362

    
    

    
                int column = ImGui::TableGetColumnIndex();

    


    

    
4363

    
    

    
                int row = ImGui::TableGetRowIndex();

    


    

    
4364

    
    

    

    


    

    
4365

    
    

    
                ImGui::PushID(cell);

    


    

    
4366

    
    

    
                char label[32];

    


    

    
4367

    
    

    
                static char text_buf[32] = "";

    


    

    
4368

    
    

    
                sprintf(label, "Hello %d,%d", column, row);

    


    

    
4369

    
    

    
                switch (contents_type)

    


    

    
4370

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
4371

    
    

    
                case CT_ShortText:  ImGui::TextUnformatted(label); break;

    


    

    
4372

    
    

    
                case CT_LongText:   ImGui::Text("Some %s text %d,%d\nOver two lines..", column == 0 ? "long" : "longeeer", column, row); break;

    


    

    
4373

    
    

    
                case CT_ShowWidth:  ImGui::Text("W: %.1f", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x); break;

    


    

    
4374

    
    

    
                case CT_Button:     ImGui::Button(label); break;

    


    

    
4375

    
    

    
                case CT_FillButton: ImGui::Button(label, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f)); break;

    


    

    
4376

    
    

    
                case CT_InputText:  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN); ImGui::InputText("##", text_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(text_buf)); break;

    


    

    
4377

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
4378

    
    

    
                ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
4379

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
4380

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
4381

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
4382

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
4383

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
4384

    
    

    

    


    

    
4385

    
    

    
    if (open_action != -1)

    


    

    
4386

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);

    


    

    
4387

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Vertical scrolling, with clipping");

    


    

    
4388

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Vertical scrolling, with clipping"))

    


    

    
4389

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
4390

    
    

    
        HelpMarker("Here we activate ScrollY, which will create a child window container to allow hosting scrollable contents.\n\nWe also demonstrate using ImGuiListClipper to virtualize the submission of many items.");

    


    

    
4391

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable;

    


    

    
4392

    
    

    

    


    

    
4393

    
    

    
        PushStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4394

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY);

    


    

    
4395

    
    

    
        PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4396

    
    

    

    


    

    
4397

    
    

    
        // When using ScrollX or ScrollY we need to specify a size for our table container!

    


    

    
4398

    
    

    
        // Otherwise by default the table will fit all available space, like a BeginChild() call.

    


    

    
4399

    
    

    
        ImVec2 outer_size = ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 8);

    


    

    
4400

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_scrolly", 3, flags, outer_size))

    


    

    
4401

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4402

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupScrollFreeze(0, 1); // Make top row always visible

    


    

    
4403

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None);

    


    

    
4404

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None);

    


    

    
4405

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None);

    


    

    
4406

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableHeadersRow();

    


    

    
4407

    
    

    

    


    

    
4408

    
    

    
            // Demonstrate using clipper for large vertical lists

    


    

    
4409

    
    

    
            ImGuiListClipper clipper;

    


    

    
4410

    
    

    
            clipper.Begin(1000);

    


    

    
4411

    
    

    
            while (clipper.Step())

    


    

    
4412

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4413

    
    

    
                for (int row = clipper.DisplayStart; row < clipper.DisplayEnd; row++)

    


    

    
4414

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
4415

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
4416

    
    

    
                    for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)

    


    

    
4417

    
    

    
                    {

    


    

    
4418

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);

    


    

    
4419

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Text("Hello %d,%d", column, row);

    


    

    
4420

    
    

    
                    }

    


    

    
4421

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
4422

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
4423

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
4424

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
4425

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
4426

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
4427

    
    

    

    


    

    
4428

    
    

    
    if (open_action != -1)

    


    

    
4429

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);

    


    

    
4430

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Horizontal scrolling");

    


    

    
4431

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Horizontal scrolling"))

    


    

    
4432

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
4433

    
    

    
        HelpMarker(

    


    

    
4434

    
    

    
            "When ScrollX is enabled, the default sizing policy becomes ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit, "

    


    

    
4435

    
    

    
            "as automatically stretching columns doesn't make much sense with horizontal scrolling.\n\n"

    


    

    
4436

    
    

    
            "Also note that as of the current version, you will almost always want to enable ScrollY along with ScrollX,"

    


    

    
4437

    
    

    
            "because the container window won't automatically extend vertically to fix contents (this may be improved in future versions).");

    


    

    
4438

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable;

    


    

    
4439

    
    

    
        static int freeze_cols = 1;

    


    

    
4440

    
    

    
        static int freeze_rows = 1;

    


    

    
4441

    
    

    

    


    

    
4442

    
    

    
        PushStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4443

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);

    


    

    
4444

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX);

    


    

    
4445

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY);

    


    

    
4446

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFrameHeight());

    


    

    
4447

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragInt("freeze_cols", &freeze_cols, 0.2f, 0, 9, NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput);

    


    

    
4448

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFrameHeight());

    


    

    
4449

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragInt("freeze_rows", &freeze_rows, 0.2f, 0, 9, NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput);

    


    

    
4450

    
    

    
        PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4451

    
    

    

    


    

    
4452

    
    

    
        // When using ScrollX or ScrollY we need to specify a size for our table container!

    


    

    
4453

    
    

    
        // Otherwise by default the table will fit all available space, like a BeginChild() call.

    


    

    
4454

    
    

    
        ImVec2 outer_size = ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 8);

    


    

    
4455

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_scrollx", 7, flags, outer_size))

    


    

    
4456

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4457

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupScrollFreeze(freeze_cols, freeze_rows);

    


    

    
4458

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Line #", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHide); // Make the first column not hideable to match our use of TableSetupScrollFreeze()

    


    

    
4459

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");

    


    

    
4460

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");

    


    

    
4461

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");

    


    

    
4462

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Four");

    


    

    
4463

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Five");

    


    

    
4464

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Six");

    


    

    
4465

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableHeadersRow();

    


    

    
4466

    
    

    
            for (int row = 0; row < 20; row++)

    


    

    
4467

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4468

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
4469

    
    

    
                for (int column = 0; column < 7; column++)

    


    

    
4470

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
4471

    
    

    
                    // Both TableNextColumn() and TableSetColumnIndex() return true when a column is visible or performing width measurement.

    


    

    
4472

    
    

    
                    // Because here we know that:

    


    

    
4473

    
    

    
                    // - A) all our columns are contributing the same to row height

    


    

    
4474

    
    

    
                    // - B) column 0 is always visible,

    


    

    
4475

    
    

    
                    // We only always submit this one column and can skip others.

    


    

    
4476

    
    

    
                    // More advanced per-column clipping behaviors may benefit from polling the status flags via TableGetColumnFlags().

    


    

    
4477

    
    

    
                    if (!ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column) && column > 0)

    


    

    
4478

    
    

    
                        continue;

    


    

    
4479

    
    

    
                    if (column == 0)

    


    

    
4480

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Text("Line %d", row);

    


    

    
4481

    
    

    
                    else

    


    

    
4482

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Text("Hello world %d,%d", column, row);

    


    

    
4483

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
4484

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
4485

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
4486

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
4487

    
    

    

    


    

    
4488

    
    

    
        ImGui::Spacing();

    


    

    
4489

    
    

    
        ImGui::TextUnformatted("Stretch + ScrollX");

    


    

    
4490

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
4491

    
    

    
        HelpMarker(

    


    

    
4492

    
    

    
            "Showcase using Stretch columns + ScrollX together: "

    


    

    
4493

    
    

    
            "this is rather unusual and only makes sense when specifying an 'inner_width' for the table!\n"

    


    

    
4494

    
    

    
            "Without an explicit value, inner_width is == outer_size.x and therefore using Stretch columns + ScrollX together doesn't make sense.");

    


    

    
4495

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags flags2 = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody;

    


    

    
4496

    
    

    
        static float inner_width = 1000.0f;

    


    

    
4497

    
    

    
        PushStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4498

    
    

    
        ImGui::PushID("flags3");

    


    

    
4499

    
    

    
        ImGui::PushItemWidth(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30);

    


    

    
4500

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX);

    


    

    
4501

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragFloat("inner_width", &inner_width, 1.0f, 0.0f, FLT_MAX, "%.1f");

    


    

    
4502

    
    

    
        ImGui::PopItemWidth();

    


    

    
4503

    
    

    
        ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
4504

    
    

    
        PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4505

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 7, flags2, outer_size, inner_width))

    


    

    
4506

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4507

    
    

    
            for (int cell = 0; cell < 20 * 7; cell++)

    


    

    
4508

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4509

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextColumn();

    


    

    
4510

    
    

    
                ImGui::Text("Hello world %d,%d", ImGui::TableGetColumnIndex(), ImGui::TableGetRowIndex());

    


    

    
4511

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
4512

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
4513

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
4514

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
4515

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
4516

    
    

    

    


    

    
4517

    
    

    
    if (open_action != -1)

    


    

    
4518

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);

    


    

    
4519

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Columns flags");

    


    

    
4520

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Columns flags"))

    


    

    
4521

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
4522

    
    

    
        // Create a first table just to show all the options/flags we want to make visible in our example!

    


    

    
4523

    
    

    
        const int column_count = 3;

    


    

    
4524

    
    

    
        const char* column_names[column_count] = { "One", "Two", "Three" };

    


    

    
4525

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableColumnFlags column_flags[column_count] = { ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide };

    


    

    
4526

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableColumnFlags column_flags_out[column_count] = { 0, 0, 0 }; // Output from TableGetColumnFlags()

    


    

    
4527

    
    

    

    


    

    
4528

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_columns_flags_checkboxes", column_count, ImGuiTableFlags_None))

    


    

    
4529

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4530

    
    

    
            PushStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4531

    
    

    
            for (int column = 0; column < column_count; column++)

    


    

    
4532

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4533

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextColumn();

    


    

    
4534

    
    

    
                ImGui::PushID(column);

    


    

    
4535

    
    

    
                ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding(); // FIXME-TABLE: Workaround for wrong text baseline propagation across columns

    


    

    
4536

    
    

    
                ImGui::Text("'%s'", column_names[column]);

    


    

    
4537

    
    

    
                ImGui::Spacing();

    


    

    
4538

    
    

    
                ImGui::Text("Input flags:");

    


    

    
4539

    
    

    
                EditTableColumnsFlags(&column_flags[column]);

    


    

    
4540

    
    

    
                ImGui::Spacing();

    


    

    
4541

    
    

    
                ImGui::Text("Output flags:");

    


    

    
4542

    
    

    
                ImGui::BeginDisabled();

    


    

    
4543

    
    

    
                ShowTableColumnsStatusFlags(column_flags_out[column]);

    


    

    
4544

    
    

    
                ImGui::EndDisabled();

    


    

    
4545

    
    

    
                ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
4546

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
4547

    
    

    
            PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4548

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
4549

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
4550

    
    

    

    


    

    
4551

    
    

    
        // Create the real table we care about for the example!

    


    

    
4552

    
    

    
        // We use a scrolling table to be able to showcase the difference between the _IsEnabled and _IsVisible flags above, otherwise in

    


    

    
4553

    
    

    
        // a non-scrolling table columns are always visible (unless using ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible + resizing the parent window down)

    


    

    
4554

    
    

    
        const ImGuiTableFlags flags

    


    

    
4555

    
    

    
            = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY

    


    

    
4556

    
    

    
            | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV

    


    

    
4557

    
    

    
            | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable;

    


    

    
4558

    
    

    
        ImVec2 outer_size = ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 9);

    


    

    
4559

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_columns_flags", column_count, flags, outer_size))

    


    

    
4560

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4561

    
    

    
            for (int column = 0; column < column_count; column++)

    


    

    
4562

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableSetupColumn(column_names[column], column_flags[column]);

    


    

    
4563

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableHeadersRow();

    


    

    
4564

    
    

    
            for (int column = 0; column < column_count; column++)

    


    

    
4565

    
    

    
                column_flags_out[column] = ImGui::TableGetColumnFlags(column);

    


    

    
4566

    
    

    
            float indent_step = (float)((int)TEXT_BASE_WIDTH / 2);

    


    

    
4567

    
    

    
            for (int row = 0; row < 8; row++)

    


    

    
4568

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4569

    
    

    
                ImGui::Indent(indent_step); // Add some indentation to demonstrate usage of per-column IndentEnable/IndentDisable flags.

    


    

    
4570

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
4571

    
    

    
                for (int column = 0; column < column_count; column++)

    


    

    
4572

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
4573

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);

    


    

    
4574

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Text("%s %s", (column == 0) ? "Indented" : "Hello", ImGui::TableGetColumnName(column));

    


    

    
4575

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
4576

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
4577

    
    

    
            ImGui::Unindent(indent_step * 8.0f);

    


    

    
4578

    
    

    

    


    

    
4579

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
4580

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
4581

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
4582

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
4583

    
    

    

    


    

    
4584

    
    

    
    if (open_action != -1)

    


    

    
4585

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);

    


    

    
4586

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Columns widths");

    


    

    
4587

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Columns widths"))

    


    

    
4588

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
4589

    
    

    
        HelpMarker("Using TableSetupColumn() to setup default width.");

    


    

    
4590

    
    

    

    


    

    
4591

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags flags1 = ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize;

    


    

    
4592

    
    

    
        PushStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4593

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);

    


    

    
4594

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize);

    


    

    
4595

    
    

    
        PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4596

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags1))

    


    

    
4597

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4598

    
    

    
            // We could also set ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit on the table and all columns will default to ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed.

    


    

    
4599

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("one", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 100.0f); // Default to 100.0f

    


    

    
4600

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("two", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 200.0f); // Default to 200.0f

    


    

    
4601

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("three", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);       // Default to auto

    


    

    
4602

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableHeadersRow();

    


    

    
4603

    
    

    
            for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++)

    


    

    
4604

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4605

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
4606

    
    

    
                for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)

    


    

    
4607

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
4608

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);

    


    

    
4609

    
    

    
                    if (row == 0)

    


    

    
4610

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Text("(w: %5.1f)", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x);

    


    

    
4611

    
    

    
                    else

    


    

    
4612

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Text("Hello %d,%d", column, row);

    


    

    
4613

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
4614

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
4615

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
4616

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
4617

    
    

    

    


    

    
4618

    
    

    
        HelpMarker("Using TableSetupColumn() to setup explicit width.\n\nUnless _NoKeepColumnsVisible is set, fixed columns with set width may still be shrunk down if there's not enough space in the host.");

    


    

    
4619

    
    

    

    


    

    
4620

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags flags2 = ImGuiTableFlags_None;

    


    

    
4621

    
    

    
        PushStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4622

4623

4624

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV);

    


    

    
4625

    
    

    
        PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4626

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 4, flags2))

    


    

    
4627

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4628

4629

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 100.0f);

    


    

    
4630

4631

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30.0f);

    


    

    
4632

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 15.0f);

    


    

    
4633

    
    

    
            for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)

    


    

    
4634

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4635

4636

4637

4638

4639

4648

4649

    
    

    

    


    

    
4650

    
    

    
    if (open_action != -1)

    


    

    
4651

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);

    


    

    
4652

4663

4664

4666

    
    

    
                float rows_height = TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 2;

    


    

    
4667

4697

4698

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Row height"))

    


    

    
4699

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
4700

    
    

    
        HelpMarker("You can pass a 'min_row_height' to TableNextRow().\n\nRows are padded with 'style.CellPadding.y' on top and bottom, so effectively the minimum row height will always be >= 'style.CellPadding.y * 2.0f'.\n\nWe cannot honor a _maximum_ row height as that would require a unique clipping rectangle per row.");

    


    

    
4701

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_row_height", 1, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV))

    


    

    
4702

4704

4705

4706

4707

4717

4718

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Outer size"))

    


    

    
4719

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
4720

    
    

    
        // Showcasing use of ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX and ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY

    


    

    
4721

    
    

    
        // Important to that note how the two flags have slightly different behaviors!

    


    

    
4722

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Using NoHostExtendX and NoHostExtendY:");

    


    

    
4723

    
    

    
        PushStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4724

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX;

    


    

    
4725

4726

4727

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY);

    


    

    
4728

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Make outer height stop exactly at outer_size.y (prevent auto-extending table past the limit).\n\nOnly available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled. Data below the limit will be clipped and not visible.");

    


    

    
4729

    
    

    
        PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4730

    
    

    

    


    

    
4731

    
    

    
        ImVec2 outer_size = ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 5.5f);

    


    

    
4732

4735

4784

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Background color");

    


    

    
4785

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Background color"))

    


    

    
4786

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
4787

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg;

    


    

    
4788

    
    

    
        static int row_bg_type = 1;

    


    

    
4789

    
    

    
        static int row_bg_target = 1;

    


    

    
4790

    
    

    
        static int cell_bg_type = 1;

    


    

    
4791

    
    

    

    


    

    
4792

    
    

    
        PushStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4793

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Borders", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders);

    


    

    
4794

4795

4796

    
    

    
        ImGui::Combo("row bg type", (int*)&row_bg_type, "None\0Red\0Gradient\0");

    


    

    
4797

    
    

    
        ImGui::Combo("row bg target", (int*)&row_bg_target, "RowBg0\0RowBg1\0"); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Target RowBg0 to override the alternating odd/even colors,\nTarget RowBg1 to blend with them.");

    


    

    
4798

    
    

    
        ImGui::Combo("cell bg type", (int*)&cell_bg_type, "None\0Blue\0"); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("We are colorizing cells to B1->C2 here.");

    


    

    
4799

    
    

    
        IM_ASSERT(row_bg_type >= 0 && row_bg_type <= 2);

    


    

    
4800

    
    

    
        IM_ASSERT(row_bg_target >= 0 && row_bg_target <= 1);

    


    

    
4801

    
    

    
        IM_ASSERT(cell_bg_type >= 0 && cell_bg_type <= 1);

    


    

    
4802

    
    

    
        PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
4803

    
    

    

    


    

    
4804

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 5, flags))

    


    

    
4805

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4806

    
    

    
            for (int row = 0; row < 6; row++)

    


    

    
4807

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4808

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
4809

    
    

    

    


    

    
4810

    
    

    
                // Demonstrate setting a row background color with 'ImGui::TableSetBgColor(ImGuiTableBgTarget_RowBgX, ...)'

    


    

    
4811

    
    

    
                // We use a transparent color so we can see the one behind in case our target is RowBg1 and RowBg0 was already targeted by the ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg flag.

    


    

    
4812

    
    

    
                if (row_bg_type != 0)

    


    

    
4813

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
4814

    
    

    
                    ImU32 row_bg_color = ImGui::GetColorU32(row_bg_type == 1 ? ImVec4(0.7f, 0.3f, 0.3f, 0.65f) : ImVec4(0.2f + row * 0.1f, 0.2f, 0.2f, 0.65f)); // Flat or Gradient?

    


    

    
4815

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableSetBgColor(ImGuiTableBgTarget_RowBg0 + row_bg_target, row_bg_color);

    


    

    
4816

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
4817

    
    

    

    


    

    
4818

    
    

    
                // Fill cells

    


    

    
4819

    
    

    
                for (int column = 0; column < 5; column++)

    


    

    
4820

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
4821

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);

    


    

    
4822

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Text("%c%c", 'A' + row, '0' + column);

    


    

    
4823

    
    

    

    


    

    
4824

    
    

    
                    // Change background of Cells B1->C2

    


    

    
4825

    
    

    
                    // Demonstrate setting a cell background color with 'ImGui::TableSetBgColor(ImGuiTableBgTarget_CellBg, ...)'

    


    

    
4826

    
    

    
                    // (the CellBg color will be blended over the RowBg and ColumnBg colors)

    


    

    
4827

    
    

    
                    // We can also pass a column number as a third parameter to TableSetBgColor() and do this outside the column loop.

    


    

    
4828

    
    

    
                    if (row >= 1 && row <= 2 && column >= 1 && column <= 2 && cell_bg_type == 1)

    


    

    
4829

    
    

    
                    {

    


    

    
4830

    
    

    
                        ImU32 cell_bg_color = ImGui::GetColorU32(ImVec4(0.3f, 0.3f, 0.7f, 0.65f));

    


    

    
4831

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TableSetBgColor(ImGuiTableBgTarget_CellBg, cell_bg_color);

    


    

    
4832

    
    

    
                    }

    


    

    
4833

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
4834

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
4835

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
4836

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
4837

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
4838

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
4839

    
    

    

    


    

    
4840

    
    

    
    if (open_action != -1)

    


    

    
4841

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);

    


    

    
4842

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Tree view");

    


    

    
4843

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tree view"))

    


    

    
4844

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
4845

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody;

    


    

    
4846

    
    

    

    


    

    
4847

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("3ways", 3, flags))

    


    

    
4848

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4849

    
    

    
            // The first column will use the default _WidthStretch when ScrollX is Off and _WidthFixed when ScrollX is On

    


    

    
4850

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Name", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHide);

    


    

    
4851

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Size", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 12.0f);

    


    

    
4852

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Type", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 18.0f);

    


    

    
4853

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableHeadersRow();

    


    

    
4854

    
    

    

    


    

    
4855

    
    

    
            // Simple storage to output a dummy file-system.

    


    

    
4856

    
    

    
            struct MyTreeNode

    


    

    
4857

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4858

    
    

    
                const char*     Name;

    


    

    
4859

    
    

    
                const char*     Type;

    


    

    
4860

    
    

    
                int             Size;

    


    

    
4861

    
    

    
                int             ChildIdx;

    


    

    
4862

    
    

    
                int             ChildCount;

    


    

    
4863

    
    

    
                static void DisplayNode(const MyTreeNode* node, const MyTreeNode* all_nodes)

    


    

    
4864

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
4865

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
4866

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextColumn();

    


    

    
4867

    
    

    
                    const bool is_folder = (node->ChildCount > 0);

    


    

    
4868

    
    

    
                    if (is_folder)

    


    

    
4869

    
    

    
                    {

    


    

    
4870

    
    

    
                        bool open = ImGui::TreeNodeEx(node->Name, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth);

    


    

    
4871

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TableNextColumn();

    


    

    
4872

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TextDisabled("--");

    


    

    
4873

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TableNextColumn();

    


    

    
4874

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TextUnformatted(node->Type);

    


    

    
4875

    
    

    
                        if (open)

    


    

    
4876

    
    

    
                        {

    


    

    
4877

    
    

    
                            for (int child_n = 0; child_n < node->ChildCount; child_n++)

    


    

    
4878

    
    

    
                                DisplayNode(&all_nodes[node->ChildIdx + child_n], all_nodes);

    


    

    
4879

    
    

    
                            ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
4880

    
    

    
                        }

    


    

    
4881

    
    

    
                    }

    


    

    
4882

    
    

    
                    else

    


    

    
4883

    
    

    
                    {

    


    

    
4884

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TreeNodeEx(node->Name, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth);

    


    

    
4885

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TableNextColumn();

    


    

    
4886

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Text("%d", node->Size);

    


    

    
4887

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TableNextColumn();

    


    

    
4888

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TextUnformatted(node->Type);

    


    

    
4889

    
    

    
                    }

    


    

    
4890

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
4891

    
    

    
            };

    


    

    
4892

    
    

    
            static const MyTreeNode nodes[] =

    


    

    
4893

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4894

    
    

    
                { "Root",                         "Folder",       -1,       1, 3    }, // 0

    


    

    
4895

    
    

    
                { "Music",                        "Folder",       -1,       4, 2    }, // 1

    


    

    
4896

    
    

    
                { "Textures",                     "Folder",       -1,       6, 3    }, // 2

    


    

    
4897

    
    

    
                { "desktop.ini",                  "System file",  1024,    -1,-1    }, // 3

    


    

    
4898

    
    

    
                { "File1_a.wav",                  "Audio file",   123000,  -1,-1    }, // 4

    


    

    
4899

    
    

    
                { "File1_b.wav",                  "Audio file",   456000,  -1,-1    }, // 5

    


    

    
4900

    
    

    
                { "Image001.png",                 "Image file",   203128,  -1,-1    }, // 6

    


    

    
4901

    
    

    
                { "Copy of Image001.png",         "Image file",   203256,  -1,-1    }, // 7

    


    

    
4902

    
    

    
                { "Copy of Image001 (Final2).png","Image file",   203512,  -1,-1    }, // 8

    


    

    
4903

    
    

    
            };

    


    

    
4904

    
    

    

    


    

    
4905

    
    

    
            MyTreeNode::DisplayNode(&nodes[0], nodes);

    


    

    
4906

    
    

    

    


    

    
4907

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
4908

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
4909

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
4910

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
4911

    
    

    

    


    

    
4912

    
    

    
    if (open_action != -1)

    


    

    
4913

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);

    


    

    
4914

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Item width");

    


    

    
4915

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Item width"))

    


    

    
4916

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
4917

    
    

    
        HelpMarker(

    


    

    
4918

    
    

    
            "Showcase using PushItemWidth() and how it is preserved on a per-column basis.\n\n"

    


    

    
4919

    
    

    
            "Note that on auto-resizing non-resizable fixed columns, querying the content width for e.g. right-alignment doesn't make sense.");

    


    

    
4920

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_item_width", 3, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders))

    


    

    
4921

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4922

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("small");

    


    

    
4923

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("half");

    


    

    
4924

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("right-align");

    


    

    
4925

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableHeadersRow();

    


    

    
4926

    
    

    

    


    

    
4927

    
    

    
            for (int row = 0; row < 3; row++)

    


    

    
4928

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4929

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
4930

    
    

    
                if (row == 0)

    


    

    
4931

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
4932

    
    

    
                    // Setup ItemWidth once (instead of setting up every time, which is also possible but less efficient)

    


    

    
4933

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(0);

    


    

    
4934

    
    

    
                    ImGui::PushItemWidth(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 3.0f); // Small

    


    

    
4935

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(1);

    


    

    
4936

    
    

    
                    ImGui::PushItemWidth(-ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x * 0.5f);

    


    

    
4937

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(2);

    


    

    
4938

    
    

    
                    ImGui::PushItemWidth(-FLT_MIN); // Right-aligned

    


    

    
4939

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
4940

    
    

    

    


    

    
4941

    
    

    
                // Draw our contents

    


    

    
4942

    
    

    
                static float dummy_f = 0.0f;

    


    

    
4943

    
    

    
                ImGui::PushID(row);

    


    

    
4944

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(0);

    


    

    
4945

    
    

    
                ImGui::SliderFloat("float0", &dummy_f, 0.0f, 1.0f);

    


    

    
4946

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(1);

    


    

    
4947

    
    

    
                ImGui::SliderFloat("float1", &dummy_f, 0.0f, 1.0f);

    


    

    
4948

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(2);

    


    

    
4949

    
    

    
                ImGui::SliderFloat("##float2", &dummy_f, 0.0f, 1.0f); // No visible label since right-aligned

    


    

    
4950

    
    

    
                ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
4951

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
4952

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
4953

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
4954

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
4955

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
4956

    
    

    

    


    

    
4957

    
    

    
    // Demonstrate using TableHeader() calls instead of TableHeadersRow()

    


    

    
4958

    
    

    
    if (open_action != -1)

    


    

    
4959

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);

    


    

    
4960

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Custom headers");

    


    

    
4961

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Custom headers"))

    


    

    
4962

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
4963

    
    

    
        const int COLUMNS_COUNT = 3;

    


    

    
4964

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_custom_headers", COLUMNS_COUNT, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable))

    


    

    
4965

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
4966

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Apricot");

    


    

    
4967

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Banana");

    


    

    
4968

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Cherry");

    


    

    
4969

    
    

    

    


    

    
4970

    
    

    
            // Dummy entire-column selection storage

    


    

    
4971

    
    

    
            // FIXME: It would be nice to actually demonstrate full-featured selection using those checkbox.

    


    

    
4972

    
    

    
            static bool column_selected[3] = {};

    


    

    
4973

    
    

    

    


    

    
4974

    
    

    
            // Instead of calling TableHeadersRow() we'll submit custom headers ourselves

    


    

    
4975

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableNextRow(ImGuiTableRowFlags_Headers);

    


    

    
4976

    
    

    
            for (int column = 0; column < COLUMNS_COUNT; column++)

    


    

    
4977

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4978

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);

    


    

    
4979

    
    

    
                const char* column_name = ImGui::TableGetColumnName(column); // Retrieve name passed to TableSetupColumn()

    


    

    
4980

    
    

    
                ImGui::PushID(column);

    


    

    
4981

    
    

    
                ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(0, 0));

    


    

    
4982

    
    

    
                ImGui::Checkbox("##checkall", &column_selected[column]);

    


    

    
4983

    
    

    
                ImGui::PopStyleVar();

    


    

    
4984

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);

    


    

    
4985

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableHeader(column_name);

    


    

    
4986

    
    

    
                ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
4987

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
4988

    
    

    

    


    

    
4989

    
    

    
            for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)

    


    

    
4990

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
4991

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
4992

    
    

    
                for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)

    


    

    
4993

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
4994

    
    

    
                    char buf[32];

    


    

    
4995

    
    

    
                    sprintf(buf, "Cell %d,%d", column, row);

    


    

    
4996

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);

    


    

    
4997

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Selectable(buf, column_selected[column]);

    


    

    
4998

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
4999

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5000

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
5001

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5002

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5003

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
5004

    
    

    

    


    

    
5005

    
    

    
    // Demonstrate creating custom context menus inside columns, while playing it nice with context menus provided by TableHeadersRow()/TableHeader()

    


    

    
5006

    
    

    
    if (open_action != -1)

    


    

    
5007

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);

    


    

    
5008

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Context menus");

    


    

    
5009

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Context menus"))

    


    

    
5010

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
5011

    
    

    
        HelpMarker("By default, right-clicking over a TableHeadersRow()/TableHeader() line will open the default context-menu.\nUsing ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody we also allow right-clicking over columns body.");

    


    

    
5012

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags flags1 = ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody;

    


    

    
5013

    
    

    

    


    

    
5014

    
    

    
        PushStyleCompact();

    


    

    
5015

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody);

    


    

    
5016

    
    

    
        PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
5017

    
    

    

    


    

    
5018

    
    

    
        // Context Menus: first example

    


    

    
5019

    
    

    
        // [1.1] Right-click on the TableHeadersRow() line to open the default table context menu.

    


    

    
5020

    
    

    
        // [1.2] Right-click in columns also open the default table context menu (if ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody is set)

    


    

    
5021

    
    

    
        const int COLUMNS_COUNT = 3;

    


    

    
5022

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_context_menu", COLUMNS_COUNT, flags1))

    


    

    
5023

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5024

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");

    


    

    
5025

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");

    


    

    
5026

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");

    


    

    
5027

    
    

    

    


    

    
5028

    
    

    
            // [1.1]] Right-click on the TableHeadersRow() line to open the default table context menu.

    


    

    
5029

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableHeadersRow();

    


    

    
5030

    
    

    

    


    

    
5031

    
    

    
            // Submit dummy contents

    


    

    
5032

    
    

    
            for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++)

    


    

    
5033

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5034

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
5035

    
    

    
                for (int column = 0; column < COLUMNS_COUNT; column++)

    


    

    
5036

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
5037

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);

    


    

    
5038

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Text("Cell %d,%d", column, row);

    


    

    
5039

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
5040

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5041

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
5042

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5043

    
    

    

    


    

    
5044

    
    

    
        // Context Menus: second example

    


    

    
5045

    
    

    
        // [2.1] Right-click on the TableHeadersRow() line to open the default table context menu.

    


    

    
5046

    
    

    
        // [2.2] Right-click on the ".." to open a custom popup

    


    

    
5047

    
    

    
        // [2.3] Right-click in columns to open another custom popup

    


    

    
5048

    
    

    
        HelpMarker("Demonstrate mixing table context menu (over header), item context button (over button) and custom per-colum context menu (over column body).");

    


    

    
5049

    
    

    
        ImGuiTableFlags flags2 = ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders;

    


    

    
5050

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_context_menu_2", COLUMNS_COUNT, flags2))

    


    

    
5051

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5052

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");

    


    

    
5053

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");

    


    

    
5054

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");

    


    

    
5055

    
    

    

    


    

    
5056

    
    

    
            // [2.1] Right-click on the TableHeadersRow() line to open the default table context menu.

    


    

    
5057

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableHeadersRow();

    


    

    
5058

    
    

    
            for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++)

    


    

    
5059

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5060

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
5061

    
    

    
                for (int column = 0; column < COLUMNS_COUNT; column++)

    


    

    
5062

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
5063

    
    

    
                    // Submit dummy contents

    


    

    
5064

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);

    


    

    
5065

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Text("Cell %d,%d", column, row);

    


    

    
5066

    
    

    
                    ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
5067

    
    

    

    


    

    
5068

    
    

    
                    // [2.2] Right-click on the ".." to open a custom popup

    


    

    
5069

    
    

    
                    ImGui::PushID(row * COLUMNS_COUNT + column);

    


    

    
5070

    
    

    
                    ImGui::SmallButton("..");

    


    

    
5071

    
    

    
                    if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem())

    


    

    
5072

    
    

    
                    {

    


    

    
5073

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Text("This is the popup for Button(\"..\") in Cell %d,%d", column, row);

    


    

    
5074

    
    

    
                        if (ImGui::Button("Close"))

    


    

    
5075

    
    

    
                            ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();

    


    

    
5076

    
    

    
                        ImGui::EndPopup();

    


    

    
5077

    
    

    
                    }

    


    

    
5078

    
    

    
                    ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
5079

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
5080

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5081

    
    

    

    


    

    
5082

    
    

    
            // [2.3] Right-click anywhere in columns to open another custom popup

    


    

    
5083

    
    

    
            // (instead of testing for !IsAnyItemHovered() we could also call OpenPopup() with ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverExistingPopup

    


    

    
5084

    
    

    
            // to manage popup priority as the popups triggers, here "are we hovering a column" are overlapping)

    


    

    
5085

    
    

    
            int hovered_column = -1;

    


    

    
5086

    
    

    
            for (int column = 0; column < COLUMNS_COUNT + 1; column++)

    


    

    
5087

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5088

    
    

    
                ImGui::PushID(column);

    


    

    
5089

    
    

    
                if (ImGui::TableGetColumnFlags(column) & ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsHovered)

    


    

    
5090

    
    

    
                    hovered_column = column;

    


    

    
5091

    
    

    
                if (hovered_column == column && !ImGui::IsAnyItemHovered() && ImGui::IsMouseReleased(1))

    


    

    
5092

    
    

    
                    ImGui::OpenPopup("MyPopup");

    


    

    
5093

    
    

    
                if (ImGui::BeginPopup("MyPopup"))

    


    

    
5094

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
5095

    
    

    
                    if (column == COLUMNS_COUNT)

    


    

    
5096

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Text("This is a custom popup for unused space after the last column.");

    


    

    
5097

    
    

    
                    else

    


    

    
5098

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Text("This is a custom popup for Column %d", column);

    


    

    
5099

    
    

    
                    if (ImGui::Button("Close"))

    


    

    
5100

    
    

    
                        ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();

    


    

    
5101

    
    

    
                    ImGui::EndPopup();

    


    

    
5102

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
5103

    
    

    
                ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
5104

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5105

    
    

    

    


    

    
5106

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
5107

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Hovered column: %d", hovered_column);

    


    

    
5108

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5109

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5110

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
5111

    
    

    

    


    

    
5112

    
    

    
    // Demonstrate creating multiple tables with the same ID

    


    

    
5113

    
    

    
    if (open_action != -1)

    


    

    
5114

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);

    


    

    
5115

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Synced instances");

    


    

    
5116

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Synced instances"))

    


    

    
5117

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
5118

    
    

    
        HelpMarker("Multiple tables with the same identifier will share their settings, width, visibility, order etc.");

    


    

    
5119

    
    

    
        for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++)

    


    

    
5120

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5121

    
    

    
            char buf[32];

    


    

    
5122

    
    

    
            sprintf(buf, "Synced Table %d", n);

    


    

    
5123

    
    

    
            bool open = ImGui::CollapsingHeader(buf, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen);

    


    

    
5124
