            if (open && ImGui::BeginTable("Table", 3, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_NoSavedSettings))

    


    

    
5125

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5126

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");

    


    

    
5127

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");

    


    

    
5128

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");

    


    

    
5129

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableHeadersRow();

    


    

    
5130

    
    

    
                for (int cell = 0; cell < 9; cell++)

    


    

    
5131

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
5132

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextColumn();

    


    

    
5133

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Text("this cell %d", cell);

    


    

    
5134

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
5135

    
    

    
                ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
5136

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5137

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5138

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5139

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
5140

    
    

    

    


    

    
5141

    
    

    
    // Demonstrate using Sorting facilities

    


    

    
5142

    
    

    
    // This is a simplified version of the "Advanced" example, where we mostly focus on the code necessary to handle sorting.

    


    

    
5143

    
    

    
    // Note that the "Advanced" example also showcase manually triggering a sort (e.g. if item quantities have been modified)

    


    

    
5144

    
    

    
    static const char* template_items_names[] =

    


    

    
5145

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
5146

    
    

    
        "Banana", "Apple", "Cherry", "Watermelon", "Grapefruit", "Strawberry", "Mango",

    


    

    
5147

    
    

    
        "Kiwi", "Orange", "Pineapple", "Blueberry", "Plum", "Coconut", "Pear", "Apricot"

    


    

    
5148

    
    

    
    };

    


    

    
5149

    
    

    
    if (open_action != -1)

    


    

    
5150

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);

    


    

    
5151

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Sorting");

    


    

    
5152

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Sorting"))

    


    

    
5153

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
5154

    
    

    
        // Create item list

    


    

    
5155

    
    

    
        static ImVector<MyItem> items;

    


    

    
5156

    
    

    
        if (items.Size == 0)

    


    

    
5157

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5158

    
    

    
            items.resize(50, MyItem());

    


    

    
5159

    
    

    
            for (int n = 0; n < items.Size; n++)

    


    

    
5160

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5161

    
    

    
                const int template_n = n % IM_ARRAYSIZE(template_items_names);

    


    

    
5162

    
    

    
                MyItem& item = items[n];

    


    

    
5163

    
    

    
                item.ID = n;

    


    

    
5164

    
    

    
                item.Name = template_items_names[template_n];

    


    

    
5165

    
    

    
                item.Quantity = (n * n - n) % 20; // Assign default quantities

    


    

    
5166

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5167

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5168

    
    

    

    


    

    
5169

    
    

    
        // Options

    


    

    
5170

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags flags =

    


    

    
5171

    
    

    
            ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable | ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti

    


    

    
5172

    
    

    
            | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody

    


    

    
5173

    
    

    
            | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY;

    


    

    
5174

    
    

    
        PushStyleCompact();

    


    

    
5175

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti);

    


    

    
5176

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("When sorting is enabled: hold shift when clicking headers to sort on multiple column. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount > 1).");

    


    

    
5177

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate);

    


    

    
5178

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("When sorting is enabled: allow no sorting, disable default sorting. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount == 0).");

    


    

    
5179

    
    

    
        PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
5180

    
    

    

    


    

    
5181

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_sorting", 4, flags, ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 15), 0.0f))

    


    

    
5182

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5183

    
    

    
            // Declare columns

    


    

    
5184

    
    

    
            // We use the "user_id" parameter of TableSetupColumn() to specify a user id that will be stored in the sort specifications.

    


    

    
5185

    
    

    
            // This is so our sort function can identify a column given our own identifier. We could also identify them based on their index!

    


    

    
5186

    
    

    
            // Demonstrate using a mixture of flags among available sort-related flags:

    


    

    
5187

    
    

    
            // - ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort

    


    

    
5188

    
    

    
            // - ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort / ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortAscending / ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortDescending

    


    

    
5189

    
    

    
            // - ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortAscending / ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortDescending

    


    

    
5190

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("ID",       ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort          | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed,   0.0f, MyItemColumnID_ID);

    


    

    
5191

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Name",                                                  ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed,   0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Name);

    


    

    
5192

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Action",   ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort               | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed,   0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Action);

    


    

    
5193

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Quantity", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortDescending | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Quantity);

    


    

    
5194

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupScrollFreeze(0, 1); // Make row always visible

    


    

    
5195

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableHeadersRow();

    


    

    
5196

    
    

    

    


    

    
5197

    
    

    
            // Sort our data if sort specs have been changed!

    


    

    
5198

    
    

    
            if (ImGuiTableSortSpecs* sorts_specs = ImGui::TableGetSortSpecs())

    


    

    
5199

    
    

    
                if (sorts_specs->SpecsDirty)

    


    

    
5200

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
5201

    
    

    
                    MyItem::s_current_sort_specs = sorts_specs; // Store in variable accessible by the sort function.

    


    

    
5202

    
    

    
                    if (items.Size > 1)

    


    

    
5203

    
    

    
                        qsort(&items[0], (size_t)items.Size, sizeof(items[0]), MyItem::CompareWithSortSpecs);

    


    

    
5204

    
    

    
                    MyItem::s_current_sort_specs = NULL;

    


    

    
5205

    
    

    
                    sorts_specs->SpecsDirty = false;

    


    

    
5206

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
5207

    
    

    

    


    

    
5208

    
    

    
            // Demonstrate using clipper for large vertical lists

    


    

    
5209

    
    

    
            ImGuiListClipper clipper;

    


    

    
5210

    
    

    
            clipper.Begin(items.Size);

    


    

    
5211

    
    

    
            while (clipper.Step())

    


    

    
5212

    
    

    
                for (int row_n = clipper.DisplayStart; row_n < clipper.DisplayEnd; row_n++)

    


    

    
5213

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
5214

    
    

    
                    // Display a data item

    


    

    
5215

    
    

    
                    MyItem* item = &items[row_n];

    


    

    
5216

    
    

    
                    ImGui::PushID(item->ID);

    


    

    
5217

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
5218

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextColumn();

    


    

    
5219

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Text("%04d", item->ID);

    


    

    
5220

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextColumn();

    


    

    
5221

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TextUnformatted(item->Name);

    


    

    
5222

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextColumn();

    


    

    
5223

    
    

    
                    ImGui::SmallButton("None");

    


    

    
5224

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextColumn();

    


    

    
5225

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Text("%d", item->Quantity);

    


    

    
5226

    
    

    
                    ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
5227

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
5228

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
5229

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5230

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5231

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
5232

    
    

    

    


    

    
5233

    
    

    
    // In this example we'll expose most table flags and settings.

    


    

    
5234

    
    

    
    // For specific flags and settings refer to the corresponding section for more detailed explanation.

    


    

    
5235

    
    

    
    // This section is mostly useful to experiment with combining certain flags or settings with each others.

    


    

    
5236

    
    

    
    //ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once); // [DEBUG]

    


    

    
5237

    
    

    
    if (open_action != -1)

    


    

    
5238

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);

    


    

    
5239

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Advanced");

    


    

    
5240

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Advanced"))

    


    

    
5241

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
5242

    
    

    
        static ImGuiTableFlags flags =

    


    

    
5243

    
    

    
            ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable

    


    

    
5244

    
    

    
            | ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable | ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti

    


    

    
5245

    
    

    
            | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody

    


    

    
5246

    
    

    
            | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY

    


    

    
5247

    
    

    
            | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit;

    


    

    
5248

    
    

    

    


    

    
5249

    
    

    
        enum ContentsType { CT_Text, CT_Button, CT_SmallButton, CT_FillButton, CT_Selectable, CT_SelectableSpanRow };

    


    

    
5250

    
    

    
        static int contents_type = CT_SelectableSpanRow;

    


    

    
5251

    
    

    
        const char* contents_type_names[] = { "Text", "Button", "SmallButton", "FillButton", "Selectable", "Selectable (span row)" };

    


    

    
5252

    
    

    
        static int freeze_cols = 1;

    


    

    
5253

    
    

    
        static int freeze_rows = 1;

    


    

    
5254

    
    

    
        static int items_count = IM_ARRAYSIZE(template_items_names) * 2;

    


    

    
5255

    
    

    
        static ImVec2 outer_size_value = ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 12);

    


    

    
5256

    
    

    
        static float row_min_height = 0.0f; // Auto

    


    

    
5257

    
    

    
        static float inner_width_with_scroll = 0.0f; // Auto-extend

    


    

    
5258

    
    

    
        static bool outer_size_enabled = true;

    


    

    
5259

    
    

    
        static bool show_headers = true;

    


    

    
5260

    
    

    
        static bool show_wrapped_text = false;

    


    

    
5261

    
    

    
        //static ImGuiTextFilter filter;

    


    

    
5262

    
    

    
        //ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once); // FIXME-TABLE: Enabling this results in initial clipped first pass on table which tend to affect column sizing

    


    

    
5263

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::TreeNode("Options"))

    


    

    
5264

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5265

    
    

    
            // Make the UI compact because there are so many fields

    


    

    
5266

    
    

    
            PushStyleCompact();

    


    

    
5267

    
    

    
            ImGui::PushItemWidth(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 28.0f);

    


    

    
5268

    
    

    

    


    

    
5269

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Features:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))

    


    

    
5270

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5271

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);

    


    

    
5272

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable);

    


    

    
5273

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable);

    


    

    
5274

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable);

    


    

    
5275

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoSavedSettings", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoSavedSettings);

    


    

    
5276

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody);

    


    

    
5277

    
    

    
                ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5278

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5279

    
    

    

    


    

    
5280

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Decorations:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))

    


    

    
5281

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5282

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg);

    


    

    
5283

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV);

    


    

    
5284

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV);

    


    

    
5285

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV);

    


    

    
5286

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH);

    


    

    
5287

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH);

    


    

    
5288

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH);

    


    

    
5289

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable vertical borders in columns Body (borders will always appear in Headers");

    


    

    
5290

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable vertical borders in columns Body until hovered for resize (borders will always appear in Headers)");

    


    

    
5291

    
    

    
                ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5292

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5293

    
    

    

    


    

    
5294

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Sizing:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))

    


    

    
5295

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5296

    
    

    
                EditTableSizingFlags(&flags);

    


    

    
5297

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("In the Advanced demo we override the policy of each column so those table-wide settings have less effect that typical.");

    


    

    
5298

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX);

    


    

    
5299

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Make outer width auto-fit to columns, overriding outer_size.x value.\n\nOnly available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled and Stretch columns are not used.");

    


    

    
5300

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY);

    


    

    
5301

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Make outer height stop exactly at outer_size.y (prevent auto-extending table past the limit).\n\nOnly available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled. Data below the limit will be clipped and not visible.");

    


    

    
5302

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible);

    


    

    
5303

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Only available if ScrollX is disabled.");

    


    

    
5304

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_PreciseWidths", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_PreciseWidths);

    


    

    
5305

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable distributing remainder width to stretched columns (width allocation on a 100-wide table with 3 columns: Without this flag: 33,33,34. With this flag: 33,33,33). With larger number of columns, resizing will appear to be less smooth.");

    


    

    
5306

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoClip", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoClip);

    


    

    
5307

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable clipping rectangle for every individual columns (reduce draw command count, items will be able to overflow into other columns). Generally incompatible with ScrollFreeze options.");

    


    

    
5308

    
    

    
                ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5309

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5310

    
    

    

    


    

    
5311

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Padding:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))

    


    

    
5312

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5313

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_PadOuterX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_PadOuterX);

    


    

    
5314

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX);

    


    

    
5315

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadInnerX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadInnerX);

    


    

    
5316

    
    

    
                ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5317

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5318

    
    

    

    


    

    
5319

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Scrolling:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))

    


    

    
5320

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5321

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX);

    


    

    
5322

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
5323

    
    

    
                ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFrameHeight());

    


    

    
5324

    
    

    
                ImGui::DragInt("freeze_cols", &freeze_cols, 0.2f, 0, 9, NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput);

    


    

    
5325

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY);

    


    

    
5326

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
5327

    
    

    
                ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFrameHeight());

    


    

    
5328

    
    

    
                ImGui::DragInt("freeze_rows", &freeze_rows, 0.2f, 0, 9, NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput);

    


    

    
5329

    
    

    
                ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5330

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5331

    
    

    

    


    

    
5332

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Sorting:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))

    


    

    
5333

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5334

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti);

    


    

    
5335

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("When sorting is enabled: hold shift when clicking headers to sort on multiple column. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount > 1).");

    


    

    
5336

    
    

    
                ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate);

    


    

    
5337

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("When sorting is enabled: allow no sorting, disable default sorting. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount == 0).");

    


    

    
5338

    
    

    
                ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5339

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5340

    
    

    

    


    

    
5341

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Other:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))

    


    

    
5342

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5343

    
    

    
                ImGui::Checkbox("show_headers", &show_headers);

    


    

    
5344

    
    

    
                ImGui::Checkbox("show_wrapped_text", &show_wrapped_text);

    


    

    
5345

    
    

    

    


    

    
5346

    
    

    
                ImGui::DragFloat2("##OuterSize", &outer_size_value.x);

    


    

    
5347

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);

    


    

    
5348

    
    

    
                ImGui::Checkbox("outer_size", &outer_size_enabled);

    


    

    
5349

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
5350

    
    

    
                HelpMarker("If scrolling is disabled (ScrollX and ScrollY not set):\n"

    


    

    
5351

    
    

    
                    "- The table is output directly in the parent window.\n"

    


    

    
5352

    
    

    
                    "- OuterSize.x < 0.0f will right-align the table.\n"

    


    

    
5353

    
    

    
                    "- OuterSize.x = 0.0f will narrow fit the table unless there are any Stretch columns.\n"

    


    

    
5354

    
    

    
                    "- OuterSize.y then becomes the minimum size for the table, which will extend vertically if there are more rows (unless NoHostExtendY is set).");

    


    

    
5355

    
    

    

    


    

    
5356

    
    

    
                // From a user point of view we will tend to use 'inner_width' differently depending on whether our table is embedding scrolling.

    


    

    
5357

    
    

    
                // To facilitate toying with this demo we will actually pass 0.0f to the BeginTable() when ScrollX is disabled.

    


    

    
5358

    
    

    
                ImGui::DragFloat("inner_width (when ScrollX active)", &inner_width_with_scroll, 1.0f, 0.0f, FLT_MAX);

    


    

    
5359

    
    

    

    


    

    
5360

    
    

    
                ImGui::DragFloat("row_min_height", &row_min_height, 1.0f, 0.0f, FLT_MAX);

    


    

    
5361

    
    

    
                ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Specify height of the Selectable item.");

    


    

    
5362

    
    

    

    


    

    
5363

    
    

    
                ImGui::DragInt("items_count", &items_count, 0.1f, 0, 9999);

    


    

    
5364

    
    

    
                ImGui::Combo("items_type (first column)", &contents_type, contents_type_names, IM_ARRAYSIZE(contents_type_names));

    


    

    
5365

    
    

    
                //filter.Draw("filter");

    


    

    
5366

    
    

    
                ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5367

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5368

    
    

    

    


    

    
5369

    
    

    
            ImGui::PopItemWidth();

    


    

    
5370

    
    

    
            PopStyleCompact();

    


    

    
5371

    
    

    
            ImGui::Spacing();

    


    

    
5372

    
    

    
            ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5373

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5374

    
    

    

    


    

    
5375

    
    

    
        // Update item list if we changed the number of items

    


    

    
5376

    
    

    
        static ImVector<MyItem> items;

    


    

    
5377

    
    

    
        static ImVector<int> selection;

    


    

    
5378

    
    

    
        static bool items_need_sort = false;

    


    

    
5379

    
    

    
        if (items.Size != items_count)

    


    

    
5380

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5381

    
    

    
            items.resize(items_count, MyItem());

    


    

    
5382

    
    

    
            for (int n = 0; n < items_count; n++)

    


    

    
5383

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5384

    
    

    
                const int template_n = n % IM_ARRAYSIZE(template_items_names);

    


    

    
5385

    
    

    
                MyItem& item = items[n];

    


    

    
5386

    
    

    
                item.ID = n;

    


    

    
5387

    
    

    
                item.Name = template_items_names[template_n];

    


    

    
5388

    
    

    
                item.Quantity = (template_n == 3) ? 10 : (template_n == 4) ? 20 : 0; // Assign default quantities

    


    

    
5389

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5390

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5391

    
    

    

    


    

    
5392

    
    

    
        const ImDrawList* parent_draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();

    


    

    
5393

    
    

    
        const int parent_draw_list_draw_cmd_count = parent_draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size;

    


    

    
5394

    
    

    
        ImVec2 table_scroll_cur, table_scroll_max; // For debug display

    


    

    
5395

    
    

    
        const ImDrawList* table_draw_list = NULL;  // "

    


    

    
5396

    
    

    

    


    

    
5397

    
    

    
        // Submit table

    


    

    
5398

    
    

    
        const float inner_width_to_use = (flags & ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX) ? inner_width_with_scroll : 0.0f;

    


    

    
5399

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_advanced", 6, flags, outer_size_enabled ? outer_size_value : ImVec2(0, 0), inner_width_to_use))

    


    

    
5400

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5401

    
    

    
            // Declare columns

    


    

    
5402

    
    

    
            // We use the "user_id" parameter of TableSetupColumn() to specify a user id that will be stored in the sort specifications.

    


    

    
5403

    
    

    
            // This is so our sort function can identify a column given our own identifier. We could also identify them based on their index!

    


    

    
5404

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("ID",           ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHide, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_ID);

    


    

    
5405

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Name",         ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Name);

    


    

    
5406

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Action",       ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Action);

    


    

    
5407

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Quantity",     ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortDescending, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Quantity);

    


    

    
5408

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Description",  (flags & ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX) ? 0 : ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Description);

    


    

    
5409

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Hidden",       ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort);

    


    

    
5410

    
    

    
            ImGui::TableSetupScrollFreeze(freeze_cols, freeze_rows);

    


    

    
5411

    
    

    

    


    

    
5412

    
    

    
            // Sort our data if sort specs have been changed!

    


    

    
5413

    
    

    
            ImGuiTableSortSpecs* sorts_specs = ImGui::TableGetSortSpecs();

    


    

    
5414

    
    

    
            if (sorts_specs && sorts_specs->SpecsDirty)

    


    

    
5415

    
    

    
                items_need_sort = true;

    


    

    
5416

    
    

    
            if (sorts_specs && items_need_sort && items.Size > 1)

    


    

    
5417

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5418

    
    

    
                MyItem::s_current_sort_specs = sorts_specs; // Store in variable accessible by the sort function.

    


    

    
5419

    
    

    
                qsort(&items[0], (size_t)items.Size, sizeof(items[0]), MyItem::CompareWithSortSpecs);

    


    

    
5420

    
    

    
                MyItem::s_current_sort_specs = NULL;

    


    

    
5421

    
    

    
                sorts_specs->SpecsDirty = false;

    


    

    
5422

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5423

    
    

    
            items_need_sort = false;

    


    

    
5424

    
    

    

    


    

    
5425

    
    

    
            // Take note of whether we are currently sorting based on the Quantity field,

    


    

    
5426

    
    

    
            // we will use this to trigger sorting when we know the data of this column has been modified.

    


    

    
5427

    
    

    
            const bool sorts_specs_using_quantity = (ImGui::TableGetColumnFlags(3) & ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsSorted) != 0;

    


    

    
5428

    
    

    

    


    

    
5429

    
    

    
            // Show headers

    


    

    
5430

    
    

    
            if (show_headers)

    


    

    
5431

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableHeadersRow();

    


    

    
5432

    
    

    

    


    

    
5433

    
    

    
            // Show data

    


    

    
5434

    
    

    
            // FIXME-TABLE FIXME-NAV: How we can get decent up/down even though we have the buttons here?

    


    

    
5435

    
    

    
            ImGui::PushButtonRepeat(true);

    


    

    
5436

    
    

    
#if 1

    


    

    
5437

    
    

    
            // Demonstrate using clipper for large vertical lists

    


    

    
5438

    
    

    
            ImGuiListClipper clipper;

    


    

    
5439

    
    

    
            clipper.Begin(items.Size);

    


    

    
5440

    
    

    
            while (clipper.Step())

    


    

    
5441

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5442

    
    

    
                for (int row_n = clipper.DisplayStart; row_n < clipper.DisplayEnd; row_n++)

    


    

    
5443

    
    

    
#else

    


    

    
5444

    
    

    
            // Without clipper

    


    

    
5445

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5446

    
    

    
                for (int row_n = 0; row_n < items.Size; row_n++)

    


    

    
5447

    
    

    
#endif

    


    

    
5448

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
5449

    
    

    
                    MyItem* item = &items[row_n];

    


    

    
5450

    
    

    
                    //if (!filter.PassFilter(item->Name))

    


    

    
5451

    
    

    
                    //    continue;

    


    

    
5452

    
    

    

    


    

    
5453

    
    

    
                    const bool item_is_selected = selection.contains(item->ID);

    


    

    
5454

    
    

    
                    ImGui::PushID(item->ID);

    


    

    
5455

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableNextRow(ImGuiTableRowFlags_None, row_min_height);

    


    

    
5456

    
    

    

    


    

    
5457

    
    

    
                    // For the demo purpose we can select among different type of items submitted in the first column

    


    

    
5458

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(0);

    


    

    
5459

    
    

    
                    char label[32];

    


    

    
5460

    
    

    
                    sprintf(label, "%04d", item->ID);

    


    

    
5461

    
    

    
                    if (contents_type == CT_Text)

    


    

    
5462

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TextUnformatted(label);

    


    

    
5463

    
    

    
                    else if (contents_type == CT_Button)

    


    

    
5464

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Button(label);

    


    

    
5465

    
    

    
                    else if (contents_type == CT_SmallButton)

    


    

    
5466

    
    

    
                        ImGui::SmallButton(label);

    


    

    
5467

    
    

    
                    else if (contents_type == CT_FillButton)

    


    

    
5468

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Button(label, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f));

    


    

    
5469

    
    

    
                    else if (contents_type == CT_Selectable || contents_type == CT_SelectableSpanRow)

    


    

    
5470

    
    

    
                    {

    


    

    
5471

    
    

    
                        ImGuiSelectableFlags selectable_flags = (contents_type == CT_SelectableSpanRow) ? ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns | ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowItemOverlap : ImGuiSelectableFlags_None;

    


    

    
5472

    
    

    
                        if (ImGui::Selectable(label, item_is_selected, selectable_flags, ImVec2(0, row_min_height)))

    


    

    
5473

    
    

    
                        {

    


    

    
5474

    
    

    
                            if (ImGui::GetIO().KeyCtrl)

    


    

    
5475

    
    

    
                            {

    


    

    
5476

    
    

    
                                if (item_is_selected)

    


    

    
5477

    
    

    
                                    selection.find_erase_unsorted(item->ID);

    


    

    
5478

    
    

    
                                else

    


    

    
5479

    
    

    
                                    selection.push_back(item->ID);

    


    

    
5480

    
    

    
                            }

    


    

    
5481

    
    

    
                            else

    


    

    
5482

    
    

    
                            {

    


    

    
5483

    
    

    
                                selection.clear();

    


    

    
5484

    
    

    
                                selection.push_back(item->ID);

    


    

    
5485

    
    

    
                            }

    


    

    
5486

    
    

    
                        }

    


    

    
5487

    
    

    
                    }

    


    

    
5488

    
    

    

    


    

    
5489

    
    

    
                    if (ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(1))

    


    

    
5490

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TextUnformatted(item->Name);

    


    

    
5491

    
    

    

    


    

    
5492

    
    

    
                    // Here we demonstrate marking our data set as needing to be sorted again if we modified a quantity,

    


    

    
5493

    
    

    
                    // and we are currently sorting on the column showing the Quantity.

    


    

    
5494

    
    

    
                    // To avoid triggering a sort while holding the button, we only trigger it when the button has been released.

    


    

    
5495

    
    

    
                    // You will probably need a more advanced system in your code if you want to automatically sort when a specific entry changes.

    


    

    
5496

    
    

    
                    if (ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(2))

    


    

    
5497

    
    

    
                    {

    


    

    
5498

    
    

    
                        if (ImGui::SmallButton("Chop")) { item->Quantity += 1; }

    


    

    
5499

    
    

    
                        if (sorts_specs_using_quantity && ImGui::IsItemDeactivated()) { items_need_sort = true; }

    


    

    
5500

    
    

    
                        ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
5501

    
    

    
                        if (ImGui::SmallButton("Eat")) { item->Quantity -= 1; }

    


    

    
5502

    
    

    
                        if (sorts_specs_using_quantity && ImGui::IsItemDeactivated()) { items_need_sort = true; }

    


    

    
5503

    
    

    
                    }

    


    

    
5504

    
    

    

    


    

    
5505

    
    

    
                    if (ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(3))

    


    

    
5506

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Text("%d", item->Quantity);

    


    

    
5507

    
    

    

    


    

    
5508

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(4);

    


    

    
5509

    
    

    
                    if (show_wrapped_text)

    


    

    
5510

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TextWrapped("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet");

    


    

    
5511

    
    

    
                    else

    


    

    
5512

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Text("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet");

    


    

    
5513

    
    

    

    


    

    
5514

    
    

    
                    if (ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(5))

    


    

    
5515

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Text("1234");

    


    

    
5516

    
    

    

    


    

    
5517

    
    

    
                    ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
5518

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
5519

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5520

    
    

    
            ImGui::PopButtonRepeat();

    


    

    
5521

    
    

    

    


    

    
5522

    
    

    
            // Store some info to display debug details below

    


    

    
5523

    
    

    
            table_scroll_cur = ImVec2(ImGui::GetScrollX(), ImGui::GetScrollY());

    


    

    
5524

    
    

    
            table_scroll_max = ImVec2(ImGui::GetScrollMaxX(), ImGui::GetScrollMaxY());

    


    

    
5525

    
    

    
            table_draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();

    


    

    
5526

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
5527

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5528

    
    

    
        static bool show_debug_details = false;

    


    

    
5529

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("Debug details", &show_debug_details);

    


    

    
5530

    
    

    
        if (show_debug_details && table_draw_list)

    


    

    
5531

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5532

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, 0.0f);

    


    

    
5533

    
    

    
            const int table_draw_list_draw_cmd_count = table_draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size;

    


    

    
5534

    
    

    
            if (table_draw_list == parent_draw_list)

    


    

    
5535

    
    

    
                ImGui::Text(": DrawCmd: +%d (in same window)",

    


    

    
5536

    
    

    
                    table_draw_list_draw_cmd_count - parent_draw_list_draw_cmd_count);

    


    

    
5537

    
    

    
            else

    


    

    
5538

    
    

    
                ImGui::Text(": DrawCmd: +%d (in child window), Scroll: (%.f/%.f) (%.f/%.f)",

    


    

    
5539

    
    

    
                    table_draw_list_draw_cmd_count - 1, table_scroll_cur.x, table_scroll_max.x, table_scroll_cur.y, table_scroll_max.y);

    


    

    
5540

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5541

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5542

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
5543

    
    

    

    


    

    
5544

    
    

    
    ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
5545

    
    

    

    


    

    
5546

    
    

    
    ShowDemoWindowColumns();

    


    

    
5547

    
    

    

    


    

    
5548

    
    

    
    if (disable_indent)

    


    

    
5549

    
    

    
        ImGui::PopStyleVar();

    


    

    
5550

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
5551

    
    

    

    


    

    
5552

    
    

    
// Demonstrate old/legacy Columns API!

    


    

    
5553

    
    

    
// [2020: Columns are under-featured and not maintained. Prefer using the more flexible and powerful BeginTable() API!]

    


    

    
5554

    
    

    
static void ShowDemoWindowColumns()

    


    

    
5555

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
5556

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)");

    


    

    
5557

    
    

    
    bool open = ImGui::TreeNode("Legacy Columns API");

    


    

    
5558

    
    

    
    ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
5559

    
    

    
    HelpMarker("Columns() is an old API! Prefer using the more flexible and powerful BeginTable() API!");

    


    

    
5560

    
    

    
    if (!open)

    


    

    
5561

    
    

    
        return;

    


    

    
5562

    
    

    

    


    

    
5563

    
    

    
    // Basic columns

    


    

    
5564

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)/Basic");

    


    

    
5565

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Basic"))

    


    

    
5566

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
5567

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Without border:");

    


    

    
5568

    
    

    
        ImGui::Columns(3, "mycolumns3", false);  // 3-ways, no border

    


    

    
5569

    
    

    
        ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
5570

    
    

    
        for (int n = 0; n < 14; n++)

    


    

    
5571

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5572

    
    

    
            char label[32];

    


    

    
5573

    
    

    
            sprintf(label, "Item %d", n);

    


    

    
5574

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::Selectable(label)) {}

    


    

    
5575

    
    

    
            //if (ImGui::Button(label, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN,0.0f))) {}

    


    

    
5576

    
    

    
            ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5577

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5578

    
    

    
        ImGui::Columns(1);

    


    

    
5579

    
    

    
        ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
5580

    
    

    

    


    

    
5581

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("With border:");

    


    

    
5582

    
    

    
        ImGui::Columns(4, "mycolumns"); // 4-ways, with border

    


    

    
5583

    
    

    
        ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
5584

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("ID"); ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5585

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Name"); ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5586

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Path"); ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5587

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Hovered"); ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5588

    
    

    
        ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
5589

    
    

    
        const char* names[3] = { "One", "Two", "Three" };

    


    

    
5590

    
    

    
        const char* paths[3] = { "/path/one", "/path/two", "/path/three" };

    


    

    
5591

    
    

    
        static int selected = -1;

    


    

    
5592

    
    

    
        for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)

    


    

    
5593

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5594

    
    

    
            char label[32];

    


    

    
5595

    
    

    
            sprintf(label, "%04d", i);

    


    

    
5596

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::Selectable(label, selected == i, ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns))

    


    

    
5597

    
    

    
                selected = i;

    


    

    
5598

    
    

    
            bool hovered = ImGui::IsItemHovered();

    


    

    
5599

    
    

    
            ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5600

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text(names[i]); ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5601

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text(paths[i]); ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5602

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("%d", hovered); ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5603

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5604

    
    

    
        ImGui::Columns(1);

    


    

    
5605

    
    

    
        ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
5606

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5607

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
5608

    
    

    

    


    

    
5609

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)/Borders");

    


    

    
5610

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Borders"))

    


    

    
5611

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
5612

    
    

    
        // NB: Future columns API should allow automatic horizontal borders.

    


    

    
5613

    
    

    
        static bool h_borders = true;

    


    

    
5614

    
    

    
        static bool v_borders = true;

    


    

    
5615

    
    

    
        static int columns_count = 4;

    


    

    
5616

    
    

    
        const int lines_count = 3;

    


    

    
5617

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 8);

    


    

    
5618

    
    

    
        ImGui::DragInt("##columns_count", &columns_count, 0.1f, 2, 10, "%d columns");

    


    

    
5619

    
    

    
        if (columns_count < 2)

    


    

    
5620

    
    

    
            columns_count = 2;

    


    

    
5621

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
5622

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("horizontal", &h_borders);

    


    

    
5623

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
5624

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("vertical", &v_borders);

    


    

    
5625

    
    

    
        ImGui::Columns(columns_count, NULL, v_borders);

    


    

    
5626

    
    

    
        for (int i = 0; i < columns_count * lines_count; i++)

    


    

    
5627

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5628

    
    

    
            if (h_borders && ImGui::GetColumnIndex() == 0)

    


    

    
5629

    
    

    
                ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
5630

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("%c%c%c", 'a' + i, 'a' + i, 'a' + i);

    


    

    
5631

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Width %.2f", ImGui::GetColumnWidth());

    


    

    
5632

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Avail %.2f", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x);

    


    

    
5633

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Offset %.2f", ImGui::GetColumnOffset());

    


    

    
5634

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Long text that is likely to clip");

    


    

    
5635

    
    

    
            ImGui::Button("Button", ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f));

    


    

    
5636

    
    

    
            ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5637

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5638

    
    

    
        ImGui::Columns(1);

    


    

    
5639

    
    

    
        if (h_borders)

    


    

    
5640

    
    

    
            ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
5641

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5642

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
5643

    
    

    

    


    

    
5644

    
    

    
    // Create multiple items in a same cell before switching to next column

    


    

    
5645

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)/Mixed items");

    


    

    
5646

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Mixed items"))

    


    

    
5647

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
5648

    
    

    
        ImGui::Columns(3, "mixed");

    


    

    
5649

    
    

    
        ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
5650

    
    

    

    


    

    
5651

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Hello");

    


    

    
5652

    
    

    
        ImGui::Button("Banana");

    


    

    
5653

    
    

    
        ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5654

    
    

    

    


    

    
5655

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("ImGui");

    


    

    
5656

    
    

    
        ImGui::Button("Apple");

    


    

    
5657

    
    

    
        static float foo = 1.0f;

    


    

    
5658

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputFloat("red", &foo, 0.05f, 0, "%.3f");

    


    

    
5659

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("An extra line here.");

    


    

    
5660

    
    

    
        ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5661

    
    

    

    


    

    
5662

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Sailor");

    


    

    
5663

    
    

    
        ImGui::Button("Corniflower");

    


    

    
5664

    
    

    
        static float bar = 1.0f;

    


    

    
5665

    
    

    
        ImGui::InputFloat("blue", &bar, 0.05f, 0, "%.3f");

    


    

    
5666

    
    

    
        ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5667

    
    

    

    


    

    
5668

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Category A")) { ImGui::Text("Blah blah blah"); } ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5669

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Category B")) { ImGui::Text("Blah blah blah"); } ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5670

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Category C")) { ImGui::Text("Blah blah blah"); } ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5671

    
    

    
        ImGui::Columns(1);

    


    

    
5672

    
    

    
        ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
5673

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5674

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
5675

    
    

    

    


    

    
5676

    
    

    
    // Word wrapping

    


    

    
5677

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)/Word-wrapping");

    


    

    
5678

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Word-wrapping"))

    


    

    
5679

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
5680

    
    

    
        ImGui::Columns(2, "word-wrapping");

    


    

    
5681

    
    

    
        ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
5682

    
    

    
        ImGui::TextWrapped("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.");

    


    

    
5683

    
    

    
        ImGui::TextWrapped("Hello Left");

    


    

    
5684

    
    

    
        ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5685

    
    

    
        ImGui::TextWrapped("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.");

    


    

    
5686

    
    

    
        ImGui::TextWrapped("Hello Right");

    


    

    
5687

    
    

    
        ImGui::Columns(1);

    


    

    
5688

    
    

    
        ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
5689

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5690

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
5691

    
    

    

    


    

    
5692

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)/Horizontal Scrolling");

    


    

    
5693

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Horizontal Scrolling"))

    


    

    
5694

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
5695

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(1500.0f, 0.0f));

    


    

    
5696

    
    

    
        ImVec2 child_size = ImVec2(0, ImGui::GetFontSize() * 20.0f);

    


    

    
5697

    
    

    
        ImGui::BeginChild("##ScrollingRegion", child_size, false, ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar);

    


    

    
5698

    
    

    
        ImGui::Columns(10);

    


    

    
5699

    
    

    

    


    

    
5700

    
    

    
        // Also demonstrate using clipper for large vertical lists

    


    

    
5701

    
    

    
        int ITEMS_COUNT = 2000;

    


    

    
5702

    
    

    
        ImGuiListClipper clipper;

    


    

    
5703

    
    

    
        clipper.Begin(ITEMS_COUNT);

    


    

    
5704

    
    

    
        while (clipper.Step())

    


    

    
5705

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5706

    
    

    
            for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)

    


    

    
5707

    
    

    
                for (int j = 0; j < 10; j++)

    


    

    
5708

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
5709

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Text("Line %d Column %d...", i, j);

    


    

    
5710

    
    

    
                    ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5711

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
5712

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5713

    
    

    
        ImGui::Columns(1);

    


    

    
5714

    
    

    
        ImGui::EndChild();

    


    

    
5715

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5716

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
5717

    
    

    

    


    

    
5718

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)/Tree");

    


    

    
5719

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tree"))

    


    

    
5720

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
5721

    
    

    
        ImGui::Columns(2, "tree", true);

    


    

    
5722

    
    

    
        for (int x = 0; x < 3; x++)

    


    

    
5723

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5724

    
    

    
            bool open1 = ImGui::TreeNode((void*)(intptr_t)x, "Node%d", x);

    


    

    
5725

    
    

    
            ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5726

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Node contents");

    


    

    
5727

    
    

    
            ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5728

    
    

    
            if (open1)

    


    

    
5729

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5730

    
    

    
                for (int y = 0; y < 3; y++)

    


    

    
5731

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
5732

    
    

    
                    bool open2 = ImGui::TreeNode((void*)(intptr_t)y, "Node%d.%d", x, y);

    


    

    
5733

    
    

    
                    ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5734

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Text("Node contents");

    


    

    
5735

    
    

    
                    if (open2)

    


    

    
5736

    
    

    
                    {

    


    

    
5737

    
    

    
                        ImGui::Text("Even more contents");

    


    

    
5738

    
    

    
                        if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tree in column"))

    


    

    
5739

    
    

    
                        {

    


    

    
5740

    
    

    
                            ImGui::Text("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog");

    


    

    
5741

    
    

    
                            ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5742

    
    

    
                        }

    


    

    
5743

    
    

    
                    }

    


    

    
5744

    
    

    
                    ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
5745

    
    

    
                    if (open2)

    


    

    
5746

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5747

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
5748

    
    

    
                ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5749

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5750

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5751

    
    

    
        ImGui::Columns(1);

    


    

    
5752

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5753

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
5754

    
    

    

    


    

    
5755

    
    

    
    ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5756

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
5757

    
    

    

    


    

    
5758

    
    

    
namespace ImGui { extern ImGuiKeyData* GetKeyData(ImGuiKey key); }

    


    

    
5759

    
    

    

    


    

    
5760

    
    

    
static void ShowDemoWindowInputs()

    


    

    
5761

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
5762

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs, Navigation & Focus");

    


    

    
5763

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Inputs, Navigation & Focus"))

    


    

    
5764

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
5765

    
    

    
        ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();

    


    

    
5766

    
    

    

    


    

    
5767

    
    

    
        // Display ImGuiIO output flags

    


    

    
5768

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs, Navigation & Focus/Output");

    


    

    
5769

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once);

    


    

    
5770

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::TreeNode("Output"))

    


    

    
5771

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5772

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("io.WantCaptureMouse: %d", io.WantCaptureMouse);

    


    

    
5773

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("io.WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose: %d", io.WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose);

    


    

    
5774

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("io.WantCaptureKeyboard: %d", io.WantCaptureKeyboard);

    


    

    
5775

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("io.WantTextInput: %d", io.WantTextInput);

    


    

    
5776

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("io.WantSetMousePos: %d", io.WantSetMousePos);

    


    

    
5777

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("io.NavActive: %d, io.NavVisible: %d", io.NavActive, io.NavVisible);

    


    

    
5778

    
    

    
            ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5779

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5780

    
    

    

    


    

    
5781

    
    

    
        // Display Mouse state

    


    

    
5782

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs, Navigation & Focus/Mouse State");

    


    

    
5783

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::TreeNode("Mouse State"))

    


    

    
5784

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5785

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::IsMousePosValid())

    


    

    
5786

    
    

    
                ImGui::Text("Mouse pos: (%g, %g)", io.MousePos.x, io.MousePos.y);

    


    

    
5787

    
    

    
            else

    


    

    
5788

    
    

    
                ImGui::Text("Mouse pos: <INVALID>");

    


    

    
5789

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Mouse delta: (%g, %g)", io.MouseDelta.x, io.MouseDelta.y);

    


    

    
5790

    
    

    

    


    

    
5791

    
    

    
            int count = IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown);

    


    

    
5792

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Mouse down:");         for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) if (ImGui::IsMouseDown(i))      { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("b%d (%.02f secs)", i, io.MouseDownDuration[i]); }

    


    

    
5793

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Mouse clicked:");      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) if (ImGui::IsMouseClicked(i))   { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("b%d (%d)", i, ImGui::GetMouseClickedCount(i)); }

    


    

    
5794

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Mouse released:");     for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) if (ImGui::IsMouseReleased(i))  { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("b%d", i); }

    


    

    
5795

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Mouse wheel: %.1f", io.MouseWheel);

    


    

    
5796

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Pen Pressure: %.1f", io.PenPressure); // Note: currently unused

    


    

    
5797

    
    

    
            ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5798

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5799

    
    

    

    


    

    
5800

    
    

    
        // Display mouse cursors

    


    

    
5801

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs, Navigation & Focus/Mouse Cursors");

    


    

    
5802

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::TreeNode("Mouse Cursors"))

    


    

    
5803

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5804

    
    

    
            const char* mouse_cursors_names[] = { "Arrow", "TextInput", "ResizeAll", "ResizeNS", "ResizeEW", "ResizeNESW", "ResizeNWSE", "Hand", "NotAllowed" };

    


    

    
5805

    
    

    
            IM_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(mouse_cursors_names) == ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT);

    


    

    
5806

    
    

    

    


    

    
5807

    
    

    
            ImGuiMouseCursor current = ImGui::GetMouseCursor();

    


    

    
5808

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Current mouse cursor = %d: %s", current, mouse_cursors_names[current]);

    


    

    
5809

    
    

    
            ImGui::BeginDisabled(true);

    


    

    
5810

    
    

    
            ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: HasMouseCursors", &io.BackendFlags, ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors);

    


    

    
5811

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndDisabled();

    


    

    
5812

    
    

    

    


    

    
5813

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Hover to see mouse cursors:");

    


    

    
5814

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(

    


    

    
5815

    
    

    
                "Your application can render a different mouse cursor based on what ImGui::GetMouseCursor() returns. "

    


    

    
5816

    
    

    
                "If software cursor rendering (io.MouseDrawCursor) is set ImGui will draw the right cursor for you, "

    


    

    
5817

    
    

    
                "otherwise your backend needs to handle it.");

    


    

    
5818

    
    

    
            for (int i = 0; i < ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT; i++)

    


    

    
5819

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5820

    
    

    
                char label[32];

    


    

    
5821

    
    

    
                sprintf(label, "Mouse cursor %d: %s", i, mouse_cursors_names[i]);

    


    

    
5822

    
    

    
                ImGui::Bullet(); ImGui::Selectable(label, false);

    


    

    
5823

    
    

    
                if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())

    


    

    
5824

    
    

    
                    ImGui::SetMouseCursor(i);

    


    

    
5825

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5826

    
    

    
            ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5827

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5828

    
    

    

    


    

    
5829

    
    

    
        // Display Keyboard/Mouse state

    


    

    
5830

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs, Navigation & Focus/Keyboard, Gamepad & Navigation State");

    


    

    
5831

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::TreeNode("Keyboard, Gamepad & Navigation State"))

    


    

    
5832

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5833

    
    

    
            // We iterate both legacy native range and named ImGuiKey ranges, which is a little odd but this allows displaying the data for old/new backends.

    


    

    
5834

    
    

    
            // User code should never have to go through such hoops: old code may use native keycodes, new code may use ImGuiKey codes.

    


    

    
5835

    
    

    
#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO

    


    

    
5836

    
    

    
            struct funcs { static bool IsLegacyNativeDupe(ImGuiKey) { return false; } };

    


    

    
5837

    
    

    
            const ImGuiKey key_first = (ImGuiKey)ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN;

    


    

    
5838

    
    

    
#else

    


    

    
5839

    
    

    
            struct funcs { static bool IsLegacyNativeDupe(ImGuiKey key) { return key < 512 && ImGui::GetIO().KeyMap[key] != -1; } }; // Hide Native<>ImGuiKey duplicates when both exists in the array

    


    

    
5840

    
    

    
            const ImGuiKey key_first = (ImGuiKey)0;

    


    

    
5841

    
    

    
            //ImGui::Text("Legacy raw:");       for (ImGuiKey key = key_first; key < ImGuiKey_COUNT; key++) { if (io.KeysDown[key]) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("\"%s\" %d", ImGui::GetKeyName(key), key); } }

    


    

    
5842

    
    

    
#endif

    


    

    
5843

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Keys down:");          for (ImGuiKey key = key_first; key < ImGuiKey_COUNT; key = (ImGuiKey)(key + 1)) { if (funcs::IsLegacyNativeDupe(key)) continue; if (ImGui::IsKeyDown(key)) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("\"%s\" %d (%.02f)", ImGui::GetKeyName(key), key, ImGui::GetKeyData(key)->DownDuration); } }

    


    

    
5844

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Keys pressed:");       for (ImGuiKey key = key_first; key < ImGuiKey_COUNT; key = (ImGuiKey)(key + 1)) { if (funcs::IsLegacyNativeDupe(key)) continue; if (ImGui::IsKeyPressed(key)) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("\"%s\" %d", ImGui::GetKeyName(key), key); } }

    


    

    
5845

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Keys released:");      for (ImGuiKey key = key_first; key < ImGuiKey_COUNT; key = (ImGuiKey)(key + 1)) { if (funcs::IsLegacyNativeDupe(key)) continue; if (ImGui::IsKeyReleased(key)) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("\"%s\" %d", ImGui::GetKeyName(key), key); } }

    


    

    
5846

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Keys mods: %s%s%s%s", io.KeyCtrl ? "CTRL " : "", io.KeyShift ? "SHIFT " : "", io.KeyAlt ? "ALT " : "", io.KeySuper ? "SUPER " : "");

    


    

    
5847

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Chars queue:");        for (int i = 0; i < io.InputQueueCharacters.Size; i++) { ImWchar c = io.InputQueueCharacters[i]; ImGui::SameLine();  ImGui::Text("\'%c\' (0x%04X)", (c > ' ' && c <= 255) ? (char)c : '?', c); } // FIXME: We should convert 'c' to UTF-8 here but the functions are not public.

    


    

    
5848

    
    

    

    


    

    
5849

    
    

    
            // Draw an arbitrary US keyboard layout to visualize translated keys

    


    

    
5850

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
5851

    
    

    
                const ImVec2 key_size = ImVec2(35.0f, 35.0f);

    


    

    
5852

    
    

    
                const float  key_rounding = 3.0f;

    


    

    
5853

    
    

    
                const ImVec2 key_face_size = ImVec2(25.0f, 25.0f);

    


    

    
5854

    
    

    
                const ImVec2 key_face_pos = ImVec2(5.0f, 3.0f);

    


    

    
5855

    
    

    
                const float  key_face_rounding = 2.0f;

    


    

    
5856

    
    

    
                const ImVec2 key_label_pos = ImVec2(7.0f, 4.0f);

    


    

    
5857

    
    

    
                const ImVec2 key_step = ImVec2(key_size.x - 1.0f, key_size.y - 1.0f);

    


    

    
5858

    
    

    
                const float  key_row_offset = 9.0f;

    


    

    
5859

    
    

    

    


    

    
5860

    
    

    
                ImVec2 board_min = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();

    


    

    
5861

    
    

    
                ImVec2 board_max = ImVec2(board_min.x + 3 * key_step.x + 2 * key_row_offset + 10.0f, board_min.y + 3 * key_step.y + 10.0f);

    


    

    
5862

    
    

    
                ImVec2 start_pos = ImVec2(board_min.x + 5.0f - key_step.x, board_min.y);

    


    

    
5863

    
    

    

    


    

    
5864

    
    

    
                struct KeyLayoutData { int Row, Col; const char* Label; ImGuiKey Key; };

    


    

    
5865

    
    

    
                const KeyLayoutData keys_to_display[] =

    


    

    
5866

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
5867

    
    

    
                    { 0, 0, "", ImGuiKey_Tab },      { 0, 1, "Q", ImGuiKey_Q }, { 0, 2, "W", ImGuiKey_W }, { 0, 3, "E", ImGuiKey_E }, { 0, 4, "R", ImGuiKey_R },

    


    

    
5868

    
    

    
                    { 1, 0, "", ImGuiKey_CapsLock }, { 1, 1, "A", ImGuiKey_A }, { 1, 2, "S", ImGuiKey_S }, { 1, 3, "D", ImGuiKey_D }, { 1, 4, "F", ImGuiKey_F },

    


    

    
5869

    
    

    
                    { 2, 0, "", ImGuiKey_LeftShift },{ 2, 1, "Z", ImGuiKey_Z }, { 2, 2, "X", ImGuiKey_X }, { 2, 3, "C", ImGuiKey_C }, { 2, 4, "V", ImGuiKey_V }

    


    

    
5870

    
    

    
                };

    


    

    
5871

    
    

    

    


    

    
5872

    
    

    
                // Elements rendered manually via ImDrawList API are not clipped automatically.

    


    

    
5873

    
    

    
                // While not strictly necessary, here IsItemVisible() is used to avoid rendering these shapes when they are out of view.

    


    

    
5874

    
    

    
                ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2(board_max.x - board_min.x, board_max.y - board_min.y));

    


    

    
5875

    
    

    
                if (ImGui::IsItemVisible())

    


    

    
5876

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
5877

    
    

    
                    ImDrawList* draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();

    


    

    
5878

    
    

    
                    draw_list->PushClipRect(board_min, board_max, true);

    


    

    
5879

    
    

    
                    for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(keys_to_display); n++)

    


    

    
5880

    
    

    
                    {

    


    

    
5881

    
    

    
                        const KeyLayoutData* key_data = &keys_to_display[n];

    


    

    
5882

    
    

    
                        ImVec2 key_min = ImVec2(start_pos.x + key_data->Col * key_step.x + key_data->Row * key_row_offset, start_pos.y + key_data->Row * key_step.y);

    


    

    
5883

    
    

    
                        ImVec2 key_max = ImVec2(key_min.x + key_size.x, key_min.y + key_size.y);

    


    

    
5884

    
    

    
                        draw_list->AddRectFilled(key_min, key_max, IM_COL32(204, 204, 204, 255), key_rounding);

    


    

    
5885

    
    

    
                        draw_list->AddRect(key_min, key_max, IM_COL32(24, 24, 24, 255), key_rounding);

    


    

    
5886

    
    

    
                        ImVec2 face_min = ImVec2(key_min.x + key_face_pos.x, key_min.y + key_face_pos.y);

    


    

    
5887

    
    

    
                        ImVec2 face_max = ImVec2(face_min.x + key_face_size.x, face_min.y + key_face_size.y);

    


    

    
5888

    
    

    
                        draw_list->AddRect(face_min, face_max, IM_COL32(193, 193, 193, 255), key_face_rounding, ImDrawFlags_None, 2.0f);

    


    

    
5889

    
    

    
                        draw_list->AddRectFilled(face_min, face_max, IM_COL32(252, 252, 252, 255), key_face_rounding);

    


    

    
5890

    
    

    
                        ImVec2 label_min = ImVec2(key_min.x + key_label_pos.x, key_min.y + key_label_pos.y);

    


    

    
5891

    
    

    
                        draw_list->AddText(label_min, IM_COL32(64, 64, 64, 255), key_data->Label);

    


    

    
5892

    
    

    
                        if (ImGui::IsKeyDown(key_data->Key))

    


    

    
5893

    
    

    
                            draw_list->AddRectFilled(key_min, key_max, IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 128), key_rounding);

    


    

    
5894

    
    

    
                    }

    


    

    
5895

    
    

    
                    draw_list->PopClipRect();

    


    

    
5896

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
5897

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
5898

    
    

    
            ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5899

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5900

    
    

    

    


    

    
5901

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::TreeNode("Capture override"))

    


    

    
5902

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5903

    
    

    
            HelpMarker(

    


    

    
5904

    
    

    
                "The value of io.WantCaptureMouse and io.WantCaptureKeyboard are normally set by Dear ImGui "

    


    

    
5905

    
    

    
                "to instruct your application of how to route inputs. Typically, when a value is true, it means "

    


    

    
5906

    
    

    
                "Dear ImGui wants the corresponding inputs and we expect the underlying application to ignore them.\n\n"

    


    

    
5907

    
    

    
                "The most typical case is: when hovering a window, Dear ImGui set io.WantCaptureMouse to true, "

    


    

    
5908

    
    

    
                "and underlying application should ignore mouse inputs (in practice there are many and more subtle "

    


    

    
5909

    
    

    
                "rules leading to how those flags are set).");

    


    

    
5910

    
    

    

    


    

    
5911

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("io.WantCaptureMouse: %d", io.WantCaptureMouse);

    


    

    
5912

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("io.WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose: %d", io.WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose);

    


    

    
5913

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("io.WantCaptureKeyboard: %d", io.WantCaptureKeyboard);

    


    

    
5914

    
    

    

    


    

    
5915

    
    

    
            HelpMarker(

    


    

    
5916

    
    

    
                "Hovering the colored canvas will override io.WantCaptureXXX fields.\n"

    


    

    
5917

    
    

    
                "Notice how normally (when set to none), the value of io.WantCaptureKeyboard would be false when hovering and true when clicking.");

    


    

    
5918

    
    

    
            static int capture_override_mouse = -1;

    


    

    
5919

    
    

    
            static int capture_override_keyboard = -1;

    


    

    
5920

    
    

    
            const char* capture_override_desc[] = { "None", "Set to false", "Set to true" };

    


    

    
5921

    
    

    
            ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 15);

    


    

    
5922

    
    

    
            ImGui::SliderInt("SetNextFrameWantCaptureMouse()", &capture_override_mouse, -1, +1, capture_override_desc[capture_override_mouse + 1], ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);

    


    

    
5923

    
    

    
            ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 15);

    


    

    
5924

    
    

    
            ImGui::SliderInt("SetNextFrameWantCaptureKeyboard()", &capture_override_keyboard, -1, +1, capture_override_desc[capture_override_keyboard + 1], ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);

    


    

    
5925

    
    

    

    


    

    
5926

    
    

    
            ImGui::ColorButton("##panel", ImVec4(0.7f, 0.1f, 0.7f, 1.0f), ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop, ImVec2(256.0f, 192.0f)); // Dummy item

    


    

    
5927

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::IsItemHovered() && capture_override_mouse != -1)

    


    

    
5928

    
    

    
                ImGui::SetNextFrameWantCaptureMouse(capture_override_mouse == 1);

    


    

    
5929

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::IsItemHovered() && capture_override_keyboard != -1)

    


    

    
5930

    
    

    
                ImGui::SetNextFrameWantCaptureKeyboard(capture_override_keyboard == 1);

    


    

    
5931

    
    

    

    


    

    
5932

    
    

    
            ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
5933

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
5934

    
    

    

    


    

    
5935

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs, Navigation & Focus/Tabbing");

    


    

    
5936

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tabbing"))

    


    

    
5937

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
5938

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Use TAB/SHIFT+TAB to cycle through keyboard editable fields.");

    


    

    
5939

    
    

    
            static char buf[32] = "hello";

    


    

    
5940

    
    

    
            ImGui::InputText("1", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));

    


    

    
5941

    
    

    
            ImGui::InputText("2", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));

    


    

    
5942

    
    

    
            ImGui::InputText("3", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));

    


    

    
5943

    
    

    
            ImGui::PushAllowKeyboardFocus(false);

    


    

    
5944

    
    

    
            ImGui::InputText("4 (tab skip)", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));

    


    

    
5945

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Item won't be cycled through when using TAB or Shift+Tab.");

    


    

    
5946
