            reclaim_focus = true;

    


    

    
6840

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
6841

    
    

    

    


    

    
6842

    
    

    
        // Auto-focus on window apparition

    


    

    
6843

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetItemDefaultFocus();

    


    

    
6844

    
    

    
        if (reclaim_focus)

    


    

    
6845

    
    

    
            ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere(-1); // Auto focus previous widget

    


    

    
6846

    
    

    

    


    

    
6847

    
    

    
        ImGui::End();

    


    

    
6848

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
6849

    
    

    

    


    

    
6850

    
    

    
    void    ExecCommand(const char* command_line)

    


    

    
6851

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
6852

    
    

    
        AddLog("# %s\n", command_line);

    


    

    
6853

    
    

    

    


    

    
6854

    
    

    
        // Insert into history. First find match and delete it so it can be pushed to the back.

    


    

    
6855

    
    

    
        // This isn't trying to be smart or optimal.

    


    

    
6856

    
    

    
        HistoryPos = -1;

    


    

    
6857

    
    

    
        for (int i = History.Size - 1; i >= 0; i--)

    


    

    
6858

    
    

    
            if (Stricmp(History[i], command_line) == 0)

    


    

    
6859

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
6860

    
    

    
                free(History[i]);

    


    

    
6861

    
    

    
                History.erase(History.begin() + i);

    


    

    
6862

    
    

    
                break;

    


    

    
6863

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
6864

    
    

    
        History.push_back(Strdup(command_line));

    


    

    
6865

    
    

    

    


    

    
6866

    
    

    
        // Process command

    


    

    
6867

    
    

    
        if (Stricmp(command_line, "CLEAR") == 0)

    


    

    
6868

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
6869

    
    

    
            ClearLog();

    


    

    
6870

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
6871

    
    

    
        else if (Stricmp(command_line, "HELP") == 0)

    


    

    
6872

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
6873

    
    

    
            AddLog("Commands:");

    


    

    
6874

    
    

    
            for (int i = 0; i < Commands.Size; i++)

    


    

    
6875

    
    

    
                AddLog("- %s", Commands[i]);

    


    

    
6876

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
6877

    
    

    
        else if (Stricmp(command_line, "HISTORY") == 0)

    


    

    
6878

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
6879

    
    

    
            int first = History.Size - 10;

    


    

    
6880

    
    

    
            for (int i = first > 0 ? first : 0; i < History.Size; i++)

    


    

    
6881

    
    

    
                AddLog("%3d: %s\n", i, History[i]);

    


    

    
6882

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
6883

    
    

    
        else

    


    

    
6884

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
6885

    
    

    
            AddLog("Unknown command: '%s'\n", command_line);

    


    

    
6886

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
6887

    
    

    

    


    

    
6888

    
    

    
        // On command input, we scroll to bottom even if AutoScroll==false

    


    

    
6889

    
    

    
        ScrollToBottom = true;

    


    

    
6890

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
6891

    
    

    

    


    

    
6892

    
    

    
    // In C++11 you'd be better off using lambdas for this sort of forwarding callbacks

    


    

    
6893

    
    

    
    static int TextEditCallbackStub(ImGuiInputTextCallbackData* data)

    


    

    
6894

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
6895

    
    

    
        ExampleAppConsole* console = (ExampleAppConsole*)data->UserData;

    


    

    
6896

    
    

    
        return console->TextEditCallback(data);

    


    

    
6897

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
6898

    
    

    

    


    

    
6899

    
    

    
    int     TextEditCallback(ImGuiInputTextCallbackData* data)

    


    

    
6900

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
6901

    
    

    
        //AddLog("cursor: %d, selection: %d-%d", data->CursorPos, data->SelectionStart, data->SelectionEnd);

    


    

    
6902

    
    

    
        switch (data->EventFlag)

    


    

    
6903

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
6904

    
    

    
        case ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion:

    


    

    
6905

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
6906

    
    

    
                // Example of TEXT COMPLETION

    


    

    
6907

    
    

    

    


    

    
6908

    
    

    
                // Locate beginning of current word

    


    

    
6909

    
    

    
                const char* word_end = data->Buf + data->CursorPos;

    


    

    
6910

    
    

    
                const char* word_start = word_end;

    


    

    
6911

    
    

    
                while (word_start > data->Buf)

    


    

    
6912

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
6913

    
    

    
                    const char c = word_start[-1];

    


    

    
6914

    
    

    
                    if (c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == ',' || c == ';')

    


    

    
6915

    
    

    
                        break;

    


    

    
6916

    
    

    
                    word_start--;

    


    

    
6917

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
6918

    
    

    

    


    

    
6919

    
    

    
                // Build a list of candidates

    


    

    
6920

    
    

    
                ImVector<const char*> candidates;

    


    

    
6921

    
    

    
                for (int i = 0; i < Commands.Size; i++)

    


    

    
6922

    
    

    
                    if (Strnicmp(Commands[i], word_start, (int)(word_end - word_start)) == 0)

    


    

    
6923

    
    

    
                        candidates.push_back(Commands[i]);

    


    

    
6924

    
    

    

    


    

    
6925

    
    

    
                if (candidates.Size == 0)

    


    

    
6926

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
6927

    
    

    
                    // No match

    


    

    
6928

    
    

    
                    AddLog("No match for \"%.*s\"!\n", (int)(word_end - word_start), word_start);

    


    

    
6929

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
6930

    
    

    
                else if (candidates.Size == 1)

    


    

    
6931

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
6932

    
    

    
                    // Single match. Delete the beginning of the word and replace it entirely so we've got nice casing.

    


    

    
6933

    
    

    
                    data->DeleteChars((int)(word_start - data->Buf), (int)(word_end - word_start));

    


    

    
6934

    
    

    
                    data->InsertChars(data->CursorPos, candidates[0]);

    


    

    
6935

    
    

    
                    data->InsertChars(data->CursorPos, " ");

    


    

    
6936

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
6937

    
    

    
                else

    


    

    
6938

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
6939

    
    

    
                    // Multiple matches. Complete as much as we can..

    


    

    
6940

    
    

    
                    // So inputing "C"+Tab will complete to "CL" then display "CLEAR" and "CLASSIFY" as matches.

    


    

    
6941

    
    

    
                    int match_len = (int)(word_end - word_start);

    


    

    
6942

    
    

    
                    for (;;)

    


    

    
6943

    
    

    
                    {

    


    

    
6944

    
    

    
                        int c = 0;

    


    

    
6945

    
    

    
                        bool all_candidates_matches = true;

    


    

    
6946

    
    

    
                        for (int i = 0; i < candidates.Size && all_candidates_matches; i++)

    


    

    
6947

    
    

    
                            if (i == 0)

    


    

    
6948

    
    

    
                                c = toupper(candidates[i][match_len]);

    


    

    
6949

    
    

    
                            else if (c == 0 || c != toupper(candidates[i][match_len]))

    


    

    
6950

    
    

    
                                all_candidates_matches = false;

    


    

    
6951

    
    

    
                        if (!all_candidates_matches)

    


    

    
6952

    
    

    
                            break;

    


    

    
6953

    
    

    
                        match_len++;

    


    

    
6954

    
    

    
                    }

    


    

    
6955

    
    

    

    


    

    
6956

    
    

    
                    if (match_len > 0)

    


    

    
6957

    
    

    
                    {

    


    

    
6958

    
    

    
                        data->DeleteChars((int)(word_start - data->Buf), (int)(word_end - word_start));

    


    

    
6959

    
    

    
                        data->InsertChars(data->CursorPos, candidates[0], candidates[0] + match_len);

    


    

    
6960

    
    

    
                    }

    


    

    
6961

    
    

    

    


    

    
6962

    
    

    
                    // List matches

    


    

    
6963

    
    

    
                    AddLog("Possible matches:\n");

    


    

    
6964

    
    

    
                    for (int i = 0; i < candidates.Size; i++)

    


    

    
6965

    
    

    
                        AddLog("- %s\n", candidates[i]);

    


    

    
6966

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
6967

    
    

    

    


    

    
6968

    
    

    
                break;

    


    

    
6969

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
6970

    
    

    
        case ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory:

    


    

    
6971

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
6972

    
    

    
                // Example of HISTORY

    


    

    
6973

    
    

    
                const int prev_history_pos = HistoryPos;

    


    

    
6974

    
    

    
                if (data->EventKey == ImGuiKey_UpArrow)

    


    

    
6975

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
6976

    
    

    
                    if (HistoryPos == -1)

    


    

    
6977

    
    

    
                        HistoryPos = History.Size - 1;

    


    

    
6978

    
    

    
                    else if (HistoryPos > 0)

    


    

    
6979

    
    

    
                        HistoryPos--;

    


    

    
6980

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
6981

    
    

    
                else if (data->EventKey == ImGuiKey_DownArrow)

    


    

    
6982

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
6983

    
    

    
                    if (HistoryPos != -1)

    


    

    
6984

    
    

    
                        if (++HistoryPos >= History.Size)

    


    

    
6985

    
    

    
                            HistoryPos = -1;

    


    

    
6986

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
6987

    
    

    

    


    

    
6988

    
    

    
                // A better implementation would preserve the data on the current input line along with cursor position.

    


    

    
6989

    
    

    
                if (prev_history_pos != HistoryPos)

    


    

    
6990

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
6991

    
    

    
                    const char* history_str = (HistoryPos >= 0) ? History[HistoryPos] : "";

    


    

    
6992

    
    

    
                    data->DeleteChars(0, data->BufTextLen);

    


    

    
6993

    
    

    
                    data->InsertChars(0, history_str);

    


    

    
6994

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
6995

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
6996

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
6997

    
    

    
        return 0;

    


    

    
6998

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
6999

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
7000

    
    

    

    


    

    
7001

    
    

    
static void ShowExampleAppConsole(bool* p_open)

    


    

    
7002

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
7003

    
    

    
    static ExampleAppConsole console;

    


    

    
7004

    
    

    
    console.Draw("Example: Console", p_open);

    


    

    
7005

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
7006

    
    

    

    


    

    
7007

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7008

    
    

    
// [SECTION] Example App: Debug Log / ShowExampleAppLog()

    


    

    
7009

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7010

    
    

    

    


    

    
7011

    
    

    
// Usage:

    


    

    
7012

    
    

    
//  static ExampleAppLog my_log;

    


    

    
7013

    
    

    
//  my_log.AddLog("Hello %d world\n", 123);

    


    

    
7014

    
    

    
//  my_log.Draw("title");

    


    

    
7015

    
    

    
struct ExampleAppLog

    


    

    
7016

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
7017

    
    

    
    ImGuiTextBuffer     Buf;

    


    

    
7018

    
    

    
    ImGuiTextFilter     Filter;

    


    

    
7019

    
    

    
    ImVector<int>       LineOffsets; // Index to lines offset. We maintain this with AddLog() calls.

    


    

    
7020

    
    

    
    bool                AutoScroll;  // Keep scrolling if already at the bottom.

    


    

    
7021

    
    

    

    


    

    
7022

    
    

    
    ExampleAppLog()

    


    

    
7023

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7024

    
    

    
        AutoScroll = true;

    


    

    
7025

    
    

    
        Clear();

    


    

    
7026

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7027

    
    

    

    


    

    
7028

    
    

    
    void    Clear()

    


    

    
7029

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7030

    
    

    
        Buf.clear();

    


    

    
7031

    
    

    
        LineOffsets.clear();

    


    

    
7032

    
    

    
        LineOffsets.push_back(0);

    


    

    
7033

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7034

    
    

    

    


    

    
7035

    
    

    
    void    AddLog(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2)

    


    

    
7036

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7037

    
    

    
        int old_size = Buf.size();

    


    

    
7038

    
    

    
        va_list args;

    


    

    
7039

    
    

    
        va_start(args, fmt);

    


    

    
7040

    
    

    
        Buf.appendfv(fmt, args);

    


    

    
7041

    
    

    
        va_end(args);

    


    

    
7042

    
    

    
        for (int new_size = Buf.size(); old_size < new_size; old_size++)

    


    

    
7043

    
    

    
            if (Buf[old_size] == '\n')

    


    

    
7044

    
    

    
                LineOffsets.push_back(old_size + 1);

    


    

    
7045

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7046

    
    

    

    


    

    
7047

    
    

    
    void    Draw(const char* title, bool* p_open = NULL)

    


    

    
7048

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7049

    
    

    
        if (!ImGui::Begin(title, p_open))

    


    

    
7050

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
7051

    
    

    
            ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7052

    
    

    
            return;

    


    

    
7053

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
7054

    
    

    

    


    

    
7055

    
    

    
        // Options menu

    


    

    
7056

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginPopup("Options"))

    


    

    
7057

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
7058

    
    

    
            ImGui::Checkbox("Auto-scroll", &AutoScroll);

    


    

    
7059

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndPopup();

    


    

    
7060

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
7061

    
    

    

    


    

    
7062

    
    

    
        // Main window

    


    

    
7063

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::Button("Options"))

    


    

    
7064

    
    

    
            ImGui::OpenPopup("Options");

    


    

    
7065

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
7066

    
    

    
        bool clear = ImGui::Button("Clear");

    


    

    
7067

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
7068

    
    

    
        bool copy = ImGui::Button("Copy");

    


    

    
7069

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
7070

    
    

    
        Filter.Draw("Filter", -100.0f);

    


    

    
7071

    
    

    

    


    

    
7072

    
    

    
        ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
7073

    
    

    

    


    

    
7074

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginChild("scrolling", ImVec2(0, 0), false, ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar))

    


    

    
7075

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
7076

    
    

    
            if (clear)

    


    

    
7077

    
    

    
                Clear();

    


    

    
7078

    
    

    
            if (copy)

    


    

    
7079

    
    

    
                ImGui::LogToClipboard();

    


    

    
7080

    
    

    

    


    

    
7081

    
    

    
            ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(0, 0));

    


    

    
7082

    
    

    
            const char* buf = Buf.begin();

    


    

    
7083

    
    

    
            const char* buf_end = Buf.end();

    


    

    
7084

    
    

    
            if (Filter.IsActive())

    


    

    
7085

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
7086

    
    

    
                // In this example we don't use the clipper when Filter is enabled.

    


    

    
7087

    
    

    
                // This is because we don't have random access to the result of our filter.

    


    

    
7088

    
    

    
                // A real application processing logs with ten of thousands of entries may want to store the result of

    


    

    
7089

    
    

    
                // search/filter.. especially if the filtering function is not trivial (e.g. reg-exp).

    


    

    
7090

    
    

    
                for (int line_no = 0; line_no < LineOffsets.Size; line_no++)

    


    

    
7091

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
7092

    
    

    
                    const char* line_start = buf + LineOffsets[line_no];

    


    

    
7093

    
    

    
                    const char* line_end = (line_no + 1 < LineOffsets.Size) ? (buf + LineOffsets[line_no + 1] - 1) : buf_end;

    


    

    
7094

    
    

    
                    if (Filter.PassFilter(line_start, line_end))

    


    

    
7095

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TextUnformatted(line_start, line_end);

    


    

    
7096

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
7097

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
7098

    
    

    
            else

    


    

    
7099

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
7100

    
    

    
                // The simplest and easy way to display the entire buffer:

    


    

    
7101

    
    

    
                //   ImGui::TextUnformatted(buf_begin, buf_end);

    


    

    
7102

    
    

    
                // And it'll just work. TextUnformatted() has specialization for large blob of text and will fast-forward

    


    

    
7103

    
    

    
                // to skip non-visible lines. Here we instead demonstrate using the clipper to only process lines that are

    


    

    
7104

    
    

    
                // within the visible area.

    


    

    
7105

    
    

    
                // If you have tens of thousands of items and their processing cost is non-negligible, coarse clipping them

    


    

    
7106

    
    

    
                // on your side is recommended. Using ImGuiListClipper requires

    


    

    
7107

    
    

    
                // - A) random access into your data

    


    

    
7108

    
    

    
                // - B) items all being the  same height,

    


    

    
7109

    
    

    
                // both of which we can handle since we have an array pointing to the beginning of each line of text.

    


    

    
7110

    
    

    
                // When using the filter (in the block of code above) we don't have random access into the data to display

    


    

    
7111

    
    

    
                // anymore, which is why we don't use the clipper. Storing or skimming through the search result would make

    


    

    
7112

    
    

    
                // it possible (and would be recommended if you want to search through tens of thousands of entries).

    


    

    
7113

    
    

    
                ImGuiListClipper clipper;

    


    

    
7114

    
    

    
                clipper.Begin(LineOffsets.Size);

    


    

    
7115

    
    

    
                while (clipper.Step())

    


    

    
7116

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
7117

    
    

    
                    for (int line_no = clipper.DisplayStart; line_no < clipper.DisplayEnd; line_no++)

    


    

    
7118

    
    

    
                    {

    


    

    
7119

    
    

    
                        const char* line_start = buf + LineOffsets[line_no];

    


    

    
7120

    
    

    
                        const char* line_end = (line_no + 1 < LineOffsets.Size) ? (buf + LineOffsets[line_no + 1] - 1) : buf_end;

    


    

    
7121

    
    

    
                        ImGui::TextUnformatted(line_start, line_end);

    


    

    
7122

    
    

    
                    }

    


    

    
7123

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
7124

    
    

    
                clipper.End();

    


    

    
7125

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
7126

    
    

    
            ImGui::PopStyleVar();

    


    

    
7127

    
    

    

    


    

    
7128

    
    

    
            // Keep up at the bottom of the scroll region if we were already at the bottom at the beginning of the frame.

    


    

    
7129

    
    

    
            // Using a scrollbar or mouse-wheel will take away from the bottom edge.

    


    

    
7130

    
    

    
            if (AutoScroll && ImGui::GetScrollY() >= ImGui::GetScrollMaxY())

    


    

    
7131

    
    

    
                ImGui::SetScrollHereY(1.0f);

    


    

    
7132

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
7133

    
    

    
        ImGui::EndChild();

    


    

    
7134

    
    

    
        ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7135

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7136

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
7137

    
    

    

    


    

    
7138

    
    

    
// Demonstrate creating a simple log window with basic filtering.

    


    

    
7139

    
    

    
static void ShowExampleAppLog(bool* p_open)

    


    

    
7140

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
7141

    
    

    
    static ExampleAppLog log;

    


    

    
7142

    
    

    

    


    

    
7143

    
    

    
    // For the demo: add a debug button _BEFORE_ the normal log window contents

    


    

    
7144

    
    

    
    // We take advantage of a rarely used feature: multiple calls to Begin()/End() are appending to the _same_ window.

    


    

    
7145

    
    

    
    // Most of the contents of the window will be added by the log.Draw() call.

    


    

    
7146

    
    

    
    ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(500, 400), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);

    


    

    
7147

    
    

    
    ImGui::Begin("Example: Log", p_open);

    


    

    
7148

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Log");

    


    

    
7149

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::SmallButton("[Debug] Add 5 entries"))

    


    

    
7150

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7151

    
    

    
        static int counter = 0;

    


    

    
7152

    
    

    
        const char* categories[3] = { "info", "warn", "error" };

    


    

    
7153

    
    

    
        const char* words[] = { "Bumfuzzled", "Cattywampus", "Snickersnee", "Abibliophobia", "Absquatulate", "Nincompoop", "Pauciloquent" };

    


    

    
7154

    
    

    
        for (int n = 0; n < 5; n++)

    


    

    
7155

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
7156

    
    

    
            const char* category = categories[counter % IM_ARRAYSIZE(categories)];

    


    

    
7157

    
    

    
            const char* word = words[counter % IM_ARRAYSIZE(words)];

    


    

    
7158

    
    

    
            log.AddLog("[%05d] [%s] Hello, current time is %.1f, here's a word: '%s'\n",

    


    

    
7159

    
    

    
                ImGui::GetFrameCount(), category, ImGui::GetTime(), word);

    


    

    
7160

    
    

    
            counter++;

    


    

    
7161

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
7162

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7163

    
    

    
    ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7164

    
    

    

    


    

    
7165

    
    

    
    // Actually call in the regular Log helper (which will Begin() into the same window as we just did)

    


    

    
7166

    
    

    
    log.Draw("Example: Log", p_open);

    


    

    
7167

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
7168

    
    

    

    


    

    
7169

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7170

    
    

    
// [SECTION] Example App: Simple Layout / ShowExampleAppLayout()

    


    

    
7171

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7172

    
    

    

    


    

    
7173

    
    

    
// Demonstrate create a window with multiple child windows.

    


    

    
7174

    
    

    
static void ShowExampleAppLayout(bool* p_open)

    


    

    
7175

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
7176

    
    

    
    ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(500, 440), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);

    


    

    
7177

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::Begin("Example: Simple layout", p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))

    


    

    
7178

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7179

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Simple layout");

    


    

    
7180

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())

    


    

    
7181

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
7182

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::BeginMenu("File"))

    


    

    
7183

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
7184

    
    

    
                if (ImGui::MenuItem("Close")) *p_open = false;

    


    

    
7185

    
    

    
                ImGui::EndMenu();

    


    

    
7186

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
7187

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndMenuBar();

    


    

    
7188

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
7189

    
    

    

    


    

    
7190

    
    

    
        // Left

    


    

    
7191

    
    

    
        static int selected = 0;

    


    

    
7192

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
7193

    
    

    
            ImGui::BeginChild("left pane", ImVec2(150, 0), true);

    


    

    
7194

    
    

    
            for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++)

    


    

    
7195

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
7196

    
    

    
                // FIXME: Good candidate to use ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnNav

    


    

    
7197

    
    

    
                char label[128];

    


    

    
7198

    
    

    
                sprintf(label, "MyObject %d", i);

    


    

    
7199

    
    

    
                if (ImGui::Selectable(label, selected == i))

    


    

    
7200

    
    

    
                    selected = i;

    


    

    
7201

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
7202

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndChild();

    


    

    
7203

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
7204

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
7205

    
    

    

    


    

    
7206

    
    

    
        // Right

    


    

    
7207

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
7208

    
    

    
            ImGui::BeginGroup();

    


    

    
7209

    
    

    
            ImGui::BeginChild("item view", ImVec2(0, -ImGui::GetFrameHeightWithSpacing())); // Leave room for 1 line below us

    


    

    
7210

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("MyObject: %d", selected);

    


    

    
7211

    
    

    
            ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
7212

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::BeginTabBar("##Tabs", ImGuiTabBarFlags_None))

    


    

    
7213

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
7214

    
    

    
                if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Description"))

    


    

    
7215

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
7216

    
    

    
                    ImGui::TextWrapped("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. ");

    


    

    
7217

    
    

    
                    ImGui::EndTabItem();

    


    

    
7218

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
7219

    
    

    
                if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Details"))

    


    

    
7220

    
    

    
                {

    


    

    
7221

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Text("ID: 0123456789");

    


    

    
7222

    
    

    
                    ImGui::EndTabItem();

    


    

    
7223

    
    

    
                }

    


    

    
7224

    
    

    
                ImGui::EndTabBar();

    


    

    
7225

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
7226

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndChild();

    


    

    
7227

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::Button("Revert")) {}

    


    

    
7228

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
7229

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::Button("Save")) {}

    


    

    
7230

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndGroup();

    


    

    
7231

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
7232

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7233

    
    

    
    ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7234

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
7235

    
    

    

    


    

    
7236

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7237

    
    

    
// [SECTION] Example App: Property Editor / ShowExampleAppPropertyEditor()

    


    

    
7238

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7239

    
    

    

    


    

    
7240

    
    

    
static void ShowPlaceholderObject(const char* prefix, int uid)

    


    

    
7241

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
7242

    
    

    
    // Use object uid as identifier. Most commonly you could also use the object pointer as a base ID.

    


    

    
7243

    
    

    
    ImGui::PushID(uid);

    


    

    
7244

    
    

    

    


    

    
7245

    
    

    
    // Text and Tree nodes are less high than framed widgets, using AlignTextToFramePadding() we add vertical spacing to make the tree lines equal high.

    


    

    
7246

    
    

    
    ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
7247

    
    

    
    ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(0);

    


    

    
7248

    
    

    
    ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();

    


    

    
7249

    
    

    
    bool node_open = ImGui::TreeNode("Object", "%s_%u", prefix, uid);

    


    

    
7250

    
    

    
    ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(1);

    


    

    
7251

    
    

    
    ImGui::Text("my sailor is rich");

    


    

    
7252

    
    

    

    


    

    
7253

    
    

    
    if (node_open)

    


    

    
7254

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7255

    
    

    
        static float placeholder_members[8] = { 0.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f, 3.1416f, 100.0f, 999.0f };

    


    

    
7256

    
    

    
        for (int i = 0; i < 8; i++)

    


    

    
7257

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
7258

    
    

    
            ImGui::PushID(i); // Use field index as identifier.

    


    

    
7259

    
    

    
            if (i < 2)

    


    

    
7260

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
7261

    
    

    
                ShowPlaceholderObject("Child", 424242);

    


    

    
7262

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
7263

    
    

    
            else

    


    

    
7264

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
7265

    
    

    
                // Here we use a TreeNode to highlight on hover (we could use e.g. Selectable as well)

    


    

    
7266

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableNextRow();

    


    

    
7267

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(0);

    


    

    
7268

    
    

    
                ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();

    


    

    
7269

    
    

    
                ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet;

    


    

    
7270

    
    

    
                ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Field", flags, "Field_%d", i);

    


    

    
7271

    
    

    

    


    

    
7272

    
    

    
                ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(1);

    


    

    
7273

    
    

    
                ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN);

    


    

    
7274

    
    

    
                if (i >= 5)

    


    

    
7275

    
    

    
                    ImGui::InputFloat("##value", &placeholder_members[i], 1.0f);

    


    

    
7276

    
    

    
                else

    


    

    
7277

    
    

    
                    ImGui::DragFloat("##value", &placeholder_members[i], 0.01f);

    


    

    
7278

    
    

    
                ImGui::NextColumn();

    


    

    
7279

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
7280

    
    

    
            ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
7281

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
7282

    
    

    
        ImGui::TreePop();

    


    

    
7283

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7284

    
    

    
    ImGui::PopID();

    


    

    
7285

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
7286

    
    

    

    


    

    
7287

    
    

    
// Demonstrate create a simple property editor.

    


    

    
7288

    
    

    
static void ShowExampleAppPropertyEditor(bool* p_open)

    


    

    
7289

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
7290

    
    

    
    ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(430, 450), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);

    


    

    
7291

    
    

    
    if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Property editor", p_open))

    


    

    
7292

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7293

    
    

    
        ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7294

    
    

    
        return;

    


    

    
7295

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7296

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Property Editor");

    


    

    
7297

    
    

    

    


    

    
7298

    
    

    
    HelpMarker(

    


    

    
7299

    
    

    
        "This example shows how you may implement a property editor using two columns.\n"

    


    

    
7300

    
    

    
        "All objects/fields data are dummies here.\n"

    


    

    
7301

    
    

    
        "Remember that in many simple cases, you can use ImGui::SameLine(xxx) to position\n"

    


    

    
7302

    
    

    
        "your cursor horizontally instead of using the Columns() API.");

    


    

    
7303

    
    

    

    


    

    
7304

    
    

    
    ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(2, 2));

    


    

    
7305

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::BeginTable("split", 2, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable))

    


    

    
7306

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7307

    
    

    
        // Iterate placeholder objects (all the same data)

    


    

    
7308

    
    

    
        for (int obj_i = 0; obj_i < 4; obj_i++)

    


    

    
7309

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
7310

    
    

    
            ShowPlaceholderObject("Object", obj_i);

    


    

    
7311

    
    

    
            //ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
7312

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
7313

    
    

    
        ImGui::EndTable();

    


    

    
7314

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7315

    
    

    
    ImGui::PopStyleVar();

    


    

    
7316

    
    

    
    ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7317

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
7318

    
    

    

    


    

    
7319

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7320

    
    

    
// [SECTION] Example App: Long Text / ShowExampleAppLongText()

    


    

    
7321

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7322

    
    

    

    


    

    
7323

    
    

    
// Demonstrate/test rendering huge amount of text, and the incidence of clipping.

    


    

    
7324

    
    

    
static void ShowExampleAppLongText(bool* p_open)

    


    

    
7325

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
7326

    
    

    
    ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(520, 600), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);

    


    

    
7327

    
    

    
    if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Long text display", p_open))

    


    

    
7328

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7329

    
    

    
        ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7330

    
    

    
        return;

    


    

    
7331

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7332

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Long text display");

    


    

    
7333

    
    

    

    


    

    
7334

    
    

    
    static int test_type = 0;

    


    

    
7335

    
    

    
    static ImGuiTextBuffer log;

    


    

    
7336

    
    

    
    static int lines = 0;

    


    

    
7337

    
    

    
    ImGui::Text("Printing unusually long amount of text.");

    


    

    
7338

    
    

    
    ImGui::Combo("Test type", &test_type,

    


    

    
7339

    
    

    
        "Single call to TextUnformatted()\0"

    


    

    
7340

    
    

    
        "Multiple calls to Text(), clipped\0"

    


    

    
7341

    
    

    
        "Multiple calls to Text(), not clipped (slow)\0");

    


    

    
7342

    
    

    
    ImGui::Text("Buffer contents: %d lines, %d bytes", lines, log.size());

    


    

    
7343

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::Button("Clear")) { log.clear(); lines = 0; }

    


    

    
7344

    
    

    
    ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
7345

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::Button("Add 1000 lines"))

    


    

    
7346

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7347

    
    

    
        for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++)

    


    

    
7348

    
    

    
            log.appendf("%i The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog\n", lines + i);

    


    

    
7349

    
    

    
        lines += 1000;

    


    

    
7350

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7351

    
    

    
    ImGui::BeginChild("Log");

    


    

    
7352

    
    

    
    switch (test_type)

    


    

    
7353

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7354

    
    

    
    case 0:

    


    

    
7355

    
    

    
        // Single call to TextUnformatted() with a big buffer

    


    

    
7356

    
    

    
        ImGui::TextUnformatted(log.begin(), log.end());

    


    

    
7357

    
    

    
        break;

    


    

    
7358

    
    

    
    case 1:

    


    

    
7359

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
7360

    
    

    
            // Multiple calls to Text(), manually coarsely clipped - demonstrate how to use the ImGuiListClipper helper.

    


    

    
7361

    
    

    
            ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(0, 0));

    


    

    
7362

    
    

    
            ImGuiListClipper clipper;

    


    

    
7363

    
    

    
            clipper.Begin(lines);

    


    

    
7364

    
    

    
            while (clipper.Step())

    


    

    
7365

    
    

    
                for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)

    


    

    
7366

    
    

    
                    ImGui::Text("%i The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog", i);

    


    

    
7367

    
    

    
            ImGui::PopStyleVar();

    


    

    
7368

    
    

    
            break;

    


    

    
7369

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
7370

    
    

    
    case 2:

    


    

    
7371

    
    

    
        // Multiple calls to Text(), not clipped (slow)

    


    

    
7372

    
    

    
        ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(0, 0));

    


    

    
7373

    
    

    
        for (int i = 0; i < lines; i++)

    


    

    
7374

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("%i The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog", i);

    


    

    
7375

    
    

    
        ImGui::PopStyleVar();

    


    

    
7376

    
    

    
        break;

    


    

    
7377

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7378

    
    

    
    ImGui::EndChild();

    


    

    
7379

    
    

    
    ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7380

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
7381

    
    

    

    


    

    
7382

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7383

    
    

    
// [SECTION] Example App: Auto Resize / ShowExampleAppAutoResize()

    


    

    
7384

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7385

    
    

    

    


    

    
7386

    
    

    
// Demonstrate creating a window which gets auto-resized according to its content.

    


    

    
7387

    
    

    
static void ShowExampleAppAutoResize(bool* p_open)

    


    

    
7388

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
7389

    
    

    
    if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Auto-resizing window", p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))

    


    

    
7390

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7391

    
    

    
        ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7392

    
    

    
        return;

    


    

    
7393

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7394

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Auto-resizing window");

    


    

    
7395

    
    

    

    


    

    
7396

    
    

    
    static int lines = 10;

    


    

    
7397

    
    

    
    ImGui::TextUnformatted(

    


    

    
7398

    
    

    
        "Window will resize every-frame to the size of its content.\n"

    


    

    
7399

    
    

    
        "Note that you probably don't want to query the window size to\n"

    


    

    
7400

    
    

    
        "output your content because that would create a feedback loop.");

    


    

    
7401

    
    

    
    ImGui::SliderInt("Number of lines", &lines, 1, 20);

    


    

    
7402

    
    

    
    for (int i = 0; i < lines; i++)

    


    

    
7403

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("%*sThis is line %d", i * 4, "", i); // Pad with space to extend size horizontally

    


    

    
7404

    
    

    
    ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7405

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
7406

    
    

    

    


    

    
7407

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7408

    
    

    
// [SECTION] Example App: Constrained Resize / ShowExampleAppConstrainedResize()

    


    

    
7409

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7410

    
    

    

    


    

    
7411

    
    

    
// Demonstrate creating a window with custom resize constraints.

    


    

    
7412

    
    

    
// Note that size constraints currently don't work on a docked window (when in 'docking' branch)

    


    

    
7413

    
    

    
static void ShowExampleAppConstrainedResize(bool* p_open)

    


    

    
7414

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
7415

    
    

    
    struct CustomConstraints

    


    

    
7416

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7417

    
    

    
        // Helper functions to demonstrate programmatic constraints

    


    

    
7418

    
    

    
        // FIXME: This doesn't take account of decoration size (e.g. title bar), library should make this easier.

    


    

    
7419

    
    

    
        static void AspectRatio(ImGuiSizeCallbackData* data)    { float aspect_ratio = *(float*)data->UserData; data->DesiredSize.x = IM_MAX(data->CurrentSize.x, data->CurrentSize.y); data->DesiredSize.y = (float)(int)(data->DesiredSize.x / aspect_ratio); }

    


    

    
7420

    
    

    
        static void Square(ImGuiSizeCallbackData* data)         { data->DesiredSize.x = data->DesiredSize.y = IM_MAX(data->CurrentSize.x, data->CurrentSize.y); }

    


    

    
7421

    
    

    
        static void Step(ImGuiSizeCallbackData* data)           { float step = *(float*)data->UserData; data->DesiredSize = ImVec2((int)(data->CurrentSize.x / step + 0.5f) * step, (int)(data->CurrentSize.y / step + 0.5f) * step); }

    


    

    
7422

    
    

    
    };

    


    

    
7423

    
    

    

    


    

    
7424

    
    

    
    const char* test_desc[] =

    


    

    
7425

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7426

    
    

    
        "Between 100x100 and 500x500",

    


    

    
7427

    
    

    
        "At least 100x100",

    


    

    
7428

    
    

    
        "Resize vertical only",

    


    

    
7429

    
    

    
        "Resize horizontal only",

    


    

    
7430

    
    

    
        "Width Between 400 and 500",

    


    

    
7431

    
    

    
        "Custom: Aspect Ratio 16:9",

    


    

    
7432

    
    

    
        "Custom: Always Square",

    


    

    
7433

    
    

    
        "Custom: Fixed Steps (100)",

    


    

    
7434

    
    

    
    };

    


    

    
7435

    
    

    

    


    

    
7436

    
    

    
    // Options

    


    

    
7437

    
    

    
    static bool auto_resize = false;

    


    

    
7438

    
    

    
    static bool window_padding = true;

    


    

    
7439

    
    

    
    static int type = 5; // Aspect Ratio

    


    

    
7440

    
    

    
    static int display_lines = 10;

    


    

    
7441

    
    

    

    


    

    
7442

    
    

    
    // Submit constraint

    


    

    
7443

    
    

    
    float aspect_ratio = 16.0f / 9.0f;

    


    

    
7444

    
    

    
    float fixed_step = 100.0f;

    


    

    
7445

    
    

    
    if (type == 0) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(100, 100), ImVec2(500, 500));         // Between 100x100 and 500x500

    


    

    
7446

    
    

    
    if (type == 1) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(100, 100), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX)); // Width > 100, Height > 100

    


    

    
7447

    
    

    
    if (type == 2) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(-1, 0),    ImVec2(-1, FLT_MAX));      // Vertical only

    


    

    
7448

    
    

    
    if (type == 3) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, -1),    ImVec2(FLT_MAX, -1));      // Horizontal only

    


    

    
7449

    
    

    
    if (type == 4) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(400, -1),  ImVec2(500, -1));          // Width Between and 400 and 500

    


    

    
7450

    
    

    
    if (type == 5) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0),     ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX), CustomConstraints::AspectRatio, (void*)&aspect_ratio);   // Aspect ratio

    


    

    
7451

    
    

    
    if (type == 6) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0),     ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX), CustomConstraints::Square);                              // Always Square

    


    

    
7452

    
    

    
    if (type == 7) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0),     ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX), CustomConstraints::Step, (void*)&fixed_step);            // Fixed Step

    


    

    
7453

    
    

    

    


    

    
7454

    
    

    
    // Submit window

    


    

    
7455

    
    

    
    if (!window_padding)

    


    

    
7456

    
    

    
        ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));

    


    

    
7457

    
    

    
    const ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = auto_resize ? ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize : 0;

    


    

    
7458

    
    

    
    const bool window_open = ImGui::Begin("Example: Constrained Resize", p_open, window_flags);

    


    

    
7459

    
    

    
    if (!window_padding)

    


    

    
7460

    
    

    
        ImGui::PopStyleVar();

    


    

    
7461

    
    

    
    if (window_open)

    


    

    
7462

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7463

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Constrained Resizing window");

    


    

    
7464

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::GetIO().KeyShift)

    


    

    
7465

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
7466

    
    

    
            // Display a dummy viewport (in your real app you would likely use ImageButton() to display a texture.

    


    

    
7467

    
    

    
            ImVec2 avail_size = ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail();

    


    

    
7468

    
    

    
            ImVec2 pos = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();

    


    

    
7469

    
    

    
            ImGui::ColorButton("viewport", ImVec4(0.5f, 0.2f, 0.5f, 1.0f), ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop, avail_size);

    


    

    
7470

    
    

    
            ImGui::SetCursorScreenPos(ImVec2(pos.x + 10, pos.y + 10));

    


    

    
7471

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("%.2f x %.2f", avail_size.x, avail_size.y);

    


    

    
7472

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
7473

    
    

    
        else

    


    

    
7474

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
7475

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("(Hold SHIFT to display a dummy viewport)");

    


    

    
7476

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::IsWindowDocked())

    


    

    
7477

    
    

    
                ImGui::Text("Warning: Sizing Constraints won't work if the window is docked!");

    


    

    
7478

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::Button("Set 200x200")) { ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImVec2(200, 200)); } ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
7479

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::Button("Set 500x500")) { ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImVec2(500, 500)); } ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
7480

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::Button("Set 800x200")) { ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImVec2(800, 200)); }

    


    

    
7481

    
    

    
            ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 20);

    


    

    
7482

    
    

    
            ImGui::Combo("Constraint", &type, test_desc, IM_ARRAYSIZE(test_desc));

    


    

    
7483

    
    

    
            ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 20);

    


    

    
7484

    
    

    
            ImGui::DragInt("Lines", &display_lines, 0.2f, 1, 100);

    


    

    
7485

    
    

    
            ImGui::Checkbox("Auto-resize", &auto_resize);

    


    

    
7486

    
    

    
            ImGui::Checkbox("Window padding", &window_padding);

    


    

    
7487

    
    

    
            for (int i = 0; i < display_lines; i++)

    


    

    
7488

    
    

    
                ImGui::Text("%*sHello, sailor! Making this line long enough for the example.", i * 4, "");

    


    

    
7489

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
7490

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7491

    
    

    
    ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7492

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
7493

    
    

    

    


    

    
7494

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7495

    
    

    
// [SECTION] Example App: Simple overlay / ShowExampleAppSimpleOverlay()

    


    

    
7496

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7497

    
    

    

    


    

    
7498

    
    

    
// Demonstrate creating a simple static window with no decoration

    


    

    
7499

    
    

    
// + a context-menu to choose which corner of the screen to use.

    


    

    
7500

    
    

    
static void ShowExampleAppSimpleOverlay(bool* p_open)

    


    

    
7501

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
7502

    
    

    
    static int location = 0;

    


    

    
7503

    
    

    
    ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();

    


    

    
7504

    
    

    
    ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNav;

    


    

    
7505

    
    

    
    if (location >= 0)

    


    

    
7506

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7507

    
    

    
        const float PAD = 10.0f;

    


    

    
7508

    
    

    
        const ImGuiViewport* viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();

    


    

    
7509

    
    

    
        ImVec2 work_pos = viewport->WorkPos; // Use work area to avoid menu-bar/task-bar, if any!

    


    

    
7510

    
    

    
        ImVec2 work_size = viewport->WorkSize;

    


    

    
7511

    
    

    
        ImVec2 window_pos, window_pos_pivot;

    


    

    
7512

    
    

    
        window_pos.x = (location & 1) ? (work_pos.x + work_size.x - PAD) : (work_pos.x + PAD);

    


    

    
7513

    
    

    
        window_pos.y = (location & 2) ? (work_pos.y + work_size.y - PAD) : (work_pos.y + PAD);

    


    

    
7514

    
    

    
        window_pos_pivot.x = (location & 1) ? 1.0f : 0.0f;

    


    

    
7515

    
    

    
        window_pos_pivot.y = (location & 2) ? 1.0f : 0.0f;

    


    

    
7516

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(window_pos, ImGuiCond_Always, window_pos_pivot);

    


    

    
7517

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextWindowViewport(viewport->ID);

    


    

    
7518

    
    

    
        window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove;

    


    

    
7519

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7520

    
    

    
    else if (location == -2)

    


    

    
7521

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7522

    
    

    
        // Center window

    


    

    
7523

    
    

    
        ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImGui::GetMainViewport()->GetCenter(), ImGuiCond_Always, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));

    


    

    
7524

    
    

    
        window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove;

    


    

    
7525

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7526

    
    

    
    ImGui::SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.35f); // Transparent background

    


    

    
7527

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::Begin("Example: Simple overlay", p_open, window_flags))

    


    

    
7528

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7529

    
    

    
        IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Simple Overlay");

    


    

    
7530

    
    

    
        ImGui::Text("Simple overlay\n" "(right-click to change position)");

    


    

    
7531

    
    

    
        ImGui::Separator();

    


    

    
7532

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::IsMousePosValid())

    


    

    
7533

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Mouse Position: (%.1f,%.1f)", io.MousePos.x, io.MousePos.y);

    


    

    
7534

    
    

    
        else

    


    

    
7535

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Mouse Position: <invalid>");

    


    

    
7536

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextWindow())

    


    

    
7537

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
7538

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::MenuItem("Custom",       NULL, location == -1)) location = -1;

    


    

    
7539

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::MenuItem("Center",       NULL, location == -2)) location = -2;

    


    

    
7540

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::MenuItem("Top-left",     NULL, location == 0)) location = 0;

    


    

    
7541

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::MenuItem("Top-right",    NULL, location == 1)) location = 1;

    


    

    
7542

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::MenuItem("Bottom-left",  NULL, location == 2)) location = 2;

    


    

    
7543

    
    

    
            if (ImGui::MenuItem("Bottom-right", NULL, location == 3)) location = 3;

    


    

    
7544

    
    

    
            if (p_open && ImGui::MenuItem("Close")) *p_open = false;

    


    

    
7545

    
    

    
            ImGui::EndPopup();

    


    

    
7546

    
    

    
        }

    


    

    
7547

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7548

    
    

    
    ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7549

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
7550

    
    

    

    


    

    
7551

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7552

    
    

    
// [SECTION] Example App: Fullscreen window / ShowExampleAppFullscreen()

    


    

    
7553

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7554

    
    

    

    


    

    
7555

    
    

    
// Demonstrate creating a window covering the entire screen/viewport

    


    

    
7556

    
    

    
static void ShowExampleAppFullscreen(bool* p_open)

    


    

    
7557

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
7558

    
    

    
    static bool use_work_area = true;

    


    

    
7559

    
    

    
    static ImGuiWindowFlags flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings;

    


    

    
7560

    
    

    

    


    

    
7561

    
    

    
    // We demonstrate using the full viewport area or the work area (without menu-bars, task-bars etc.)

    


    

    
7562

    
    

    
    // Based on your use case you may want one of the other.

    


    

    
7563

    
    

    
    const ImGuiViewport* viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();

    


    

    
7564

    
    

    
    ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(use_work_area ? viewport->WorkPos : viewport->Pos);

    


    

    
7565

    
    

    
    ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(use_work_area ? viewport->WorkSize : viewport->Size);

    


    

    
7566

    
    

    

    


    

    
7567

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::Begin("Example: Fullscreen window", p_open, flags))

    


    

    
7568

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7569

    
    

    
        ImGui::Checkbox("Use work area instead of main area", &use_work_area);

    


    

    
7570

    
    

    
        ImGui::SameLine();

    


    

    
7571

    
    

    
        HelpMarker("Main Area = entire viewport,\nWork Area = entire viewport minus sections used by the main menu bars, task bars etc.\n\nEnable the main-menu bar in Examples menu to see the difference.");

    


    

    
7572

    
    

    

    


    

    
7573

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground", &flags, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground);

    


    

    
7574

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration", &flags, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration);

    


    

    
7575

    
    

    
        ImGui::Indent();

    


    

    
7576

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar", &flags, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar);

    


    

    
7577

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse", &flags, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse);

    


    

    
7578

    
    

    
        ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar", &flags, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar);

    


    

    
7579

    
    

    
        ImGui::Unindent();

    


    

    
7580

    
    

    

    


    

    
7581

    
    

    
        if (p_open && ImGui::Button("Close this window"))

    


    

    
7582

    
    

    
            *p_open = false;

    


    

    
7583

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7584

    
    

    
    ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7585

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
7586

    
    

    

    


    

    
7587

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7588

    
    

    
// [SECTION] Example App: Manipulating Window Titles / ShowExampleAppWindowTitles()

    


    

    
7589

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7590

    
    

    

    


    

    
7591

    
    

    
// Demonstrate the use of "##" and "###" in identifiers to manipulate ID generation.

    


    

    
7592

    
    

    
// This applies to all regular items as well.

    


    

    
7593

    
    

    
// Read FAQ section "How can I have multiple widgets with the same label?" for details.

    


    

    
7594

    
    

    
static void ShowExampleAppWindowTitles(bool*)

    


    

    
7595

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
7596

    
    

    
    const ImGuiViewport* viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();

    


    

    
7597

    
    

    
    const ImVec2 base_pos = viewport->Pos;

    


    

    
7598

    
    

    

    


    

    
7599

    
    

    
    // By default, Windows are uniquely identified by their title.

    


    

    
7600

    
    

    
    // You can use the "##" and "###" markers to manipulate the display/ID.

    


    

    
7601

    
    

    

    


    

    
7602

    
    

    
    // Using "##" to display same title but have unique identifier.

    


    

    
7603

    
    

    
    ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(base_pos.x + 100, base_pos.y + 100), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);

    


    

    
7604

    
    

    
    ImGui::Begin("Same title as another window##1");

    


    

    
7605

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Manipulating window titles");

    


    

    
7606

    
    

    
    ImGui::Text("This is window 1.\nMy title is the same as window 2, but my identifier is unique.");

    


    

    
7607

    
    

    
    ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7608

    
    

    

    


    

    
7609

    
    

    
    ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(base_pos.x + 100, base_pos.y + 200), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);

    


    

    
7610

    
    

    
    ImGui::Begin("Same title as another window##2");

    


    

    
7611

    
    

    
    ImGui::Text("This is window 2.\nMy title is the same as window 1, but my identifier is unique.");

    


    

    
7612

    
    

    
    ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7613

    
    

    

    


    

    
7614

    
    

    
    // Using "###" to display a changing title but keep a static identifier "AnimatedTitle"

    


    

    
7615

    
    

    
    char buf[128];

    


    

    
7616

    
    

    
    sprintf(buf, "Animated title %c %d###AnimatedTitle", "|/-\\"[(int)(ImGui::GetTime() / 0.25f) & 3], ImGui::GetFrameCount());

    


    

    
7617

    
    

    
    ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(base_pos.x + 100, base_pos.y + 300), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);

    


    

    
7618

    
    

    
    ImGui::Begin(buf);

    


    

    
7619

    
    

    
    ImGui::Text("This window has a changing title.");

    


    

    
7620

    
    

    
    ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7621

    
    

    
}

    


    

    
7622

    
    

    

    


    

    
7623

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7624

    
    

    
// [SECTION] Example App: Custom Rendering using ImDrawList API / ShowExampleAppCustomRendering()

    


    

    
7625

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
7626

    
    

    

    


    

    
7627

    
    

    
// Demonstrate using the low-level ImDrawList to draw custom shapes.

    


    

    
7628

    
    

    
static void ShowExampleAppCustomRendering(bool* p_open)

    


    

    
7629

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
7630

    
    

    
    if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Custom rendering", p_open))

    


    

    
7631

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7632

    
    

    
        ImGui::End();

    


    

    
7633

    
    

    
        return;

    


    

    
7634

    
    

    
    }

    


    

    
7635

    
    

    
    IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Custom Rendering");

    


    

    
7636

    
    

    

    


    

    
7637

    
    

    
    // Tip: If you do a lot of custom rendering, you probably want to use your own geometrical types and benefit of

    


    

    
7638

    
    

    
    // overloaded operators, etc. Define IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA in imconfig.h to create implicit conversions between your

    


    

    
7639

    
    

    
    // types and ImVec2/ImVec4. Dear ImGui defines overloaded operators but they are internal to imgui.cpp and not

    


    

    
7640

    
    

    
    // exposed outside (to avoid messing with your types) In this example we are not using the maths operators!

    


    

    
7641

    
    

    

    


    

    
7642

    
    

    
    if (ImGui::BeginTabBar("##TabBar"))

    


    

    
7643

    
    

    
    {

    


    

    
7644

    
    

    
        if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Primitives"))

    


    

    
7645

    
    

    
        {

    


    

    
7646

    
    

    
            ImGui::PushItemWidth(-ImGui::GetFontSize() * 15);

    


    

    
7647

    
    

    
            ImDrawList* draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();

    


    

    
7648

    
    

    

    


    

    
7649

    
    

    
            // Draw gradients

    


    

    
7650

    
    

    
            // (note that those are currently exacerbating our sRGB/Linear issues)

    


    

    
7651

    
    

    
            // Calling ImGui::GetColorU32() multiplies the given colors by the current Style Alpha, but you may pass the IM_COL32() directly as well..

    


    

    
7652

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("Gradients");

    


    

    
7653

    
    

    
            ImVec2 gradient_size = ImVec2(ImGui::CalcItemWidth(), ImGui::GetFrameHeight());

    


    

    
7654

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
7655

    
    

    
                ImVec2 p0 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();

    


    

    
7656

    
    

    
                ImVec2 p1 = ImVec2(p0.x + gradient_size.x, p0.y + gradient_size.y);

    


    

    
7657

    
    

    
                ImU32 col_a = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, 255));

    


    

    
7658

    
    

    
                ImU32 col_b = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255));

    


    

    
7659

    
    

    
                draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(p0, p1, col_a, col_b, col_b, col_a);

    


    

    
7660

    
    

    
                ImGui::InvisibleButton("##gradient1", gradient_size);

    


    

    
7661

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
7662

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
7663

    
    

    
                ImVec2 p0 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();

    


    

    
7664

    
    

    
                ImVec2 p1 = ImVec2(p0.x + gradient_size.x, p0.y + gradient_size.y);

    


    

    
7665

    
    

    
                ImU32 col_a = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));

    


    

    
7666

    
    

    
                ImU32 col_b = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255));

    


    

    
7667

    
    

    
                draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(p0, p1, col_a, col_b, col_b, col_a);

    


    

    
7668

    
    

    
                ImGui::InvisibleButton("##gradient2", gradient_size);

    


    

    
7669

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
7670

    
    

    

    


    

    
7671

    
    

    
            // Draw a bunch of primitives

    


    

    
7672

    
    

    
            ImGui::Text("All primitives");

    


    

    
7673

    
    

    
            static float sz = 36.0f;

    


    

    
7674

    
    

    
            static float thickness = 3.0f;

    


    

    
7675

    
    

    
            static int ngon_sides = 6;

    


    

    
7676

    
    

    
            static bool circle_segments_override = false;

    


    

    
7677

    
    

    
            static int circle_segments_override_v = 12;

    


    

    
7678

    
    

    
            static bool curve_segments_override = false;

    


    

    
7679

    
    

    
            static int curve_segments_override_v = 8;

    


    

    
7680

    
    

    
            static ImVec4 colf = ImVec4(1.0f, 1.0f, 0.4f, 1.0f);

    


    

    
7681

    
    

    
            ImGui::DragFloat("Size", &sz, 0.2f, 2.0f, 100.0f, "%.0f");

    


    

    
7682

    
    

    
            ImGui::DragFloat("Thickness", &thickness, 0.05f, 1.0f, 8.0f, "%.02f");

    


    

    
7683

    
    

    
            ImGui::SliderInt("N-gon sides", &ngon_sides, 3, 12);

    


    

    
7684

    
    

    
            ImGui::Checkbox("##circlesegmentoverride", &circle_segments_override);

    


    

    
7685

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);

    


    

    
7686

    
    

    
            circle_segments_override |= ImGui::SliderInt("Circle segments override", &circle_segments_override_v, 3, 40);

    


    

    
7687

    
    

    
            ImGui::Checkbox("##curvessegmentoverride", &curve_segments_override);

    


    

    
7688

    
    

    
            ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);

    


    

    
7689

    
    

    
            curve_segments_override |= ImGui::SliderInt("Curves segments override", &curve_segments_override_v, 3, 40);

    


    

    
7690

    
    

    
            ImGui::ColorEdit4("Color", &colf.x);

    


    

    
7691

    
    

    

    


    

    
7692

    
    

    
            const ImVec2 p = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();

    


    

    
7693

    
    

    
            const ImU32 col = ImColor(colf);

    


    

    
7694

    
    

    
            const float spacing = 10.0f;

    


    

    
7695

    
    

    
            const ImDrawFlags corners_tl_br = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight;

    


    

    
7696

    
    

    
            const float rounding = sz / 5.0f;

    


    

    
7697

    
    

    
            const int circle_segments = circle_segments_override ? circle_segments_override_v : 0;

    


    

    
7698

    
    

    
            const int curve_segments = curve_segments_override ? curve_segments_override_v : 0;

    


    

    
7699

    
    

    
            float x = p.x + 4.0f;

    


    

    
7700

    
    

    
            float y = p.y + 4.0f;

    


    

    
7701

    
    

    
            for (int n = 0; n < 2; n++)

    


    

    
7702

    
    

    
            {

    


    

    
7703

    
    

    
                // First line uses a thickness of 1.0f, second line uses the configurable thickness

    


    

    
7704

    
    

    
                float th = (n == 0) ? 1.0f : thickness;

    


    

    
7705

    
    

    
                draw_list->AddNgon(ImVec2(x + sz*0.5f, y + sz*0.5f), sz*0.5f, col, ngon_sides, th);                 x += sz + spacing;  // N-gon

    


    

    
7706

    
    

    
                draw_list->AddCircle(ImVec2(x + sz*0.5f, y + sz*0.5f), sz*0.5f, col, circle_segments, th);          x += sz + spacing;  // Circle

    


    

    
7707

    
    

    
                draw_list->AddRect(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, 0.0f, ImDrawFlags_None, th);          x += sz + spacing;  // Square

    


    

    
7708

    
    

    
                draw_list->AddRect(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, rounding, ImDrawFlags_None, th);      x += sz + spacing;  // Square with all rounded corners

    


    

    
7709

    
    

    
                draw_list->AddRect(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, rounding, corners_tl_br, th);         x += sz + spacing;  // Square with two rounded corners

    


    

    
7710

    
    

    
                draw_list->AddTriangle(ImVec2(x+sz*0.5f,y), ImVec2(x+sz, y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x, y+sz-0.5f), col, th);x += sz + spacing;  // Triangle

    


    

    
7711

    
    

    
                //draw_list->AddTriangle(ImVec2(x+sz*0.2f,y), ImVec2(x, y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x+sz*0.4f, y+sz-0.5f), col, th);x+= sz*0.4f + spacing; // Thin triangle

    


    

    
7712

    
    

    
                draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y), col, th);                                       x += sz + spacing;  // Horizontal line (note: drawing a filled rectangle will be faster!)

    


    

    
7713

    
    

    
                draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x, y + sz), col, th);                                       x += spacing;       // Vertical line (note: drawing a filled rectangle will be faster!)

    


    

    
7714

    
    

    
                draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, th);                                  x += sz + spacing;  // Diagonal line

    


    

    
7715

    
    

    

    


    

    
7716

    
    

    
                // Quadratic Bezier Curve (3 control points)

    


    

    
7717

    
    

    
                ImVec2 cp3[3] = { ImVec2(x, y + sz * 0.6f), ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y - sz * 0.4f), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz) };

    


    

    
7718

    
    

    
                draw_list->AddBezierQuadratic(cp3[0], cp3[1], cp3[2], col, th, curve_segments); x += sz + spacing;

    


    

    
7719

    
    

    

    


    

    
7720

    
    

    
                // Cubic Bezier Curve (4 control points)

    


    

    
7721

    
    

    
                ImVec2 cp4[4] = { ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz * 1.3f, y + sz * 0.3f), ImVec2(x + sz - sz * 1.3f, y + sz - sz * 0.3f), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz) };

    


    

    
7722

    
    

    
                draw_list->AddBezierCubic(cp4[0], cp4[1], cp4[2], cp4[3], col, th, curve_segments);

    


    

    
7723

    
    

    

    


    

    
7724

    
    

    
                x = p.x + 4;

    


    

    
7725

    
    

    
                y += sz + spacing;

    


    

    
7726

    
    

    
            }

    


    

    
7727

    
    

    
            draw_list->AddNgonFilled(ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y + sz * 0.5f), sz*0.5f, col, ngon_sides);               x += sz + spacing;  // N-gon

    


    

    
7728

    
    

    
            draw_list->AddCircleFilled(ImVec2(x + sz*0.5f, y + sz*0.5f), sz*0.5f, col, circle_segments);            x += sz + spacing;  // Circle

    


    

    
7729

    
    

    
            draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col);                                    x += sz + spacing;  // Square

    


    

    
7730

    
    

    
            draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, 10.0f);                             x += sz + spacing;  // Square with all rounded corners

    


    

    
7731

    
    

    
            draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, 10.0f, corners_tl_br);              x += sz + spacing;  // Square with two rounded corners

    


    

    
7732

    
    

    
            draw_list->AddTriangleFilled(ImVec2(x+sz*0.5f,y), ImVec2(x+sz, y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x, y+sz-0.5f), col);  x += sz + spacing;  // Triangle

    


    

    
7733

    
    

    
            //draw_list->AddTriangleFilled(ImVec2(x+sz*0.2f,y), ImVec2(x, y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x+sz*0.4f, y+sz-0.5f), col); x += sz*0.4f + spacing; // Thin triangle

    


    

    
7734

    
    

    
            draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + thickness), col);                             x += sz + spacing;  // Horizontal line (faster than AddLine, but only handle integer thickness)

    


    

    
7735

    
    

    
            draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + thickness, y + sz), col);                             x += spacing * 2.0f;// Vertical line (faster than AddLine, but only handle integer thickness)

    


    

    
7736

    
    

    
            draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + 1, y + 1), col);                                      x += sz;            // Pixel (faster than AddLine)

    


    

    
7737
